loans.use: la compra de pollos, como tambien comprar madera y pinturas para su carpinteria.

loans.name: Evgeniya

texts.en:
Evgeniya is married with one son. She sells women’s purses and tights at the city market in Novaya Kahovka. Evgeniya has been in this business for six years and her current monthly profit is 5,000 UAH. 

Evgeniya is requesting a loan of 12,200 UAH to further develop her business and increase the assortment of her inventory. She hopes to use her increased income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 50-year-old married man living with his wife and four school-age children.  Twenty years ago, he got the idea of starting a new business regarding the needs of his town. He bought an electric generator to provide electricity to the region. He is the only one who distributes electricity in his town. Because of his old age, his young children help him from time to time to keep the family at a good financial stage. 
 
Today, his is requesting to borrow $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to make the needed repairs on his generator so he can grant his clients non-stoppable electricity.

loans.use: To make the needed repairs on his generator

loans.name: Susa

texts.en:
Susa R. is from the village of National Highway, Gingoog City. She is 50 years old. Susa is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Susa owns & operates a business venture in the services sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing photography services, printing of documents, book binding & encoding to local community members. Susa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Susa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Susa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 27000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase an additional printer & working capital. Susa is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service, and tools for maintenance. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Susa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service, and tools for maintenance

location.town: National Highway, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Tak's Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of sixteE. members. They are located in Sdau Kanlaeng village in Kandal province.
 
Mrs. Tak K. was born in 1947, and she is the village bank president who was selected by the other members. She earns her living by selling groceries in the local village. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it. So she would like to ask for a loan to buy more groceries to support her current business. 

Mrs. Tak K. is a widow with three childrE. who are all furniture makers.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to support her business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is from the village of Dalirig, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Evelyn owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing and shoes from NATASHA and AVON in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2011, Evelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beauty or cosmetic products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Evelyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mairamkul's Group

texts.en: Mairamkul S. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Kochkor, a nice village in Isykul region. She is 40 and married. Together with her husband, she is bringing up a son and two daughters. The son and the first daughter are at school and the second daughter is not yet in school as she is preschool age (under seven). In order to earn money, Mairamkul breeds cattle and she also cultivates agricultural products such as wheat and clover. She applied for the loan because she needs money to purchase more cattle for breeding. In the future she wants to finish their house construction. -====================================== --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios G. is from the village of Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 60 years old and married with 11 adult children. To make a living, Remedios makes and sells snacks and other delicacies. She has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month.

In 2011, Remedios joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Remedios from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Lindaura

texts.es: Lindaura tiene 36 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Vive junto a su familia en casa propia dentro del distrito de Chiclayo en un vecindario humilde. Su comunidad es urbana y está en vías de crecimiento. Desde hace 2 años, se dedica a la venta de panca, la hoja que cubre choclo, por las mañanas todos los días dentro de su misma comunidad. Durante las tardes, ella brinda servicios de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Con estas actividades, puede ayudar a su esposo solventar los gastos familiares. Con parte de su préstamo desea aumentar sus ventas de panca con la compra de más mercadería. Pretende usar la otra parte para hacer arreglar y mantener su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Lindaura, 36, is married and has two minor children.  She lives with her family in her own house in Chiclayo District in a very humble neighborhood.  Her community is urban and undergoing growth.  For the last two years she’s been selling “panca,” corn husks, every day during the morning in her own community.  During the afternoon she provides public transportation services with her mototaxi, a vehicle that consists of a motorcycle with an attached cabin used to move people from place to place.  With these activities she’s able to help her husband cover family expenses.

She will use part of the loan to increase her corn husk sales with the purchase of more merchandise.  She also needs to maintain her vehicle in good working order to continue providing good customer service.  Because of this, she has deemed it proper to request a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to repair her mototaxi and to buy more corn husks to sell.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia A. is from the village of Kimagting, Ninoy Aquino, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 60 years old, married and has one adult child. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a business providing videoke, karaoke and computer games services for local community members. Virginia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2009, Virginia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide her service. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of the service. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Virginia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools needed for the maintenance of her service

loans.name: Mercedes Violeta

texts.es:
En el sitio la pila del cantón Montecristi se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal  La Pila. Este lugar es muy conocido en la provincia y en el país por su rica cultura tradicional, en este lugar se puede encontrar una gran variedad de  artesanía que son elaboradas por sus habitantes siguiendo las costumbres tradicionales.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, todos sus hijos aun vive con ella con sus respectivas familias. Su esposo es chofer.

Ella se dedica al comercio, compra y vende adornos y cerámicas,  tiene un  local en su casa en el cual vende todo tipo de artesanía, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 17h00, nos cuenta que  lo que más vende son los centros de mesa y adornos para el hogar.  Lleva 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien. Sus productos compran a artesanos de la zona pero semi terminados, luego ella les da el toque final para que estén listos para la venta.

Este crédito es para comprar más artesanía de todas las formas y modelos para surtir su negocio. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace cinco años  y le gusta porque estos créditos le han permitido cada ir creciendo y surtiendo más su local.
 
Su sueño es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
In La Pila in the Montecristi canton the La Pila community bank meets every two weeks. This place is very well known in the province and the country for its rich cultural tradition. In this place a large variety of artisanal craft can be found, made by its inhabitants who follow traditional customs.

Here we meet Mercedes. She is 50 years old, married and has four grown children. All of her children live with her in their respective families. Her husband is a driver.  

She works as a merchant. She buys and sells ornaments and ceramics. She has a locale in her house where she sells all types of artisanal crafts. She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. She tells us that what sells the most are centerpieces and ornaments for the home. She has been doing this activity for 10 years and it has gone very well for her. She buys her products from artisans in the area, but she buys them half-finished. Later, she gives them the final touch so that they are ready for sale.    

This loan is to buy more artisanal crafts of all types and designs to supply her business. She has been in the community bank for five years and she likes it because the loans have allowed her to grow and supply her locale.
 
Her dream is to keep growing with her business.

loans.use: to buy all types of artisanal crafts.

loans.name: Olimsho

texts.ru: Олимшо проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он живет вместе с родителями. Его жена домохозяйка. Уже три года как он работает таксистом. Он развозит людей по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе - Вахдат. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины, чтобы предоставить безопасную услугу.
texts.en: Olimsho lives in Vahdat. He is 27 years old, married, and has two children. He lives with his parents. His wife is a housewife. He has worked as a taxi driver for three years. He drives people on a route between Vahdat and Dushanbe. He is taking out a loan to repair his car so that he can render his service safely.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Anastacio

texts.es:
Anastasio, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, es soltero,  vive con su abuela, el  trabajo agrícola lo realiza desde hace treinta años, con un horario de 5:00am a 11:00am, este oficio lo aprendió de su padre, este trabajo tiene una desventaja, y es que su producción depende de las condiciones del clima.
El solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en los insumos agrícolas y pago de jornaleros para la siembra, con este préstamo él podrá, iniciar la siembra, tener los materiales necesarios para el cuido y tener la oportunidad obtener buena cosecha, después de recoger la cosecha llena los graneros y vende parte de esta.
Su objetivo es  obtener la seguridad alimentaria para él y su abuela y puedan vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Anastasio works cultivating basic grains.  He is single and lives with his grandmother. He has worked in agriculture for 30 years with a schedule of working from 5:00am to 11:00am. He learned this trade from his father.  The downside of this work is that the production is dependent on weather conditions. 

He is requesting a loan to invest in agricultural inputs and payment of laborers for planting.  With this loan he will be able to start planting, have the materials needed for the care, the opportunity to get good harvest, and after the harvest fills the granaries he can sell part of it.

His goal is to obtain food security for himself and his grandmother and to live better.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and pay laborers.

loans.name: Rukaya

texts.en: Rukaya sells rubber slippers, sandals and shoes in Abura. She has received junior high school education. She is single and pays for her accommodation and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more sandals for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards her marriage.

loans.use: to buy more sandals for sale.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SUMAC  AYLLU”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 29 años de edad, el socio es soltero, El socio se dedica a la construcción el socio desea invertir en la compra de maquinaria para su trabajo, el socio compraría también una mezcladora y motocierra con el crédito que le otorgaran, el socio desea trabaja con obras y presta sus servicios a las diferentes empresas que están en el rubro de la construcción. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de maquinarias. 

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "SUMAC AYLLU" which is located in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

He is 29, single, and in the construction business.  With the loan he is requesting, he wants to buy machinery for his work, as well as a mixer and motorsaw.  His wish is to work at construction sites and lend his services to different companies in the construction sector.  

He is grateful for the support and committed to paying the loan back on time.

loans.use: To buy machinery.

loans.name: Rui

texts.pt:
Nasceu no Distrito de Namacura provincia de Zambezia ao norte de Mocambique viuvo e pai de 3 filhos de idades entre 2 a 13 anos de idade.Fez a 9ª classe e continua a estudar. vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta um sobrinho que vive com ela.
Saiu de Zambezia para Maputo devido o serviço militar obrigatorio, e segurança da G4S a 12 anos e tem um rendimento mensal de 2.350.00mt que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca fez emprestimo noutros bancos.Conheceu Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem são clientes e este e o seu quinto emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 11.100.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material para a sua obra construcao de uma casa, ou seja, moradia (chapas, areia, cimento, ferro, e outros ),os primeiros  emprestimos  foram de: 8.000.00mt, 10.500.00mt, 12.000.00mt, e 15.000.00mt.
Sonha em ampliar a sua casa,mobiliar para oferecer melhor conforto a sua familia e para tal tenciona solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Rui was born in Namacura District, Zambezia Province in northern Mozambique. He is widowed and has three children between the ages of 2 and 13. Rui finished ninth grade and still studies. He lives in his own house with his family and supports a nephew who lives with him.

Rui left Zambezia to go to Maputo because of his obligatory military service. For 12 years he has been a security guard with G4S and has a monthly income of 2,350 meticais. He uses the money for household expenses and saves some in his bank account (at BIM).

Rui has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through neighbors who are also customers. This is his fifth loan from Hluvuku. He is asking for 11,100 meticais to buy building materials (zinc sheets, sand, cement, iron and other items) for his housing project. The earlier loans were for 8,000 meticais, 10,500 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais.

He dreams of expanding his house and furnishing it to make his family more comfortable. To do so he intends to ask Hluvuku for more loans.

loans.use: to buy building materials (zinc sheets, sand, cement, iron, etc.).

loans.name: Digna Gloris

texts.es:
Digna, vive con su madre, una hija y una nieta D. 13 años D. edad, ella trabaja en la elaboración y venta D. loza, aprendió el negocio D. su madre, quien desD. muy joven le enseño el trabajo con el barro, su horario es D. 8:00am a 4:00pm, su dificultad es en ocasiones cuando se queda sin material y sin dinero para poder comprarlo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra D. barro, nacazcol y leña, estos materiales son los que necesita para la fabricación D. comales y ollas, con la oportunidad D. aumentar la producción y las ventas.
Ella durante años con mucho esfuerzo a sacado adelante a su familia, quienes hoy en día se encuentran en una condición estable con el trabajo D. artesanías.
texts.en:
Digna lives with her mother, daughter, and 13-year old granddaughter. She works making and selling cookware. She learned this business from her mother, who taught her how to work with clay from a very young age. She works from 8:00 am until 4:00 pm. The difficult part of this business is when she sometimes does not have the supplies she needs nor the money to buy them.

She is asking for a loan to buy clay, nacazcol, and firewood. She needs these materials to make comales (skillets for making tortillas) and pots and in this way she can make more and increase sales. Through the years, and with a lot of work, she has been able to help her family get ahead. Today their economic condition is stable thanks to her work in handicrafts.

loans.use: buy clay, nacazcol and firewood to make comales and clay pots

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 28-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and one young child. He has more than 10 years of experience working as an aluminum laborer. And in 2007, he opened his own shop. He cooperates financially with his wife who works as a teacher in a local school to satisfy the family needs. Today, he is asking to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase aluminum needed for his business. Earning a higher income is a must for Abdallah at this stage, since his daughter will enter school in about a year. He should make the needed savings to be able to pay his child's education fees to avoid having any financial problems with the school management.

loans.use: to purchase aluminum needed for his business

loans.name: Edis

texts.es: Edis tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en una casa alquilada. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de jugos de frutas, en un pequeño puesto en la calle, para ello cuenta con un stand rustico móvil, para poder trasladarse a diversos puntos de su localidad. Esta actividad lo viene realizando hace 5 años y en ella encontró estabilidad económica. Asimismo menciona que dentro de este negocio también ofrece bebidas calientes como café  o mates que son del agrado de su público consumidor. Ella considera que este trabajo  es rentable es por esta razón que se ha mantenido durante este tiempo con la mentalidad de mejorar y ampliar su negocio y al fin encontrar un lugar done establecerse. Es la segunda oportunidad que solicita un crédito con MFP. Cuando tuvo su  primer ciclo de préstamo de manera grupal ha demostrado la puntualidad de sus pagos  y se ha ganado la confianza de los demás integrantes de su grupo solidario. En esta ocasión, con el dinero que solicita,  podrá comprar insumos y productos para no dejar de vender jugos y mates calientes.
texts.en:
Edis is 33 years old; she lives with her husband and two children in a rented home.  

The business she works in is selling fruit juice from a small stand in the street.  She has a rustic mobile cart, so as to be able to transport it to different parts of the area.  She has been doing this for five years, and through it she has achieved financial stability.  She also mentions that within this business she also offers hot drinks such as coffee or mate (a traditional drink), which are pleasing to the consuming public.  She considers this work to be profitable, and it is for this reason that she has continued with it for this period of time, with the thought of improving and growing her business, and ultimately finding a location where she can set herself up.  

This is her second opportunity to request a loan through MFP.  When she took part in her first lending cycle as part of the group, she demonstrated punctuality in her repayments, and she has earned the trust of the other members of the solidarity group.  On this occasion, with the money that she is requesting, she will buy ingredients and products so as not to stop selling juices and hot mates.

loans.use: to buy fruits and ingredients.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en:
Mercedes is 53 years old. She has a mini restaurant in the market place. She has been administering her business for 20 years and earns an average of 5,000 every month. The existing competitors are the undermining of her income per month. Thus, she goes over the flow and competes to earn a higher income.

She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000 as additional working capital to buy vegetables and meat to cook. She wants to offer a variety of foods and viands in order to attract more customers. Through this, Mercedes can earn greater net sales per month that can be used for the education of her youngest child who is still pursuing an education.

She hopes for further development of her business and their living conditions to experience a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables and meat to cook

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo de 51 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios bàsicos, ubicada en la zona rural del departamento de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Los pobladores de ésta zona se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y artesanìa.

Wilfredo brinda el servicio de transporte en su propia moto lineal desde hace algunos años aproximadamente, está actividad lo realiza a los diferentes caserios de donde vive, el trata en lo posible desde muy temprano movilizar una buena cantidad de personas a sus diferentes destinos, y así obtenga mayores ingresos para solventar sus gastos y necesidades familiares.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 1000 nuevos soles y su destino será para brindar mantenimiento de su moto lineal, ya que a estado presentando algunas fallas y asì puede seguir brindando un buen servicio a su clientela y mejorar la calidad de vida familia.  Wilfredo es una persona responsable, trabajador y un buen padre que siempre está tratando de que su familia salga adelante.
texts.en:
Wilfredo, 51, lives with his wife and child in his own home.  His house lacks basic utilities, and is located in a rural area of Tambogrande, which is in the department of Piura.  The residents of this area work in agriculture, livestock and handicrafts.

Wilfredo has been providing transportation services using his own motorcycle for a few years.  He carries out this activity in different settlements near his home.  He tries as much as possible to start moving a good quantity of people to their destinations from very early in the morning, so that in this way he can have a higher income to cover his expenses and the necessities for his family.

He has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa that he will use to do maintenance work on his motorcycle, since he's having some mechanical problems with it. This way he can continue to provide good service to his customers, and improve the quality of life for his family.  Wilfredo is a responsible and hardworking person, and he is a good father who is always trying to provide well for his family.

loans.use: to do maintenance work on his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Del Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y tiene un niño de 7 años de edad el cual estudia la primaria, ella tiene una tienda de regalos asociada con su hermana desde hace un poco mas de un año, dice que comenzó vendiendo ropa de segunda mano, después ella le siguieron invirtiendo en peluches, después en bolsas de regalo y poco a poco  las dos han surtido bolsas para dama, carteras y un poco de bisutería. Dice que comenzaron el negocio por que las dos se habían quedado sin trabajo y tenían ropa que ya no usaban y se pusieron a venderla y poco a poco ganaron clientas. Ellas surten sus artículos en la capital del país, y están pidiendo que la financiera le haga un crédito con el cual pueda hacer crecer su negocio ella comprara, bolsas de regalo, listones, papel para envolver regalos, pegamento, peluches, globos etc. Lulu como de cariño le dicen esta muy contenta por que gracias al crédito su negocio estará mejor surtido y tendrá mas ganancias.
texts.en:
Lourdes, age 26, is married and has a seven year old child who goes to elementary school.  She and her sister have had a gift shop for a little over a year.  She says she started selling second-hand clothes.  Later she invested in stuffed animals, and after that she invested in gift bags. 

Little by little the two of them have stocked women’s handbags, wallets, and a bit of costume jewelry.  She says that they started the business because they were both out of work.  They had clothes that they no longer used, and they put them up for sale.  They slowly gained customers.  They stock their items in the capital of the country.

They are requesting the loan to be able to make their business grow.  She will buy gift bags, ribbon, wrapping paper, glue, stuffed animals, and balloons, etc.  Lulu, as she is affectionately called, is very happy.  Thanks to the loan her business will be better stocked and will have increased earnings.

loans.use: to buy gift bags, ribbon, wrapping paper, glue, stuffed animals, and balloons, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 8 años.
Nelly tiene un cafetín en en Colegio, recuerda con mucha nostalgia que antes vendía en la puerta del colegio y su primer préstamo lo utilizó para poder comprar golosinas para poder vender claro que era muy poco, y así pudo progresar, ahora esta en cafetín del colegio, le encanta las capacitaciones porque le ayudan a mejorar su vida y su negocio, ahora lo préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de aceite, arroz y golosinas, su meta es seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Nelly is a member of the “Florecer” (To Flourish) communal bank.  She is 33 years old, and she has two children.  She has been a member of FINCA Peru for eight years.

Nelly has a snack stand at a school.  She nostalgically remembers when she sold at the door to the school.  She used her first loan to buy sweets to be able to sell.  Cleary, it was very little.  She was able to progress that way, and now she has a snack stand at the school. 

She loves the trainings because they help her to improve her life and her business.  She will now use the loan to buy oil, rice, and sweets.  Her goal is to continue progressing.

loans.use: to buy oil, rice, and sweets.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a 33-year-old married woman. She has six children – one boy and five girls, with ages ranging from 7 months to 15 years. Four of them are currently enrolled in school. Mwanajuma operates a food kiosk and sells her goods from home. She's worked in this business for 13 years and was previously employed as a farmer. Her primary customers are neighbors and local residents. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest business challenge to be competition and her highest monthly expenses are school fees, food, and clothing. 

Mwanajuma will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil. Mwanajuma aspires to open another grocery business in the future. She joined Yehu to access working capital and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil.

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita is 53 years old and lives in Ibabao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married/single and has no children. 

Conchita has a fish vending business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of work. She has a requested a loan  of 25,000 to purchase more fish to sell. 

Conchita has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Conchita hopes to have a fishing boat and wants to improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is an electrician, while his wife, Vanna is a garment worker.  They live in a village outside Phnom Penh City. They have only been married since 2011 and have no child yet. 
 
Chantha is asking for his first loan of $800 to buy a motorbike to get to work because he commutes to work by taking a taxi often. Taking a taxi to work is expensive for the family.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to get work.

loans.name: Euy

texts.en: Euy, 27, is married and resides with her husband in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. She is farmer, and her husband is a blacksmith. Euy is requesting a loan of USD 800 to purchase cows to raise and sell. This will be her first loan from KREDIT, a longstanding Kiva partner.

loans.use: to purchase cows to raise and sell

loans.name: Tuavao

texts.en:
Tuavao is 48 years old and married with 5 children.

Tuavao owns and operates a business venture planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Tuavao needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 550 talas or US $229 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Tuavao joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Tuavao's first loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers. Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About  SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive, and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on Kiva to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed killers, such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you Joseph, a small scale entrepreneur who has come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000.00 in order to invest in his business. 

Joseph sells spare-parts like tires, spanners, chains, belts, sockets, etc. He has been doing this business for six years now in the township of Magburaka, in Northern Sierra Leone. A husband and a father of five school going children, the forty-year-old was born in Mayagba village. He has requested this loan in order to buy a large quantity of spare parts to add to his shop.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of spare parts to add to his shop

loans.name: Alfreda's Group

texts.en:
Alfreda is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home. She has given birth to 2 daughters who have studied till 10th level. She also supports her husband who is an animal seller. He purchases goats and sheep at their younger age, grows them up and sells at a profit to butchers. Alfreda, in her spare time, gives food to the animals and keeps their living place clean.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for further expansion of her brother’s business, who is also an animal seller. With the loan investment, he will buy goats and sheep in larger numbers that will allow him to earn more profits after selling to butchers and on EID (a holiday in Pakistan). He has been operating his business for the past many years, and Alfreda is confident that an investment will be more profitable for him.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Alfreda.

loans.use: To buy goats and sheep for the animal selling business.

loans.name: Maria Carmelina

texts.es:
María es una mujer soltera, tiene dos hijos y viven en Otavalo, Provincia de Imbabura, en la sierra norte de Ecuador. María es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora, le gusta salir adelante para el bienestar de su familia.

María trabaja 10 años en un puesto de venta de artesanías, es el séptimo año consecutivo que trabaja con Fodemi, el crédito que realiza actualmente es para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar las artesanías como mullos, perlas de plástico, masa pan, pintura y también invertirá en la compra de ropa artesanal ya que desea entrar en el negocio de ropa. Esta inversión ayudará a María a obtener mejores ingresos con los cuales podrá mantener a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.

El sueño de María es poder tener un local propio para sus artesanías ya que tiene buena clientela y quiere servirles mejor.
texts.en:
María is a single mother of two children. They live in Otavalo, located in Imbabura, a province in the mountains of northern Ecuador. María is a very simple and hardworking woman, who likes working for the wellbeing of her family.

María has been working for 10 years in stall selling handicrafts. This is the seventh consequent year she has been working with Fodemi, and the loan she is currently requesting will be used to buy materials to create handicrafts such as beads, plastic pearls and paint, as well as to invest it in the purchase of handmade traditional clothing because she wants to engage in the clothes selling activity. This investment will help María earning a better income with which she will be able to provide for her family and improve their standard of living.

María wishes to run a place of her own where to sell her handicrafts, as she can count of well-established customers and she wants to tend to them in a better way.

loans.use: To buy materials to create handicrafts such as beads, plastic pearls and paint, as well as to invest it in the purchase of handmade traditional clothing to engage in the clothes selling activity.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es: Marta tiene 30 años de edad, y vive con su compañero de vida y su hija de 2 años de edad, a la que está sacando adelante con mucho esfuerzo. Ella se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos, desde hace 5 años, lo que le permite sacar adelante a su familia. Marta desea construir una pila y colocar láminas para mejorar su calidad de vida y para ello solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y lámina para construir una pila y colocar láminas en su vivienda, y de esta manera contar con un lugar adecuado para resguardar el agua de uso diario.
texts.en:
Marta is 30-years old. She lives with her husband and their 2-year old daughter, who Marta is getting ahead with a lot of hard work. Marta has made her living for the last five years offering her services as a maid, which allows her to get her family ahead.
Marta wants to build a basin and add sheet metal so she can improve her quality of life. That is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will use the loan to purchase cement, sand, gravel, brick and sheet metal so she can build a basin and add sheet metal to her house. Then she will have a decent place to store the day's water.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, gravel, bricks and sheet metal to build a basin and add sheet metal to her house.

loans.name: Marus

texts.en: Marus is happy of her successful Kiva deal in 2013 and she is very hopeful to manage her second Kiva partnership. She lives in Ijevan city of Tavush region with her son’s family. Many years Marus worked at the kinder garden and she mentions that the years she worked with children was of great pleasure for her. But already 15 years she is engaged in clothes trading business now already in her small shop. Here she sells men’s and women's clothes that she imports from Yerevan city’s wholesale market. Marus mentions that her trading business is of great importance for her family since thanks to its income she already managed to cover a lot of need of her family (she repaired the flat, bought furniture and etc.) and she is sure that with her second deal with Kiva she will manage more. Marus asks this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams as she plans to enlarge and renew the assortment of her winter season clothes with new more fashionable models.

loans.use: to enlarge and renew the assortment of her winter season clothes with new more fashionable models

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase on stock of Timber.

loans.name: Vakil

texts.en:
58-year-old Vakil with his 2 children settled in Sumgait city. He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fizuli region. Since 2001 he has been engaged in meat sales to improve his family’s living condition. As he did not have enough funds, he could not develop his business well enough in the beginning. Having borrowed first loans of amount $400 he significantly expanded his business, bought 2 calves. The loans were paid back timely.
Now Vakil applies for the loan $700 to buy 3 calves and to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy 3 calves and to expand his business

loans.name: Lolofa

texts.en: Lolofa K. is 44-years old and has four children who live with her in the small Samoan village of Vaiee.  Lolofa  is grateful for the weaving talent that she has.  She has used previous SPBD loans to leverage this talent to provide for her family.  With very hard work, she can weave up to 10 fine mats per day that will sell for a total of ST 250 (approximately USD 100).  Her mats are well known and villagers come to her and place advance orders for special occasions.  With a thriving business and a history of repaying past loans in full and on time, Lolofa now qualifies for a home improvement loan.  Providing funds to Lolofa will help her make some basic improvements to her family home’s roof and floor.  Lolofa’s home also doubles as her workshop, and so a loan to Lolofa will help ensure that she can keep her raw materials and finished mats safe, clean and dry.

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Seran

texts.en: B. Seran lives in Saatli, Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children. He started his small business in 1999, when he purchased one milk cow. Now he is going to enlarge his farm and buy one milk cow. He applied for $900 to Aqroinvest CU to realize his idea.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow

loans.name: Iliana

texts.es:
Business Description

Iliana has sold chickens and clothes for one year. She buys chickens on foot from different aviaries in the town in order to later sell them in local shops. She also sells children’s clothes, blouses etc. She began the business using a little money which her husband gave her from the salary he earns. She works at her business every day from 7am to 5pm.

Loan Use

Iliana wants a loan in order to buy clothes: she already has orders from clients and as a result wishes to invest in this line and satisfy the demand of the customers she already has.

Personal Information

Iliana is 22 years old: she is married and has two young children, one of whom is in school. Her husband works as a messenger in a business where he receives a monthly income that allows him to meet their household bills: he is excellent source of support for his wife. They currently live in her father’s house, who gave her part of the house as an inheritance. She hopes to expand her business so that in time with the income they will be able to build their house little by little and secure a better future for their children.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Descripción del Negocio

Iliana lleva 1 año dedicada a la venta de pollos y ropa, ella compra el pollo en pie en diferentes avícolas de la ciudad para posteriormente venderlos en las tiendas del sector. Además vende ropa de niños, blusas etc. Ella inicio el negocio con un dinerito que su esposo le dio del sueldo que el gana. Su negocio lo atiende todos los días de 7:00am hasta las 17:00pm.

Uso del Préstamo

Iliana desea el crédito para comprar ropa, ya que tiene pedidos de sus clientes por ello desea invertir en esta línea y poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que tiene ahora.

Información Personal

Iliana tiene 22 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de los cuales uno esta en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja como mensajero en una empresa donde percibe un ingreso mensual que le permitir solventar los gastos de su hogar. El es un soporte muy bueno para su esposa. Actualmente viven en casa de su papá que le dio como herencia una parte de la casa. Ella aspira crecer su negocio y a su vez con sus ganancias ir construyendo poco a poco su casa y brindarles un mejor futuro para sus hijos.

loans.use: To expand her clothes-selling business

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sibu

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sibu is already 50 years old, but she is still working diligently to help her husband who works as a farmer. With Rp. 800,000 (about $87) of capital, Sibu bought a female pig. Sibu spends Rp. 10,000 (about $1) for the pigs’ food every day. She gains Rp. 400,000 (about $43.5) profit per 6 months from selling the 5 piglets. She uses the profit to cover the family expenses and her children’s education fee. She has 2 children. The first child is already graduated. The other one is studying in high school. The loan from Dinari will be used to purchase the pig’s food. She hopes that the business goes well and her family has better quality of life.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Sibu meskipun sudah berumur 50 tahun, namun tetap rajin bekerja, untuk membantu suaminya yang bekerja sebagai petani. Dengan modal Rp.800.000,- Sibu membeli 1 ekor induk babi. Setiap harinya Sibu mengeluarkan biaya pakan Rp. 10.000,- untuk babinya. Dari hasil beternak babinya ini setiap 6 bulan sekali Sibu memperoleh keuntungan Rp.400.000,- dari hasil penjualan 5 ekor anak babinya. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya dan biaya sekolah anaknya. Sibu mempunyai 2 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah tamat sekolah. Sedangkan yang kedua masih bersekolah SMA. Pinjaman dari Dinari dipakai untuk membeli pakan ternaknya. Rumahnya dibangun ditanah sendiri dan bangunannya cukup sederhana. Harapan Sibu usahanya lebih meningkat dan kesejahteraan keluarganya menjadi lebih baik.

loans.use: To purchase pig's food

loans.name: Savy

texts.en:
Mrs. Savy H. is a widow with two sons. She learned to weave silk from her neighbor back in 1987 and began her silk production in the same year. She has never attended school. However, she is trying to work hard and sending her eldest son to attend school in the village and her youngest son is in the kindergarten in the same village.

Mrs. Savy H. is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time in the amount of US$ 400. She will use this loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, and to pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the looms

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in more ingredients and utensils for her business

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Pendo J.. She is married with three children, aged 8, 10, and 12. In 2007, Pendo established a poultry business, and now requires a loan of $350 in order to purchase more chicks to raise and sell. She thanks you for your support.

Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients. Kuku means chickens in Swahili, and raising them for sale is popular for a number of reasons. First, they require little start-up capital; you can start with one or two and either add to them as you go or wait for them to multiple naturally! Second, they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. Third, while they are growing they produce eggs, which can either be sold to provide a supplementary source of income, or eaten to provide a supplementary source of protein.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks to raise and sell.

loans.name: Ehson

texts.en:
K. Ehson is 38 years old. He is married with three children of school age.

Ehson has been in the business of growing and selling a variety of flowers for 13 years.  The trading place is located in the center of the city, and as a rule he works from early morning till late night. Polite and friendly with his clients, Ehson has developed a stable business generating significant income for the family. 

In order to purchase a greater variety of flowers to sell, Ehson is requesting a loan of $750.00 for the term of 10 months. He has been a client of IMON for several years and has a positive credit history. He promises to be timely in repaying the loan

loans.use: To purchase a variety of flowers to sell.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Mr. Abdulai T. sells second hand clothing in Makeni town. With previous loans from SMT, he diversified the business - he now sells both adult and children’s clothes.

Abdulai’s business is the main source of income for his family, including eight children and other extended family members in his care. He has requested this loan so that he can increase his inventory and involve his wife in the management of the business.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Rose's Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Rose is 27 years old and is married. Rose owns a small shop and she is a clothes seller, which she started in 2005. Every day she works from 8am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Halima and Mwanaid, who have businesses dealing in clothes sales and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Asif

texts.en: Asif  A. was born in 1955. He started his business ten years ago. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region in the village of Kurdmahmudlu.  He is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of $975 to buy goods to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy goods

loans.name: Toribia

texts.es:
Ms. Toribia P. is 48 and has 6 children (4 sons and 2 daughters). She has completed her primary education, speaks Aymara and Spanish and is the head of the household as she does not live with her husband. She lives on Avenida Sol, in the Yunguyo district and province.

She sells food at the 15 de Agosto market in Yunguyo, her stand is No. G31. Also, from July to November she sells soft drinks, a business she started as a result of the trouble she had with her husband. Her husband used to tell her that their money disappeared too quickly and that she looked only to her husband. When he left, he took everything with him. At that time, Toribia was the coordinator of the Juli Prelature and at one of their meetings a promoter for Credimujer Manuela Ramos (a microfinance program) gave a presentation on loans and the requirements to receive one. She immediately joined the Santa Rosa de Lima Communal Bank in the city of Yunguyo. The loan that she received was for S/. 500.00 on 4/12/08 and she will finish repaying it on 08/12/08.

Toribia is very happy because she was able to increase her income and pay for the costs of running her home, as well has her children's studies. Her biggest dream is to set up and improve the guesthouse that she has, and to send her children to school so that they can be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Toribia P. tiene 48 años de edad, es madre de 6 hijos (4 varones y 2 mujeres), su nivel de estudio alcanzado es primaria completa, habla aymara y castellano, es jefe del hogar no vive con su esposo, esta domiciliado en Avenida Sol S/N en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo.

Se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado de 15 de Agosto en la ciudad de Yunguyo Kiosco Nº G31 y también en los meses de Julio hasta Noviembre vende refresco, este negocio ha emprendido a partir de los problemas que tuvo con su esposo, quién le decía: que se gastaba rápido el dinero, que le miraba solo al marido, y cuando se fue de la casa si había llevado todos los bienes; justo en ese entonces ella era coordinadora de Prelatura de Juli y en una de sus reuniones una promotora de CrediMujer Manuela Ramos presentó y expuso sobre el crédito y sus requisitos para acceder. Inmediatamente constituyo el Banco Comunal denominado Santa Rosa de Lima en la ciudad de Yunguyo. El préstamo que recibió fue de S/. 500.00 el día 12/04/08 y terminará de pagar el día 12/08/08.

Ella esta muy feliz porque mejoró sus ingresos para solventar los gastos en su hogar, estudio de sus hijos es padre y madre. Su sueño más grande es implementar y mejorar su pensión que tiene y hacer estudiar a sus hijos e hijas hasta que sean profesionales.

loans.use: Capital, purchase of supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Mr. Lai L. is a motorcycle-taxi driver as well as a farmer. He has been driving a motorcycle-taxi for five years now and makes around US$1.67 per day. His wife, Yean Dy, is 21 years old and sells pigs and poultry. She earns about US$1 per day. The couple has one child, and the family lives in the Beng Village, Siem Reap Province. Currently, L. wants to expand his farming business and is therefore requesting a loan of US$300 to be able to purchase a plot of farmland. He will use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for rice farming.

About Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL): Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL) is one of Cambodia's largest and most successful microfinance institutions (MFIs). It is committed to helping its clients achieve their business goals by providing sound financial services, and thereby hopes to contribute to the social and economic development of Cambodia. HKL specifically targets women and poor families in order to help them achieve increased financial security and quality of life, by offering various credit programs and encouraging savings. In accordance with its mission and its commitment to operational and financial sustainability, HKL contributes part of its net profits every year to support social development in education and healthcare.

loans.use: Purchase of land and fertilizer for rice farming

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima M. is a very hard working, enthusiastic woman who has been raising her four children on her own. Because the small pension she received was not sufficient to cover the family's basic expenses, she decided to start her own business selling cosmetics. Little by little, she gained more clients and increased her sales. Her wish to provide for her children and offer them a good education is what motivates her each day to improve and grow her business.

Fotima needs a loan in the amount of 1500 Somoni (450 USD), to be repaid in 4 months, to purchase merchandise for the new season and continue growing her business. She hopes you will choose to play an important role in her business' growth and in the life of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: Purchase of goods to expand her stock for the new season

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Nguyen Thi L. is 37 years old. At present both she and her husband grow rice and raise animals at home. In 2005, Mrs. L. joined TYM Fund and borrowed a loan to raise pigs to increase her family's economy. During three years, while raising pigs, she learned experience in cow raising. Now she and her husband bravely invest in cow raising and at first this business is effective. For the next loan cycle, she wants to borrow VND 7 million to invest in animal raising. With an income of VND 2 million/month, she ensures that she can repay regularly.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise cows

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is a representative of the Tatar ethnic minority, who lives in Simferopol, Crimea. She has a family of four, raising two children who are 19 and 20 years old. Gulnara sells denim clothing in the central city market. She has three vending locations at the marketplace and one more little store in a different part of town. Gulnara likes this business and runs it very successfully due to significant help from her family members. She has been in the trade for four years already. Currently, she has about $10,000 invested in the business. 

Gulnara's enterprise has benefited a lot from the partnership with Nadiya Ukraine. She has been able to purchase and stock two vending kiosks and expand her business as a result. On a personal level, Gulnara will be able to use a portion of her profits as an investment in the remodeling of her house. One of her biggest dreams as a mom is to buy separate housing for her children. This client has had 8 loans (total $4,400) and has repaid them without any delinquencies.    

Note: this is a short term seasonal loan that will be repaid in 2 months.

loans.use: To increase return

loans.name: Marjorie Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Marjorie tiene 27 años de edad, casada y con dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad, que estudian la primaria en el colegio del barrio habita en un barrio de la capital que se llama Naciones Unida desde su niñez, su esposo trabaja en una empresa desempeñándose como técnico industrial, la Sra. Marjorie trabaja de lavado y planchado en casa particulares desde hace cinco años para ayudar a la familia ya que todo esta caro y así poder balancear los gastos, con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para mejoras de vivienda, en la compra de bloques, arena, cemento, y hierro para comenzar a construir su casa de concreto ya que es muy humilde e insegura lo cual desea una vivienda digna para su familia, también desea poder tener salud para apoyar a sus hijos a que estudien.
texts.en:
Marjorie is 27 years old and married with 2 children aged 7 and 10 who study at the local school. Their neighbourhood has always been known as 'United Nations', and Marjorie has lived there since childhood. Her husband works as an industrial technician and for five years now, Marjorie has worked as a maid in various houses, washing and ironing clothes. She began this work because everything was getting expensive and the family needed extra income to pay their bills. She is requesting a loan so that she can improve her family's quality of life. Her current home is humble and its structure is unstable so she will buy bricks, sand, cement and iron to begin construction of a concrete house. Not only would she like her family's home to be dignified, but she believes that a new home would be much better for her children health and thus, make it easier for them to concentrate on their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the puchase of construction materials

loans.name: Chrek

texts.en: Chrek T., 38, is married and has three children. The family lives in the Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Chrek T. earns income selling grocery items and raising pigs. She makes about US$11 per day, while her husband, Sut Koy, 41, works as a tractor driver, making around US$5 per day. At present, Chrek T. would like to take out a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a stock of gas for her husband's tractor.

loans.use: Purchase of gas for a tractor

loans.name: Vidalina

texts.es:
Vidalina es socia del Banco Comunal Inti que quiere decir Sol en quechua.
Vidalina es casada, tiene 61 años y 12 hijos D. los cuales 6 hijos viven con ella, Vidalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, verduras, carne, gaseosas y tiene teléfono fijo. Además su esposo tiene un taller D. carpintería, que atienD. pedidos, Vidalina le ayuda en la compra y venta D. madera.
Vidalina necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, cerveza, fideos.
Los sueños D. Vidalina son arreglar su casa, mejorar su negocio y culminar la construcción del segundo piso D. su casa.
texts.en:
Vidalina belongs to Inti Communal Banc ("Inti" means "sun" in Quechua, a language spoken before the Spanish conquest. Quechua survived only throughout the Andes, but recently Peru has begun to revive the language.). Vidalina is sixty-one years old and married. She has twelve children, six of which live with her. Vidalina has a store in her house where she has a phone and sells basic groceries, vegetables, meat, and soft drinks. In addition, her husband has a carpentry shop that gets orders. Vadalina helps him buy and sell the wood. Vadalina needs a loan of S/.16,00 ($525) to buy rice, sugar, beer, and noodles. Vadalina dreams of fixing the house, improving her business, and finishing the second floor of their house, which is currently being constructed.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing rice, sugar, beer, and noodles.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Giovanna es socia del Bancomunal  Las Orquídeas.
Giovanna es casada tiene 50 años,  tres hijos D. 26, 21 y 18 años, ellos  estudian y trabajan.
Ella trabajó en una compañía D. seguros, era secretaria por muchos años, renunció y ahora  se dedica a la venta D. ropa D. vestir D. exportación, desD. hace diez años,  ofrecer a varias empresas, su esposo es vendedor textil y  le contacta con los clientes.  
DesD. que esta en Finca, ha podido ampliar su capital, pueD. comprar mas ropa al contado, y atender todos los  pedidos que le hacen, tiene mas clientes, le gusta las reuniones por que son solidarias, y son responsables.

Necesita un préstamo D. 1600 soles, para la compra D.  pedidos D. ropa que las clientes le han hecho.
La meta que tiene es tener cada mes ventas fijas,  que le produzcan un sueldo,  mudarse D. San Juan  y comprarse un departamento.
texts.en:
Giovanna is a member of “The Orchids” cooperative bank. She is married, 50 years old, and has three children ages 26, 21 and 18 who study and work. She worked at an insurance company, having been a secretary there for many years. She resigned, and for ten years now has dedicated herself to selling clothing for export. Her husband sells textiles, and gets her in touch with customers. Since she has been with Finca she has expanded her capital base, been able to buy more clothing in cash, and fulfill all the orders she gets. She has more customers, and enjoys their meetings because of the solidarity and because they are responsible. She needs a loan of 1,600 soles to buy clothes to fill orders she has from customers. Her goals are to have steady sales each month that will proviD. her with an income, to move from San Juan and buy an apartment for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1600 soles to fill clothing orders from customers.

loans.name: Sandab's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Sandab K., 41, is the leader for this group of six people who all live in Troneam Pich village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a motor taxi driver. His wife, Mrs. T. Chhoeurm, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer. In order to deal this problem, Mr. Sandab K.'s wife decided to request a loan to purchase fertilizer to make her crops more productive. This couple has three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another attends the local school, and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Mr. Sandab K. is not requesting the loan but his wife is, so she is shown in the photo.  

All the members of this group have end-of-term (EoT) loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. These loans allow borrowers to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Pen

texts.en:
Pen S., 25, is a mother who is caring for one child. She owns and runs a small wooden store in front of her house, where she sells little snack foods and some groceries for her neighborhood in the village. She is married to Sopheak, 28, who is a local goldsmith.

S. is working hard every day for income because she wants to make sure her one child receives the highest education. To make extra income, S. is looking for a $400 loan in order to use as capital in her business activities. The family lives in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To use as capital in her business activities

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en: Supportive wife best describes Mrs. Marlene T., 55-years old, and married with five children, two of whom are in school. She lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a furniture maker. Due to her husband's skill,  they are known not just in Panaon, but also nearby towns. Her husbandmakes chairs, cabinets, tables, etc. at a competitive rate. Joining Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative was a great opportunity for her & her family. She was able to send her children to college. She was able to renovate their house also. Now she is requesting a loan to purchase additional lumbers for furniture making. She’s hopeful that their business will attract many new of clients and many orders, with God’s blessing.

loans.use: To buy additional lumber for furniture making

loans.name: Glory

texts.en: Glory is twenty-eight years old and married with four children. She sells cooked foods like rice, plantain and fufu (which is a dough-like ball used to dip into stew). She hopes for the loan amount of $275 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Sann

texts.en: Sann S. is 35 years old and resides with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She makes and sells feed. On average, she earns about US$6 per day. Her husband is a construction worker and makes US$3 per day. This couple has two school-aged children. Sann S. would like to take out a loan to purchase baskets for packing the feed she sells at the market. She will also purchase some materials to make more feed to sell.

loans.use: To purchase baskets in which to pack feed.

loans.name: Bina

texts.en:
Mrs. Bina M. is a cosmetic shopkeeper in the village of Thecho. She opened her cosmetic shop a year ago to utilize her free time and to upgrade her family’s living standard. She sells different kinds of cosmetic goods in her shop. Now she seeks Rs10,000 loan to invest in her shop. She will use the loan to buy various types of cosmetic goods such as creams, lipsticks, glass bangles, etc.

Mrs. Bina M. has three members including herself in her family. Her husband Mr. Ramesh works in a small office. His income is not enough to meet the family expenses.

loans.use: to buys cosmetic goods to sell

loans.name: Pablo Absalon

texts.es: El señor Pablo Absolon de 62 años de edad, casado, reside en el barrio Villa Reconciliación en la capital de Managua, su esposa le dio tres hijos todos mayores de edad, su negocio es la venta de golosinas, atol, arroz de leche y cereales, el cual vende desde hace trece años, estas ventas las inicio con fondos propios y ayuda de sus hijos, el vende ambulante en un mercado el Mayoreo en la capital, con este solicitud va invertir en la compra de una carreta, frutas y verduras, para seguir creciendo en su negocio. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que con sus créditos a logrado este es su onceavo crédito y se ha beneficiado en su negocio como en su vida personal en el sustento de su familia. Sus planes es poder Terminal de hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Mr. Pablo Absalon is a married 62-year-old man who lives in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. He and his wife have three grown children. He sells candy, atol (a cornstarch-based hot drink), rice pudding, and grains as a street vendor in a wholesale market in the capital. He will invest this loan in a cart, fruits, and vegetables so that he can keep expanding his business. He gives thanks to Afodenic for its support in the form of loans. This is his eleventh loan, and he has benefited from these loans not only in his business, but also in his personal life in supporting his family. He plans on finishing his home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a cart, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 55-year-old wife and mother of seven children. She lives with her family in a house in Sefwi, in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer who is mainly into crop farming.

Agnes is a resourceful and very enterprising woman. For the last four years she has run a restaurant where she sells local food, such as banku and okro soup and abetie. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Abetie is prepared from dried milled cassava and is eaten with all kinds of soup.

Agnes says the price of raw materials has gone up significantly and she is no longer able to afford her production expenses. This has affected her production quality adversely. She needs a loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Agnes belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Bekyere’, which means 'God will provide', and would be grateful for assistance.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita L. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 33 years old. Lolita is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a motor cab for hire to local community members. Lolita has run her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lolita joined PMPC to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC which she used to purchase materials for her business. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase construction materials for house repair. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She hopes that she can provide comfortable shelter for her children. About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials for house repair.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita manages a general store in the village of Linao East Tuguegarao City. She is 39 years old and she is very grateful that her business is doing well. She happily lives with her husband and a niece of who they have supported in her studies up to this time. 

Emelita is requesting a loan of PHP 25,000 from Kiva as additional business capital for her general store. She wants the loan to make her store more progressive. She is happy that, despite of the hardships of life, she is able to help her niece financially since she has no child yet. The loan is really helpful in sustaining her general store. Selling has been her passion since her childhood. She also just started a food production business and she hopes that it will be able to help to improve their standard of living and let them continue supporting her niece's educational needs.

“A family that prays together stays together” said Emelita. She believes strongly in this quotation and she prays unceasingly for the goodness of her family and progress of her business to sustain their needs. Being an entrepreneur who is wishing the best for her business, Emelita works very hard and sacrifices much. She patiently manages to open her store at a very early hour in the morning and closes it late at night in order to earn more income. She loves her customers because they help her in her business and she gives them the best of her service. She prays to God that someday, from her sacrifices in the business, she will become successful in all her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
"Patience and diligence at work are the qualities we need to have to sustain our needs," says Lolita S.. Lolita is 54 years old and married to Eulogio, 57 years old, and a farmer. They live in Sitio Anguapan, Tumauini, Isabela, and are blessed with five children. Lolita is a loving mother and grandmother and all she wants is to have a successful way of living for her family.

Lolita has a livestock business raising poultry and pigs. She wanted a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva lenders to improve her business. Her livestock business is a big help in meeting the family's needs and Lolita hopes to sustain the business for the long term.

loans.use: To use as additional capital

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Benkadi sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne  d’âge de 35 ans et 2  enfants. Elles vivent avec leur mari et enfants  dans des familles élargies dans le quartier Banankabougou de la ville de Fana, Région  de  Koulikoro  République du Mali. 
Ces femmes font des activités diverses qui vont du commerce d’articles divers à la restauration. Elles ont fait la connaissance de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  à travers des liens d’amitiés. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elles comptent acheter, des pagnes et tissus, des céréales, et une grosse quantité de condiments alimentaires sur le marché de Bamako et effectuer leurs ventes  sur le marché de Fana à une clientèle riche et variée. 
Elles comptent obtenir chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé dans l’activité, dans les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group are all married women. Their average age is 35 years old and they have, on average, two children. They live with each of their husbands, children and extended family in the Banankabougou neighbourhood of Fana, in the Koulikoro Region of Mali.
These women work in a variety of trades ranging from selling various items to running restaurants. They learned about the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso through friends.
They are on their fifth solidarity loan. Their previous loans were all fully and properly repaid.
They plan to buy lengths of cloth, cereals and a large quantity of condiments at the Bamako market to then sell to a rich and varied clientele at the Fana market.
They hope to each make a monthly profit of 20,000 XOF, which will go towards their businesses and children’s healthcare and schooling.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah is a 33 single mother of four children aged between 11/2 and 17 years. Two of her children go to school .She takes care of additional family members. Hadjah resides and owns a four roomed house where she is staying with five people. There is electricity and no piped water at home  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in semi urban area which in the outskirts of Kampala Q. Hadja works seven days a week.  Hadjah owns stall selling bananas in Ndeeba Market. She buys her bananas from the traders in who get them villages and doesn’t incur extra transport costs to and from shopping.  Hadjah pays monthly market dues as rent.  She sells to all categories of people and on both retail and whole sale Hadjah has been in this business for six years and with MCDT for four years servicing her fifteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas. Hadjah is aspiring of seeing her business grow bigger and start going to buy directly from villages.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Nget

texts.en: Nget A. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Takeo province. She and her husband are sellers who are able to make a living of about $10 USD in revenue. Both of them sell mats, pillows, mosquito nets, and other home materials. They have been engaged in this business since 2005. This couple has two young children. Nget A. would like to take out a loan of $1,200 USD to purchase more mosquito nets, pillows, and other things to sell at the market.

loans.use: Home product sales

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati is 28 years old. She is married and is a mother with three children. Currently all of her children are schooling. They are a very humble family who want to invest in their children’s future by providing them with a quality education.

Fati is a petty trader and sells items like cooking oil, spices, pepper, onions, smoked and dried fish, tinned tomatoes, bags of rice, etc. In selling these products, she says, they move very fast and you can easily recover your money. She takes delivery of goods from the surrounding communities where she lives.

With her three years experience in her business Fati wants to add other goods like cereals to increase her product line to retain her customers. She believes that this can be possible with the help of loan assistance. Therefore she wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, spices, tinned tomatoes, etc.

Fati is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock in the event of a price hike. She also believes this would help her save more towards her kid’s education.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: María Del Transito

texts.es: María Del Transito M. D. E. resiD. en San Martin municipio  del departamento D. San Salvador.
