María tiene 59 años D. edad vive con su esposo y su hijo Ricardo D. 16 años D. edad, estudiante. Hace once años que María se dedica a su negocio donD. comercializa ropa, perfumes, cremas corporales, entre otros; las ventas D. María son D. manera ambulante a colonias y pueblos, donD. va ofreciendo D. sus productos casa por casa, ahora ella esta solicitando D. un crédito para poder incrementar su inventario.
texts.en:
María Del Transito M. D. E. is a resident of the town of San Martin in the department of San Salvador. She is 59 years old and lives with her husband and 16 year old son Ricardo, who is a student. For 11 years, María has been operating a business selling clothing, perfumes, body crèmes, and other products. She sells her products as a traveling merchant to different neighborhoods and villages where she presents her merchandise door-to-door. María is requesting a loan so that she can increase her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Maruja

texts.es:
La socia MARUJA pertenece al banco comunal “HATUN SONCCO”. El nombre del banco comunal es original del idioma Quechua, “HATUN” significa “Grande” y “SONCCO” significa “Corazón” que traducido al español significa “Corazón grande”.

La socia tiene 47 años de edad, es casada, tiene 3 hijos; dos varones y una mujer y viven en la ciudad Imperial del Cusco, nuestra socia es docente en el nivel primario en la provincia de Acomayo, hace 20 años que se dedica a la enseñanza de niños de las zonas rurales. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el pequeño negocio de venta de pollos, nuestra socia es una mujer amable y emprendedora pues con mucha voluntad se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos. Ya son varios años con esta actividad y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar alimento balanceado para los pollos. 
 
La socia se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Maruja belongs to the Hatun Soncco Communal Bank. The name for the communal bank comes from the Quechua language. “Hatun” means big, and “Soncco” means heart. Translated into Spanish it means Big Heart. She is 47, married, and has three children; two boys and a girl. They live in the Imperial city of Cusco. She is an elementary school teacher in the Acomayo province. She has been teaching children in the rural areas for 20 years. She alternates her activities between the household and her small chicken selling business. She is a very kind and enterprising woman. She devotes herself to raising and selling chickens with much joy. She has been doing this for several years. It has gone very well for her thanks to all of the effort she puts into her work. She is asking for a loan to be able to buy balanced food for her chickens. She is grateful for the opportunity of the loan, and she promises to pay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy balanced food for the chickens she sells

loans.name: Irenia

texts.en: Irenia S. is from the village of Paitan, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 59 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Irenia owns and operates a business raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Irenia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase pig feed and other supplies. Irenia is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell. This loan will be her fourth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to raise and sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Rice farming is Edna's main source of income. Her rice field is two hectares wide and is located in South Cotabato. She is 48 years old and is married to Carmelino. She has eight children to support. She heard about Community Economic Ventures, Inc. offering financial assistance to entrepreneurs. She joined and requested 15,000 PHP. She will use it to buy fertilizer for her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cosmetic products

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es:
Cristian, de 51 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Cruz (52) y de sus 3 hijos; Mayra (18), Melissa (17) y José (14).
Desde muy joven aprendió a manejar autos, es por esta razón desde hace 8 años empezó a dedicarse a movilizar personas brindando el servicio de taxi. Le gusta esta actividad porque la puede realizar en el horario que él convenga, ya que su auto es propio, pero lo que no le agrada es tráfico durante las horas de mayor saturación vehicular. Por otro lado, este oficio le permite interactuar con las personas, lo cual le agrada mucho y no se aburre, además lo considera rentable porque obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su familia. 
Para el futuro, Cristian quiere instalar una ferretería en su casa y así tener un negocio más tranquilo a diferencia del taxi.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y no quiere quedar mal con las integrantes de su grupo, es por esta razón que promete ser puntual en el pago de cada una de sus cuotas. Cristian tiene pensado invertir el dinero que solicita en darle mantenimiento a su auto y también empezar a comprar mercadería para su futura ferretería, ya que quiere implementarla lo antes posible. A su vez, piensa vender su auto más adelante para usar el dinero en abastecer mejor su futuro negocio.
texts.en:
Cristian is 51 years old, and lives in his own home with his wife, Cruz (52), and their 3 children: Mayra (18), Melissa (17), and José (14). He has been driving cars since he was very young, and for this reason 8 years ago he began working in public transportation by providing taxi service. He likes this job because he can work a schedule that is convenient to him since he has his own car. He does not like traffic during rush hour. On the other hand, this job allows him to interact with people, which is something that greatly pleases him, and he does not get bored. It is also very profitable because the money he earns allows him to provide a better quality of life for his family. In the future, Cristian wants to start a hardware shop in his home in order to have a calmer business than driving the taxi.

This is the third loan he has had with MFP, and he does not want to let his other group members down, and so he promises to be punctual in his loan payments. Cristian plans to invest the requested money in car maintenance and also to begin to buy merchandise for his future hardware store, as he wants to start it as soon as possible. He is also planning to sell his car someday to use that money to better stock his future business.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance and investing in a new business

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Justine is a 38 year-old mother of three teenage girls. She operates a public transport business in Machakos, Kenya, a business she has had for the last three years. Previously, she sold used clothes in Machakos. Justine is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to repair her car. In the future, she hopes to improve her business and purchase an additional vehicle for the business. She describes herself as ambitious and hardworking.

loans.use: To repair her car.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is married. He is 47 years old. Ilham M. and his family live in Khachmaz region. Five years ago, he started a pharmacy. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy more medicine to sell in his pharmacy in order to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy medicine to sell

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en:
Iyabo sells drinks at retail prices to her customers. She loves this drink business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She hopes to be a major drink distributor in the future. She is 40 years old and married with three children. Her children are doing well in school. Iyabo’s husband is a commercial driver and he also supports their home. 

Iyabo hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more drinks to sell. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and stronger. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: N. Sarah is a business woman and a resident of the Kasubi Area. She has a shop along Kasubi-Kawada Road where she sells clothes. She is married and has three children, all in schooling. She is thirty-eight years old. She is using the loan to purchase stock of clothes in order to meet and exceed her customer's demands, so she is trying her level best to improve on her business by expanding it. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to expand the business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes in order to meet her customer demands.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: S. M. Samuel is forty-one years old. He is a married man and father of four children. He owns a milling machine for grinding cereals. He has been in business for over twelve years. He is using the loan to purchase a new machine for more services. His dream is to extend his business to other areas to generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for more services.

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 26 years old, married with two children who are 2 and 7 years old.  Fabien also takes care of two dependents who are 7 and 20 years old. Fabien has been a self-employed businessman wholesaling sacks of Irish potatoes and he has been in this business for a long time.  The hours of his business are from early in the morning until late in the evening hours.

Fabien has a problem of not satisfying the demand of his customers, so he is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company which in turn will allow him to increase the quantity of Irish potatoes he sells.  With this additional quantity, Fabien expects to earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to be financially stable and continue taking good care of his family.

loans.use: a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Hira

texts.en:
Hira R. lives with her husband, Mr. Goam Bahadur R., and one son in Sanepa, Lalitpur. Her husband is a house painter. Her son is studying in grade 4. Most of the people in this region are involved in running small businesses like grocery stores. 

Mrs. R. opened her small cafe 4 years ago to strengthen the economic situation of her family. She sells different varieties of food items in her little cafe, and her specialty is Nepali food such as DalBhat (rice). She also sells tea and coffee. Her cafe is small but very popular in her locality. Mrs. R. is requesting this loan to buy necessary food ingredients for her cafe.

loans.use: to buy necessary ingredients for her cafe

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 39 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene tres hijos, Javier de 13 años, zosimo de 12 años y Guisela de 6 años de edad. Juntos viven en la hermosa selva cuzqueña, específicamente en la comunidad de Manitea Alta, donde tienen su casa  propia. Apenas tiene secundaria incompleta, pero eso no lo impidió trabajar en la agricultura, recuerda que tuvo que esforzarse mucho para establecerse en el rubro. Refiere además que le puso todo el empeño y dedicación para obtener una buena producción, es más lo productos que posee son orgánicos, no daña al medio ambiente; para ello utiliza técnicas de manera artesanal que cuida sus cosechas. Ana es consciente de que en el futuro, lo van asumir sus hijos, desde luego que los esta enseñando el buen manejo y cuidado de sus plantaciones y a la vez a conservar el medio ambiente. Su producto es reconocido en su comunidad, por la buena calidad que tiene consigo, es por ello que los grandes mayoristas llegan a su chacra para comprarle y ofrecerlo a  un precio competitivo. Usualmente trabaja con su pareja, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que ayude en la extracción de sus productos. En un futuro cercano anhela cultivar café, con la necesidad de ganar clientes potenciales. Este es su sexto crédito con MFP y por tal se compromete a pagar durante las fechas establecidas, además se siente conforme por las buenas decisiones que toma su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más terrenos fértiles, con la necesidad de incrementar su productividad e ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children; Javier 13, Zosimo 12, and Guisela 6. They live together in the beautiful Cuzco rainforest, in the community of Manitea Alta, where they have their own home. She barely completed secondary school, but that hasn’t prevented her from working in agriculture. She recalls that she had to work hard to establish herself in farming and tells how she put a lot of determination and dedication into getting a good yield of crops. What’s more, her produce is organic and doesn’t harm the environment as she uses artisanal techniques to take care of her crops. Ana knows that her children will take over the business in the future. So, of course she is teaching them how to properly manage and care for their plantations while preserving the environment at the same time. Her produce is recognized in her community for its good quality. That is why the big wholesalers come to her farm to buy it and offer her a competitive price. Usually she works with her partner, but sometimes she gets help from her children. However at harvest time, she needs laborers to assist in the gathering of her crops. In the near future, she hopes to grow coffee, as she needs to attract new customers. This is her sixth loan with MFP and as such she agrees to pay on time. She is also happy with the good decisions that are being made by her communal group. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of more fertile land, as she needs to increase her productivity and income.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase land for cultivation and to increase her productivity

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is from the village of Malaubang, Ozamiz City. She is 50 years old. Veronica is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Veronica owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and snacks such as "bingka", "biko", and bread in the local community. Veronica has been engaged in her business for over 25 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Veronica joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Veronica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. Veronica is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Veronica's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our field partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mti-Pesa Group

texts.en:
Amri K., age 32, is married and has a daughter of 3 years.  He has been a carpenter for 4 years now. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and he is able to make monthly profits of about $41.

This will be Amri’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to buy wood for his carpentry business and has paid this loan back successfully.  He hopes to receive a loan to buy a machine to drill and plane wood.

Amri will share this loan with his loan Group, Mti -Pesa, which totals 24 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture,  Amri is second from the right, in the back row wearing a grey t-shirt

loans.use: To buy two machines, one for drilling and one to plane wood

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.en:
Arsenio Y. is from the village of Bayabo East. He is 53 years old, married and has 4 adult children. Arsenio owns & operates an agricultural business, planting and harvesting rice for sale. He has been engaged in his business for over 29 years and earns approximately 45,000 PHP per harvest.

In 2007, Arsenio joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Arsenio is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Arsenio from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
Elina is 33 years old and is married to a driver who works for a tour company called Volcano. She has three children aged between 8 and 14 years.

Elina sells carrots, onions, and cabbages and has been doing this for twelve years. She intends to use the loan to invest in her business and increase her scale of operations.

If all goes well with her business, Elina has a vision of buying a small secondhand car to facilitate the transportation of her products from farmers to her selling point.

loans.use: To buy more carrots, onions and cabbages to sell

loans.name: Marthe

texts.en:
Marthe is 49 years old and married with six children who are between 10 and 22 years old.  Marthe is commonly known for selling Irish potatoes and this is her 10th successful year in this business.  The hours of starting business are from 8 am to 3 pm every day.

Marthe needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With this loan, she will purchase a large quantity of Irish potatoes, which in turn will allow her to increase her sales as well as her profits.  If successful, Marthe will keep expanding her business for better financial stability and, in addition to that, she will continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba T. sells cloth and fried fish in Elmina. She has received junior high school education. She is divorced and lives with her four children. Her ex-husband is a trader. She is responsible for the general welfare of her home. Her loan will be used to buy additional fresh fish to fry to distribute to her customers. She hopes to save the new profits from her business to revive her cloth business.

loans.use: To buy additional fresh fish to fry to distribute to her customers

loans.name: Nelly Margarita

texts.es:
Nelly de 55 años, vive en una zona urbana en el suburbio de Guayaquil, no está casada pero ha salido adelante con sus cuatro hijos, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza donde hace todo tipo corte de cabello, tinturados, planchados etc. 

Su pequeño salón de belleza lo inicio cuando ella tenía 33 años, poco a poco ha venido trabajando con ayuda de sus hijos. Ella hace cortes de cabello, tinturados, alisados etc. Trabaja desde muy temprano hasta el anochecer.  Para tener más ganancias y tener otro estilo de ingresos ella ha implementado ubicar una papelería a lado de su salón de belleza. 

Ella quiere comprar con el préstamo tintes y maquinas para planchar el cabello y así dar un mejor servicio. En el futuro quiere su peluquería mas grande y tener a toda su familia unida.
texts.en:
Nelly is 55 years old, and lives in an urban area in the Guayaquil suburbs. She is not married, but has done well with her four children. She has a small beauty salon where she offers all types of haircuts, coloring, straightening. She started her small beauty salon when she was 33 years old, and has worked all that time, with the help of her children. She does haircuts, coloring, and straightening. She works from early in the morning to nightfall. In order to increase her earnings and have another source of income, she has opened up a stationery store beside her beauty salon. With the loan, she wants to buy dyes and equipment to straighten hair, and thus provide better service. In the future, she would like to have a larger hair salon and have her entire family together.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tintes, maquinas

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. She has been farming for four years and employs one farmhand. She sells her milk through Kenya Cooperative Creameries. She also earns income from running a shop. She recently repaid a previous loan from Juhudi Kilimo and has requested this loan of 70,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help her pay school fees for her children. Her major challenges have been lack of enough water and animal feed, especially during the dry season. In five years' time, she would like to have at least four pure dairy breeds.

Juliana is 40 years old. She is married and has been blessed with four children who are between the ages of 3 and 20. Three of the children attend school.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es:
Wilder es un hombre trabajador, comerciante de su propio negocio una pulpería en donde ha venido incrementando su inventario, gracias al esfuerzo y apoyo económico de la institución mediante el financiamiento.
Hoy en día junto a su esposa se dedican a trabajar juntos, para lograr el pan de cada día y un mejor bienestar familiar.
Atreves de los prestamos ha logrado equilibrar sus ventas, cubrir sus necesidades que es de gran relevancia.
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, que es lo fundamental, productos lácteos, golosinas, cereales, productos de limpieza. Logrando así mejores resultados.
texts.en:
Wilder is a hard-working man.  He owns his own small grocery store whose stock he has gradually been increasing through effort and the financial support of the organization.

He currently works alongside his wife to earn their daily bread and a better family well-being.

Through the loans he has managed to stabilize his sales and cover his needs which is of great importance.

With this loan he will buy: bulk grains (which is the most essential), dairy products, candies, cereals and cleaning products.  This will help him achieve better results.

loans.use: To buy bulk grains, cereals, candies, dairy products and cleaning products in order to achieve better sales

loans.name: Lesbia Maria

texts.es: Lesbia Maria tiene 34 años. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. Por lo que su actividad económica es una pulpería. Por lo que cada día, busca como proporcionarle a su familia el pan de cada día, Maria viaja a los mercados a comprar los diferentes productos ya que  tiene que ofrecer diversos productos, pero lo que más pide es obtener el crédito con otras casas comerciales para ofrecer una variedad de productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo como golosinas, refrescos, jugos entre otras.
texts.en:
Lesbia Maria is 34 years old and an extremely hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and four children and earns her living by managing a grocery store. Each day she tries to provide for her family’s daily needs.

Maria travels to the markets to buy different products so that she can offer a wide variety. What she wants most is to obtain a loan since other business establishments offer a variety of products. The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy candy, soft drinks, juices, and other products.

loans.use: Purchase candy, soft drinks, juices, and other products

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, D. 53 años, está casada con Pascual, D. 59 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con uno D. ellos, a quien cuidan y educan en su casa propia ubicada, en la localidad D. San pedro D. Cajas. En el pueblo D. San Pedro, la mayoría D. sus pobladores se dedican a la artesanía y el arte; pero muy pocas personas como Luzmila, encontraron éxito en otros campos D. desarrollo. Ella cuenta que hace 35 años, abrió una panadería y desD. ese entonces todo le va muy bien, la mayoría D. sus habitantes compran pan y pasteles en su negocio, el cual cada día venD. más. Pero como en la sangre D. un poblador D. San Pedro, corre el gusto por el arte, ella también se dedica al tejido y bordado; sus 20 años D. experiencia se refleja en su tienda D. artesanía en el parque central D. la localidad. Pero lo que más desea es abrir su panadería en diferentes lugares. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y se siente orgullosa del éxito logrado en su banco comunal, donD. sus integrantes son personas responsables y comprometidas. Con el crédito que obtendrá, le ayudará a comprar objetos artesanales al por mayor, para está campaña naviD.ña y si el dinero le alcanza comprará lana para diseñar las alfombras y tapices que le solicitaron sus clientes.
texts.en: Luzmila is 53 years old and married to Pascual, who is 59. They have 6 children, but only live with one of them, who they care for and educate in their home, located in San Pedro D. Cajas. In the town of San Pedro, most people specialize in arts and crafts. Very few people, like Luzmila, are successful in other fields. She says that 35 years ago she opened a bakery and since then everything has been going well. Most people buy their bread and pastries from her business and she sells more each day. But as a true blooded resident of San Pedro, she loves art and also weaves and does embroidery. Her 20 years of experience is reflected in her craft shop in the town's central park. But what she wishes most is to open her bakery in other locations. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is proud of the success in the community bank, where it's members are responsible and committed. This loan will help her buy wholesale crafts for this holiday season and if the money will buy enough wool she will design carpets and tapestries, requested by her clients.

loans.use: Buy handicrafts and wool to make rugs.

loans.name: Jose Guillermo

texts.es:
José, de 35 años de edad, reside en Jucuapa, departamento de Usulután, donde vive junto a su esposa y su hijos de 12, 8 y 5 años de edad, quienes dependen económicamente de él, José se dedica a la elaboración de ataúdes de madera, lo aprendió a través de su padre, lo realiza de lunes a sábado desde que tenía 18 años de edad.
Hoy José necesita un préstamo para la compra de madera, pintura, barniz, clavos y lijas, ya que estos materiales son lo necesarios para el proceso de fabricación de los ataúd, este préstamo le ayudara a contar con lo necesario y poder realizar el trabajo y darle venta con los clientes.
Sus aspiraciones son que el negocio sea prospero, seguir realizando su trabajo de la mejora manera y que sus hijos culminen los estudios para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
José, 35, lives in Jucuapa, Usulután department, with his wife and children who are 12, 8 and 5 years of age and depend on him.
José manufactures wood coffins, a skill he learned from his father.  He has worked Monday through Saturday since he was 18 years old.

Today José needs a loan to buy lumber, wood, varnish, nails and sandpaper because these supplies are needed in the coffin making process.  The loan will help him have everything he needs thus making it possible for him to do the work and sell to customers.

His wishes are that the business prosper, to continue working better and that his children finish their education so that they can get ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy lumber, paint, varnish, nails and sandpaper.

loans.name: Subhi

texts.en: Subhi is a taxi driver from Hebron city. Subhi transports passengers inside Hebron and rarely outside the city. He came to FATEN to take out a loan to pay for car insurance fees, as well as perform the regular car check to make sure everything is working fine. Subhi is married and the father of two daughters and three sons. Subhi appears in the picture here in FATEN's office.

loans.use: To pay for car insurance fees

loans.name: Michel

texts.ar:
ميشال متزوج وله ولدان يعمل في بيع الادوات الصحية له في عمله 25 سنة ميشال في عمر 57 سنة يحب عائلته
وعمله يريد لهم تحسين وضعهم المادي والاجتماعي له تاريخ جيد مع المجموعة وقد اثر فيه بشكل جيد وكان يلقى الدعم الكامل 
من عائلته يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء بضائع جديدة للمصلحة له خبرة واسعة في عمله لكن ما ينقصه
هو المساعدة حتى يزيد من مدخوله وتحسين وضعه ووضع عائلته
texts.en: Michel is a 57-year-old husband and father of two who works hard to put his family on a firmer financial footing and who in turn is very much supported by them. After a quarter century, Michel enjoys considerable expertise in selling bathroom supplies. Given his good standing with Al Majmoua, Michel would now like to seek another loan to purchase more wares for his business.

loans.use: To purchase items for bathroom supplies business

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth M. is 28 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. To make a living, Janeth owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of green and sweet bananas in the local community. Janeth has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Janeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Janeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and acquire working capital. Janeth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional green and yellow bananas. This loan will be Janeth's third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional green and yellow bananas

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
Eden Y. is from the village of Panay Daku Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Eden is married with two school-aged children. Eden runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Eden has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Eden joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. Eden is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units of offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lynnie Marie

texts.en:
Lynnie Marie G. is from the town of Banga. She is 34 years old. Lynnie Marie is married and has 2 children, aged 9 and 2. To make a living, Lynnie Marie owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lynnie also raises pigs at her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Lynnie Marie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lynnie Marie has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Lynnie Marie is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase farm supplies and pig feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies and pig feed

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys N. is 33 years old and single. 

Aloys runs a well-organized shop where he sells a variety of goods. Aloys has been in this business for six years. The hours of his business are from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day. He employees one person in his business.

Aloys needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company. With this loan, Aloys will expand his product offerings and start selling food such as bananas, sugar, rice and so on. 

Aloys hopes to earn a lot of money and this will allow him to keep reinvesting for better financial stability and start saving for the future.

loans.use: to buy a wider variety of goods to resell

loans.name: Faustino

texts.en:
Faustino L., from the village of ZNAC, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte, is 47 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Faustino owns and operates a business venture providing general services to local community members. Engaged in his business for over 5 years, he earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Faustino joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid his previous loan of 6000 PHP from PMPC that was used to purchase materials needed to provide service, he is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be Faustino's third loan from PMPC, and he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy all the additional supplies she needs in her business

loans.name: Dioubo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité de DIOUBO est créé le 27 août 2009. Il est composé de 12 femmes qui toutes issues du même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit. Le fait partie du Banc Villageois de MAMADOU LAMINE G.. 

Madame NDACK MAI F. (debout à l'extrême droite de la photo emmitouflée d'une écharpe marron) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Elle a en charge son neveu. 

Elle fait un petit commerce de poissons au marché central de la ville. Et parallèlement elle vend des tissus. Elle a une bonne expériences dans ces domaines d'activité pour les avoir menées depuis plus de trois ans. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle va augmenter son niveau d'approvisionnement en poissons et tissus pour mieux fidéliser sa clientèle et générer des revenus financiers.

Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la santé des membres de la famille et de la scolarités des enfants.
texts.en:
The solidarity group DIOUBO was created on August 27, 2009. It is composed of twelve women who are all from the same neighborhood. Their principal business involves small-scale commerce. The group is part of the Banc Villageois of MAMADOU LAMINE G.. 

Ms. NDACK MAI F. (standing at the far right in the photo and snug in a brown scarf) is the group’s leader. She is 40 years old, married, and the mother of four children. And she has her nephew in her care. She has a small business involving fish at the city's central market. And concurrently, she sells fabrics. She has good experience in these business domains for having run them for over three years.  

With her new loan, she is going to increase her supplies of fish and fabrics, so as to retain her customers and to generate revenues. Her goal is to support her husband in meeting the health care needs of the family and the schooling costs of the children.

loans.use: to buy fish to be resold at the market

loans.name: Than

texts.en: Than S. is 37 years old and works hard growing many kinds of crops. She earns about $1.50 a day, which means she must be very careful about what she spends money on. Her husband also works in the field with her. The main problem they face is that they do not own a well, and they are applying for this loan to hire laborers who can dig one for them. She is very grateful for the help she receivbes from Kiva. In this photo, which was taken inside their house, we see Than S. and her husband.

loans.use: to hire laborers to dig a well.

loans.name: Abdumanon

texts.en:
Abdumanon is 34 years old. He is married and is the father of two children. His wife is a housewife. Abdumanon is a hardworking man who is engaged in providing car repair services. He has been in this business for a year now and is mostly engaged in providing wheel/tire repair services. Abdumanon is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase new equipment and repair his workshop building. Abdumanon would like to thank in advance all the lenders who will support him in his business, thus allowing him to improve his family’s living conditions. More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy equipment and repair his workshop building

loans.name: La Buena Fe Group

texts.en:
Marta is the coordinator of her group, L. Buena Fe ("The Good Faith"). Her group is located in the rural area surrounding Hato Mayor, a sleepy agricultural town. They are five businesspeople dedicated to selling different products. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and five of their six children.

Marta is excited to be taking out her fifth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling jewelry. She intends to use the loan capital to purchase rings, chains, bracelets, and other jewels. She will use the profits to save, complete construction on her home, and invest in her children's education. 

Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally, many of whom recently immigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy jewels

loans.name: Blanca Marina

texts.en:
Blanca is 50 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán, located on Ecuador's northern border with Colombia. She is married and lives with her family. She has four children, aged 28, 25, 23, and 20 years. She is an entrepreneurial person with a peaceful, kind, and tolerant character. 

With her loan, Blanca will purchase materials including paints and brushes for her pottery business, which she runs from her home. She reports that her business began with very few ceramic products that she sold to her close friends and neighbors. Her business has since expanded and she has some regular clients. 

Blanca has been getting credit from FODEMI for six years and has found that she has increased her sales so that she could provide a better quality of life for her children. Her goals for the future are to continue to have faith and hope, and to proceed with the support of her family.

loans.use: to buy paints and brushes for her ceramics business.

loans.name: La Ñusta Iii Group

texts.es:
LA ÑUSTA III es un banco comunal que pertenece a la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Calca (Cusco, Perú). Las reuniones del banco comunal son cada treinta días en la casa de una de las socias. En la reunión conocimos  a la socia Cerafina. 
    
Cerafina es integrante del banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III” hace 1 año y recientemente por decisión de todo el grupo le otorgaron el puesto de presidenta, en la foto sale la presidenta sale sentada y está levantando la mano. Entre todo el grupo decidieron ponerle ese nombre a su banco comunal “LA ÑUSTA III” porque a todos les pareció bien y les gusto ese nombre este grupo lo conforman 12 personas las cuales tienen ya vaR. años trabajando con la Asociación.

Cerafina nació en el valle de Lares (Calca, Cusco) y tiene 52 años de edad es una madre de nueves hijos los cuales son dependientes e independiente. Cerafina trabaja en lo que es la venta de verduras en diferentes mercados de la zona como por ejemplo en la ciudades de Conchacalla, Choquecancha, Lares, Cachin, Calca y Sontococha. Cerafina piensa invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de maíz, papa y verduras. Ella no tiene un puesto de venta si no se instala de forma ambulatoria  en las ciudades antes mencionadas.
texts.en:
La Nusta III is a communal bank belonging to Asociacion Arariwa (Kiva Field Partner) in the city of Calca (Cusco, Peru). The communal bank meetings are held every thirty days at a member's house. In a meeting we met Cerafina. 

Cerafina has been a member of the communal bank "La Nusta III" for the past year and recently, by decision of the entire group, she was granted the seat of president. In the photo she is seated and she has a raised hand. The entire group decided on the name of the communal bank "La Nusta III" because they all thought it was a good name. The group is made up of 12 members who have all been with Asociacion Arariwa for many years.

Cerafina was been in Valle de Lares (Calca, Cusco) and she is 52 years old. She is the mother of nine children, some are dependents and some are independent. Cerafina is involved in the sale of vegetables in different markets in the region, for example in the cities of Conchacalla, Choquecancha, Lares, Cachin, Calca, and Sontococha. Cerafina plans on investing the funds from her loan in the purchase of corn, potatoes, and vegetables. She does not have a sales stand, so instead she sells itinerantly in the cities mentioned.

loans.use: to purchase corn, potatoes, and vegetables.

loans.name: Ibonkerahon Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 21 février 2001. Le groupe est  composé de onze femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame Souadou qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main et le responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 57 ans. Elle est veuve sans enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge quatre autres enfants confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de fruits et de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, car étant pratiquer depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront de subvenir à ses besoins personnels et d'augmenter son niveau d'épargne
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on 21 February 2001. The group comprises eleven women who live in the same area. Their main activity is running small retail businesses.

Ms. Souadou, on the right in the photo with the raised hand, is the group leader. She is 57 years old. She is widowed and has no children. She has four children in her care, all of whom were entrusted to her by their parents.

She runs a business selling fruits and vegetables. She has solid experience in this field, having practiced in it for several years.

This loan will allow her to strengthen her capital and better develop her business.

The profits will allow her to provide for herself and increase her level of savings.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Silvia María

texts.es:
La señora Silvia María de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella hace 10 años con la liquidación de su centro de trabajo empezó a vender chiverías, gaseosa y granos básicos. Con los préstamos y su ardua labor  la ha ido surtiendo y mejorando cada día hasta tener una pulpería.
Ella con el crédito comprara granos básicos, carne, chiverías, pan, embutidos…etc.
texts.en:
Silvia Maria, 38, is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman.  When her workplace closed down 10 years ago, she began selling snack foods, sodas and basic grains.  With the loan and her hard work she has been supplying and improving her business every day until she now has a general store.
She will use this loan to buy basic grains, snack foods, bread, cold cuts, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, snack foods, bread, cold cuts, etc

loans.name: Kotognontala  3 Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des grandes familles traditionnelles avec en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants, les dix membres du groupe Kotognontala 3 habitent toutes dans le village de Sirakorobougou dans la commune rurale de Sanando dans la 4ème région administrative du Mali (Ségou) et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de mariage et de voisinage. Dans le but d’avoir des intrants disponibles en début d’hivernage, elles ont fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 1er cycle de prêt de campagne. Les spéculations cultivées par les membres du groupe sont l’arachide, le mil, le gombo et le niébé.
Madame Safiatou (1 ère femme assise à l’extrême gauche) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 25 kg de grains de semences d’arachide, deux sacs d’engrais composés de complexe céréales et d’urée et se faire aider dans les activités de labour par la main d’œuvre masculine du village. Elle se ravitaille en intrants agricoles à la foire de Tissala. Avec une superficie de 2 hectares, elle espère produire  15 sacs d’arachide, 8 sacs de mil, une partie de toute sa production est consommée à domicile et le reste stocké, est vendu pendant la période de soudure pour satisfaire l’entretien et les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The ten members of group Kotognontala 3 are in their majority married in large traditional families; they are on average 42 years old with four children, and they all live in the village of Sirakerobougou in the rural township of Sanando, part of Mali's fourth administrative region (Segou). They got acquainted through family, marriage and neighborhood relationships.
In order to have agricultural intrants available at the beginning of the rainy season, they are requesting help from Soro Yiriwaso and are on their first agricultural loan cycle. The species cultivated by the group members are groundnuts, millet, okra and black-eyed peas.
Mrs. Safiatou (the woman sitting all the way to the left) is planning on using her loan to purchase 25 kilos groundnut seeds as well as two bags of a fertilizer made from urea and complex fertilizer; she will also obtain help with plowing from the male workforce of the village. She gets her agricultural intrants from the fair in Tissala. With a plot of five acres, she is hoping to produce fifteen bags of groundnuts and eight bags of millet. Part of her production is consumed at home, and the rest is stored and sold during the tide-over period to provide for the children’s support and healthcare.

loans.use: to buy groundnut seeds and fertilizer and to recruit men to plow their plots of land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts, keep up with mechanical maintenance, and pay for his insurance policy

loans.name: Deggo 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Deggo1 a été créé le 16/06/2009.IL regroupe 22 femmes issues du même village.Leurs activités sont :le commerce,l'agriculture et l'élevage.

Madame ASTOU est responsable du groupement,elle est âgée de 28 ans,elle est mariée et mére d'un enfant.Son activité est l'élevage des moutons.

Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience de cette activité pour l'avoir pratiqué pendant longtemps.

Son pret lui permettra d'acheter 2 moutons de son choix afin d'agrandir son cheptel.

Son objectif est d'assurer la scolarité de son enfant.
texts.en:
The Deggo 1 solidarity group was created on June 16, 2009. It consists of 22 women from the same village who conduct trade, farming and cattle rearing.

Mrs Astou chairs the group. She is 28 years old, married and the mother of one child. She rears sheep. After many years in this activity she has a lot of experience. She will use her loan to buy two sheep that she selects herself in order to expand her livestock. Her objective is to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Labeono

texts.fr:
Laboeno est une femme âgée de 34 ans. Elle est mariée å un soudeur. Elle a 03 enfants.
Laboeno travaille comme revendeuse depuis 3 ans. Elle vend des tissus et des bijoux de façon ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. 
Laboeno a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des tissus et des bijoux en argent. 
Dans les prochaines années, Laboeno voudrait ouvrir une grande boutique.
texts.en: Laboeno is a 34-year old woman. She is married to a welder. She has two children. Laboeno has been working as a vendor for three years. She sells fabrics and jewelry as a street vendor. She buys her goods in Lomé. Laboeno has requested her first loan from wages in order to purchase fabrics and silver jewelry. In the years to come, Laboeno would like to open a real store.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and jewelry

loans.name: Wangnina Group

texts.fr: WANGNINA est un groupe constitué de trois personnes et dont la représentante(celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) se nomme Ifètayo. Les membres du groupe résident dans le même quartier. Dans le but d’augmenter leur fonds de roulement, ce groupe sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ifètayo est âgée de 37 ans et est mariée à Antoine, un boucher. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge.  Ifètayo n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour satisfaire ses besoins et ceux de sa famille, Ifètayo vend des bois de chauffage et des sachets à son domicile. Ifètayo exerce cette activité depuis près de quatre ans ; ce qui lui permet ensemble avec son mari, d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille. Ifètayo s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Ce quatrième prêt permettra certainement à Ifètayo et à l'ensemble du groupe WANGNINA, de rehausser le niveau de leur activité et d’accroître leur clientèle et leur revenu.
texts.en:
WANGNINA Group is made up of three persons. Its representative (who's raising her hand in the photograph) is named Ifètayo. The members of the group live in the same neighborhood. In order to bolster their working capital, they are seeking their fourth loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé.

Ifètayo, age 37, is married to Antoine, a butcher. The couple has three school-attending children, whom they have to support. Ifètayo never attended school. In order to provide for herself and her family, she sells firewood and bags at her home. 

She's been running this business for nearly four years, which enables her, together with her husband, to pay the various expenses of the family. She gets her supplies from one of Benin's cities.

This fourth loan will certainly enable Ifètayo and the entire WANGNINA Group to bolster their business and increase their clientele and income.

loans.use: to buy firewood and bags

loans.name: Angel Antonio

texts.es:
Ángel de 30 años, es un hombre muy responsable en su trabajo. Su negocio lo empezó hace 2 años, alquilando una tricimoto para hacer carreras y de servicios de entrega a domicilio.  

Ahora él ya cuenta con una, escogió esta actividad porque le gusta la moto desde muy pequeño. Su trabajo lo realiza con mucha responsabilidad, su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo desde las 7.00am hasta las 5:00pm.  

Tiene una unión libre y su esposa trabaja en una empresa. Solicita él préstamo para invertir en su tricimoto y para la compra de accesorios como: radio, parlantes, llantas. Su sueño es darle un buen futuro a su familia.
texts.en:
Ángel, 30, is a very responsible man with his work.  His business started two years ago when he rented a tree-wheeled motor vehicle to do trips and home deliveries.  He now owns one.  He chose this activity because he’s liked motor vehicles since childhood.   He does his work very responsibly.  His work schedule is Monday through Sunday from 7am until 5pm.

He’s in a common law relationship and his wife works for a firm.  He’s asking for the loan to invest in his vehicle buying such accessories for it like: radio, speakers and tires.  His dream is to give his family a better future.

loans.use: to buy accessories like a radio, speakers and tires.

loans.name: Mulya Sari Group

texts.en:
This is the second loan for the Mulya Sari group. For this new loan, they received Rp 18,000,000, an increase of Rp 3,000,000 from the last loan.
Ni Ketut received Rp 1,500,000, which she is using to purchase two piglets and feed. Ni Ketut has two children who are still in school. Her husband works as an entrepreneur. She hopes with the business, she can support her life, especially her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets and feed

loans.name: Rosel

texts.en: For the last four years, Rosel has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables to the people of her village from 8 a.m.-6 p.m. She usually earns about PHP 4,000 a month and uses this income to provide for the needs of her five children, all of whom are in school. She would like to diversify her business and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy bananas, mangoes, tomatoes and cabbage to sell to her customers. Her goal is to earn enough money to send all of her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fruit to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Trakash

texts.ru: Тракаш женат имеет семерых детей. Более 30 лет он занимается купле- продажей скота. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе. Он хочет расширить бизнес и улучшить благосостояние семьи. Тракаш раньше кредитовался  в  «ИМОН Интернэшнл» и на полученный займ купил корову и овцу. Теперь он хочет снова получить займ для покупки двух голов крупного рогатого скота. А еще хочет использовать часть займа для покупки семян пшеницы и ячменя для посева. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за поддержку.
texts.en: Trakash is married and has seven children.  He has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over 30 years.  His wife helps him in this business.  He wants to expand his business and improve his family's well-being.  Trakash had previously obtained a loan from "Imon International" and used it to buy a cow and a sheep.  Now, he wants to obtain another loan to buy two heads of cattle and to use part of the loan to buy wheat and barley seeds for sowing.  He hopes to receive your help and thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Mo'tasem

texts.en: Mo'tasem is a 28-year-old young married man. He has a cafe with pool tables and also works in installing air conditioning to improve his income. Mo'tasem wants to expand his cafe by purchasing additional pool tables, but he does not have enough money for the purchase, so he needs to take out a loan in the amount of $3,000 from FATEN. When Mo'tasem gets the loan, he will purchase additional pool tables. This will increase the number of tables he has in the cafe, so his customers will increase and his income will increase too. He will be able to provide better living conditions for his family. Mo'tasem is photographed next to the pool table he has in the cafe.

loans.use: To purchase pool tables

loans.name: Tursunay

texts.ru:
Турсунай 58 лет, замужем. Турсунай, муж Шахабидин и сын занимаются полеводством и выращиванием хлопка, но так как эта работа носит сезонный характер,  в поисках дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2000 году Турсунай начала свой бизнес в торговле одеждой на рынке. Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Турсунай сумела развить свой бизнес  с ежемесячным доходом  около 15,000 сом (KGS) и оборотными средствами в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS).  
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турсунай обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента.  Доходы от кредита Турсунай планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места, и в перспективе – начать параллельно разводить скот.
texts.en:
Tursunay is 58 years old and married.  Tursunay, her husband Shakhabidin, and her son grow cotton.  But because this work is of a seasonal nature, and in search of supplemental income for her family, in 2000 Tursunay began her own business selling clothes at the market.  Thanks to her persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business which now has a monthly income of about 15,000 som (KGS) and working assets of 80,000 som (KGS).  

With the goal of further developing her business, Tursunay turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to widen her assortment of goods.  Tursunay plans to invest the income from her loan in enlarging her sales stall and, in the future, to begin breeding cattle as well.

loans.use: to broaden her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Aida María

texts.es:
Aida tiene 45 años, es una mujer de caracter fuerte y muy responsable, es casada y tiene un hijo de 15 años de edad, vive con su familia en Píllaro que se encuentra muy cerca de Ambato en la Sierra Centro de Ecuador.

Aida trabaja sola en la crianza de cerdos, es la tercera vez que solicita créditos a Fodemi, crédito que será utilizado en la ampliación de la infraestructura de las chancheras ya que quiere comprar más chanchos y actualmente los corrales son pequeños. Esta inversión le permitirá incrementar su negocio, ventas e ingresos económicos que ayudaran a mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.

El sueño que tiene es poder tener una distribuidora directa de chanchos.
texts.en:
Aida is 45 years old and  is a woman of strong character who is very responsible.  She is married with one son 15 years old and she lives with her family in Píllaro, which is very near Ambato in Sierra Centro, Ecuador.

Aida works alone raising pigs and this is her third loan request with FODEMI.  The credit will be used to expand her pig pens as she wants to buy more pigs and her current pens are small. This investment will increase business, sales and income that should improve the quality of life for her and her family.

The dream she has is to become a direct distributor of pigs.

loans.use: To grow the size of her pig pens as she wants to acquire more pigs to grow her business.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 56 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. 

To earn a living, Clemencia prepares and sells cooked food for daily meals. She has been in her business for over 20 years and earns 10,000 PHP each month. 

In 2010, Clemencia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Sevil

texts.en:
Sevil is 40 years old. She is a single mother with sons. She is a very hardworking parent who is taking care of her children alone, and this is very hard. Sevil lives in her own home and enjoys her sons, who are in school.  

Sevil sells phone accessories. She has fifteen years’ experience working in this profession, which she does every day from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. She loves her business. From this business, her monthly profit is 400 AZN.

Sevil usually sells telephone accessories because everybody is using mobile telephones. In the modern society, young-aged people need such products, so there is a big demand for these products.

Now Sevil needs a loan of 2,000 AZN. This investment will help her to improve the business, since this way she will make profits to support her family. Her dreams are for her children, so that they can stay in school and have successful careers in the future, and to offer a better quality of life to her family. She has a good loan history and this is her fourth loan.

loans.use: to improve the business and buy furnuture for her shop

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Mr Koffi vit avec sa femme coiffeuse et leurs 02 enfants à Lomé. Ils sont âgés de 12 et 07ans et sont scolarisés. Koffi est revendeur. Il exerce son activité de vente d’amplis, de radio et de télévision sur étalage. Avec ce second crédit qu’il sollicite dans notre institution, il désire acheter des radios, des télévisions et des ampli. Avec les profits, il souhaiterait acheter un terrain, devenir grossiste et assurer l’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Koffi lives with his wife, a hairstylist, and their two children in Lomé. The children are 12 and 7 years old, and both go to school. 

Koffi is a retailer who sells amplifiers, radios, and televisions from a stall. He plans to use this 2nd loan he is seeking to buy radios, televisions, and amplifiers. 

He would like to use the profits to buy some land, become a wholesaler, and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: to buy televisions, radios, and other items for resale.

loans.name: Red Rose Group  (Please Delete The Document)

texts.en:
Ever is a mother of one child and she is in her late 20’s. She has had a mamalishe business serving food such as cooked rice, ugali, bananas with meat, beans and vegetables. Ever has been in this business for 12 years now. She does business from 8 a.m. to 3 p.m. per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request to be apportioned among the Red Rose 12-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, maize and baking flour. Ever's dream is to build a classic restaurant. (The lady with the baby is part of the group).(PLEASE DELETE THIS DOCUMENTS. THANKS)

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients such as rice, beans, sugar, maize and flours.

loans.name: Mwitemania Songa Mbele Shg Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Jossy. She is eighty years old and a mother of four children. She is a member of Mwitemania Songa Mbele SHG which joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from enterprise development and financial management training.
She is a poultry farmer. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feeds which will improve on eggs production. She hopes this will increase her income hence enable her provide food for her family.
She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders.

loans.use: To buy poultry feeds and improve on production hence increased income to provide food for her family.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.en: My name is Maria Concepcion A. M., but they call me Concha.  I am 30 Years old and I have 1 daughter who is 14.  I have been with Adelante for 1 ½ years and am on my third loan.   I had a small business before, but it was very small and didn’t make much money.  Now I have bought a microwave, some furniture and a lot of other things for my house with the earnings from my business.  I have also been able to buy things for my daughter that I couldn’t before like new clothes, shoes, and now I am able to send her to highschool.  I wouldn’t be where I am today without the loans and education from Adelante.  For example we recently had a business planning lecture that talked about planning enough time for family and business and for me that was very useful.  I have also learned a lot about how to keep a record of my business – to record sales and inventory so that I can grow my business. In the next year or two I would like to be able to buy my own house, continue to grow my business and continue to learn.I had very little when I started but I had a small business – it wasn’t until my first loan with Adelante that I have been able to really make a business.With the education lessons I know how to grow inventory I even bought a freezer to increase the products to sell and I will increase my sales by notating what sells.  I have recommended several women to Adelante and tell them that they will be given money and knowledge to start their own business.  But I also tell them that they need to be ready to work and if they are then they can have a business like just like mine.

loans.use: Assorted items - general retail

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is married with one daughter. After school she was unable to find a good paying job in her field of training so she decided to start her own business selling jean clothing. She has been in business now for 4 years. Trendy clothes and her natural friendliness have helped her business be successful. Irina is very cheerful and resolute. Her main goal is to provide a level of customer friendly service that exceeds her clients’ expectations, creates repeat customers, and attracts new customers to her kiosk. Her entrepreneurial talent and hard work in combination with 10 loans from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped promote the dynamic growth of her business. Irina would like to purchase a new vending kiosk. This loan for $1,000 will allow her to purchase a kiosk and will increase her working capital so that she can expand her inventory of quality, durable jean shorts, jackets, jean sets etc. and better meet the growing demands of her clients. Successful, stable growth in Irina’s business will help provide a more secure future for her employees and family.

Ірина – одружена, в неї одна дочка. Вона певний час не могла знайти гарно оплачувану роботу за своєю спеціальністю, отже, вирішила відкрити власну справу й продавати джинсовий одяг. Ірина займається цим бізнесом вже 4 роки. Модний одяг та природна відкритість Ірини допомогли їй досягти успіху в бізнесі. Ірина – дуже жвава та рішуча. Вона завжди намагається запропонувати своїм покупцям високий рівень обслуговування, що допомагає їй зберегти постійних клієнтів та привабити нових. Заповзятливість та наполеглива праця у поєднанні з 10 позиками від „Надії України” сприяли динамічному зростанню бізнесу Ірини. Ірина хотіла б придбати новий кіоск. Саме тому вона просить про позику в 1000 доларів, яка допоможе їй збільшити свій робочий капітал, закупити якісний товар, а саме, джинсові шорти, куртки, костюми тощо, а також краще задовольнити потреби своїх покупців. Успішне, стабільне зростання бізнесу Ірини забезпечить спокійне майбутнє для її підлеглих та рідних.

loans.use: To purchase a new vending kiosk

loans.name: Taase

texts.en: Taase is forty years old. She’s married and has five children.  Taase maintains a strong belief in her business as does all of her family.  They all believe that investing time and money in their taro plantation is the only way to raise their standard of living.  Taase will use her loan to buy more bush knives for clearing brush and digging taro; this will make the work quicker and more productive.  Taase hauls her family’s taro crop to the new market in town twice a week.  She claims that the high quality of her product is what keeps her regular customers coming back each week.

loans.use: :  Bush knives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her used clothing business

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Business Description

Eduardo and his wife run a computer center where they offer internet access, photocopy services, printer cartidge refills, and computer repair and sales. The business also includes a soda bar area and fast food sales.

Use of the Loan

He needs this loan because he hopes to buy more computer parts in bulk to provide better prices and products for his clients. He will also use part of the loan to open another location which he will run with the help of his nephew.

Personal Information

Eduardo is 36 years old. He has one child in school. His home is made of cement and he enjoys a stable family life. His main goal is to grow his business to provide for the education of his children.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Sr. Eduardo tiene junto con su esposa un centro de computo donde ofrece los servicio de Internet, fotocopiado, recarga de cartuchos de impresoras y reparación y ventas de repuestos de computadoras. Además en el local que el alquila tiene también un soda bar donde vende comida rápida

Uso del Préstamo

El necesita el crédito porque ha pensado en comprar mas repuestos y partes de computadoras a precio de mayorista y así poder tener mejores precios y buenos productos para sus clientes. Otra parte del dinero lo usara para adecuar otro local donde va a abrir otro centro que va a atender con la ayuda de un sobrino de el

Información Personal

El tiene 36 años y un hijo que aun estudian su casa es de cemento y tiene estabilidad familiar. Su principal meta es de poder progresar en su negocio para asegurar la educación de sus hijos

loans.use: To buy new and replacement parts for computers.

loans.name: Nicandro Agostinho

texts.pt:
Nicandro is not officially married but lives with a woman with whom he has 4 children. He works for the City Council of Inhambane, capital of one of the southern provinces of the country. His children are all currently attending school. His wife is unemployed and takes care of the home. With his salary, it is not possible to support the family and buy electric appliances. He therefore entered the FDM loan program to acquire certain appliances that he would otherwise not be able to afford.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Nicandro nao e casado oficialmente mas vive com uma mulher com quem tem 4 filhos.Ele etrabalhador do Concelho Municipal da Cidade de Inhambane.,capital de uma das provincias a Sul do Pais. Os seus filhos todos estao a estudar. A sua esposa nao esta empregada e apenas domestica. Com o seu salario nao e possivel sustentar a familia e comprar electrodomesticos.Dai o facto de ter entrado para o programa de credito do FDM para poder adquirir ccertos electrodomesticos que de contrario nunca teria condicoes de adquirir.

loans.use: Nicandro would like to use the funds to purchase electric appliances for his home

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is married and has two children. She runs a small business selling sausage and other meats in the central market of Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She sells a variety of meat products for reasonable prices at her stall. Alla started her venture nine years ago and has achieved stability since then. Currently, she has about $2,000 in inventory. Her monthly net profit is about $600.

Alla has many loyal customers. They always come to buy sausage and meat from her, because they know she doesn’t offer any low-quality products in her kiosk. Customer demand is constantly growing, which is why Alla has decided to open a new vending kiosk in a different market and expand her trade. We believe Alla’s determination and desire to provide only the best-quality products will help her grow professionally and increase her sales.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of inventory

loans.name: Claire's Group

texts.en:
Claire N. is a 35 year old married mother of 4 (20, 17, 14,10) who sells fresh food such as sweet potatoes, yams, Irish potatoes, and casaava. With a loan, Claire intends to purchase additional stock for her business. With her profits, she will cement the floor of her house.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To add stock

loans.name: Mwanaidi's Motomoto Group

texts.en:
Mwanaidi, age 40, is married with 5 children (ages 30, 27, 20, 18, and 13). She and her husband also take care of her 80 year old father.

Mwanaidi has a business selling cassava and milk. She started this work in 2007 and she works daily from 6am to 5pm. She makes a monthly profit of about $110 from this business. She now hopes for a loan to increase her sales. She will share this loan with her subgroup who have businesses dealing in soap sales.

loans.use: To increase cassava and milk sales

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.en: Zamirahon M. lives in the Asht region of Tajikistan and she is married and has three children. Mrs. M. works in the family business of raising and selling livestock. This work brings her family income but she works also as a toastmaster for wedding parties. Now Mrs. M. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $1,200.00 to purchase a pedigreed bull and ram.

loans.use: To purchase a pedigreed bull and ram

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy lives with an employee in her own home on 3 de Mayo Street in the Villa Nuevo Potosí area of La Paz. She sells children's shoes in a store on Graneros Street, a commercial area where many such products are sold.

The requested loan will be used to increase her capital and buy more merchandise, including new models of shoes.

Her credit record is very good, and qualifies her as a good client who can receive a new loan. She has been an IMPRO client since 2000.
