Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nancy vive en casa propia en la calle 3 de mayo de la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz sola con su empleada; la actividad que tiene es la venta de calzados para niños en la calle Graneros, que es un lugar muy comercial donde se venden estos productos.

El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y comprar más mercadería y seguir surtiendo sus productos con nuevos modelos.

Su antecedente histórico es muy bueno y la califica como buen cliente y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2000.

loans.use: To purchase new models of shoes in order to have more variety in her store.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 33-year-old Sophia W., who is married and has three children aged 12, 17, and 20.  She also has two other dependents living with her because they are her sister's children.  In 2005, Sophia established her rice and maize farming business, and now requires a loan in order to purchase inputs and equipment to grow more crops. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase inputs and equipment for her rice and maize farming.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr:
Born in 1977 in Tsévié, Miss Adjo A. spent a few years in primary school before undertaking an apprenticeship as a seamstress because of financial difficulties. Married with no children, she nevertheless has a heavy responsibility in the care of her parents and one of her sisters. The meager income from her poorly-equipped sewing workroom is not sufficient to cover the household expenses. Yet through her dynamism and impeccable work, she has been able to manage and reimburse the previous loan without any problem. To meet the demands of her customers, Miss A. needs to be better equipped. She is therefore requesting a loan that will help her buy more sewing machines and work materials, as she is training four apprentices.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1977 à Tsévié, Mlle A. Adjo a fait quelques années d’étude au cours primaire avant de se lancer dans l’apprentissage de la couture, faute de moyens financiers. Mariée, sans enfant, elle a tout de même une lourde responsabilité qui est la charge de ses parents et une de ses sœurs. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges du foyer. Mais par son dynamisme et son travail impeccable, elle a su gérer et rembourser le précédent crédit sans incident. Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Mlle A. Adjo a besoin de mieux s’équiper. Ainsi donc elle sollicite un crédit qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et autres matériels de travail, car elle a quatre (4) apprenties en formation.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines and work materials

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es:
Diana belongs to the "Women headed toward success" communal bank and lives in Morales in the San Martín region of Peru. She is dedicated to selling gutted chickens at her post in the local market in the city of Tarapoto. It was her husband who motivated her to take on the job, since he is a chicken distributor. Thanks to her perseverance and skill she has been able to increase her sales and has a very good clientele. She also likes the personal interaction with customers, and her work allows her generate her own income so she has better self-esteem from the growth as a person and a woman. With the $700 loan, which she plans to repay within six months, she wants to purchase caged hens and chicks to sell by pieces and kilograms. She also plans to purchase an electric scale that will allow her to show her customers the exact weight of what she is selling. Diana is quite young, at only 21 years of age with two children. Along with her husband she works hard to provide for them. Her goal is to have her own wholesale post selling live chickens.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Diana Luz P. T. , pertenece del Banco comunal “ Mujeres Rumbo al Desarrollo” , vive en el distrito de Morales provincia de San Martín , y departamento de San Martín, se dedica a la venta de pollos desviscerados en su puesto de ventas del mercado Nº 2 ubicado en el Jr Nicolás de Pierola Cuadra 4, de la ciudad de Tarapoto . Fue su esposo quien la motivo a poner su puesto de venta de pollos, ya que él es distribuidor de estas aves, gracias a su perseverancia y buen trato sus ventas aumentaron y tiene muy buena clientela además le gusta estar en contacto con la gente, y esto le permite generar sus propios ingresos lo cual aumenta su autoestima, crecer como persona y mujer. Con este crédito de S/. 2000.00, que será pagado en 6 meses, comprará pollos y gallinas vivas en javas de 10 unidades para venderlos diariamente en pedazos y en kilos, además con el préstamo comprará una balanza eléctrica que le permite atender a su público con peso exacto de su producto. La señora Diana Luz es bastante joven, pues tiene solo 21 años y dos hijos, junto a su esposo trabaja con perseverancia para así poderlos atender en todas sus necesidades, anhela tener su propio puesto de venta de pollos vivos al por mayor.

loans.use: Purchase hens and chickens wholesale as well as an electric scale / Compra de animales menores al por mayor.

loans.name: José Vicente

texts.pt:
José Vicente T. is 53 years old and was born in Maputo. He is married and the father of 7 adult children, 2 of which still live at home. His 21-year-old is in the 12th grade. José himself was not able to study past 12th grade because his family could not afford to pay for his studies. Because his parents separated early on, he lived with his mother who raised him on her own.

Besides working in the military services, José has a small plot in a rural community in the Mahau district of Matutuine. José has been an employee of the ministry of defense for 30 years. His work day begins at 7:30 a.m. and ends at 3:30 p.m. His monthly salary is 10,500.00 MT, and he saves some of it at the end of every month. He lives in his own house.

This is José’s third loan. The first and second ones he used to purchase goats and cows, and with this one he intends to buy construction materials. José’s dream is to open a small general store.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer.

José Vicente T. tem 53 anos de idade e natural de Maputo. Casado maritalmente e pai de 7 filhos já maiores de idade apenas vive com dois filhos um com 21 anos e frequenta 12ªclasse.

José estudou até 12ªclasse não continuou por que a família não tinha condições para pagar os seu estudos a mãe teve que criar-lhe sozinha por que muito cedo os pais separaram e ele viveu com a mãe. Para alem do trabalho como militar tem uma pequena machamba numa comunidade rural de mahau distrito de matutuine.

José é funcionario do ministério da defesa a 30 anos e trabalha das 7:30 às 15:30h tem um salário mensal de 10500,00mt e poupa algum no fim de cada mes. Vive numa casa própria.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo para José o primeiro e segundo usou o dinheiro para compra de gado caprino e bovino e este pretende comprar material de construção. Constitui grande sonho para José abrir uma pequena mercearia.

loans.use: To buy materials to build family house

loans.name: Tano's Umoja Ni Nguvu Group

texts.en:
Tano is 35 years old, married with five children aged between two and 10. She has been a fish seller since 2005. She works 14-hour days and earns a monthly profit of about $175 from her sales.

Tano hopes for a loan to buy more fish and other items for her business. She will share this loan with her sub-group members, whose businesses include running a kiosk and selling fish, charcoal and coconuts.

loans.use: To buy more fish and other items for her business.

loans.name: Léa

texts.fr: Dame G. Léa est née à Cotonou et est originaire de Zè dans le départemnt de l'Atlantique. Veuve de Batchéoumba Jean-Pierre (un colonnel) il y a neuf ans, elle a huit enfants.  Dame G. Léa  est revendeuse de divers articles de grande consommation: savons, eaux de toilettes, liqueurs, pâtes alimentaires, boîtes de conserves, etc. Au départ, elle vendait  les chaussures et pagnes au grand marché  Dantokpa de Cotonou. Suite au décès de son mari, elle cessa toute activité. Il y a trois ans, elle reprit son petit commerce en faisant cette fois-ci un changement d'activité. Le troisième crédit qu'elle sollicite maintenant  vise à consolider son étalage pour mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Léa G. was born in Cotonou and comes from Zè (Atlantique Department). She lost her husband, Colonel Jean-Pierre Batchéoumba, nine years ago and has eight children. Mrs. Léa G. resells various staples : soap, perfumes, liquor, pasta, canned food, etc. In the beginning, she used to sell shoes and pagnes (colorful African cloth) in the grand market Dantokpa in Cotonou. Following her husband's death, she stopped her business. Three years ago, she started her new business. The third loan she's seeking now aims at bolstering her inventory to better meet customer demand.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two sacks of rice, 2 boxes of canned food, one box of pasta and 6 pieces of "Hitarget" pagne (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Yboni

texts.es:
La señora Yboni, socia del BC “Virgen del Rosario”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista. Se dedica a la venta de leña y por las noches vende anticuchos. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el  Jr. Lamas Nº 1428, lugar donde acuden sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y transeúntes que visitan su barrio.   

Con este préstamo de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará leña en grandes cantidades para luego venderlos al menudeo y los insumos que necesita para la venta de anticuchos como arroz, carnes, carbón entre otros y contar con lo necesario para surtir su negocio y satisfacer las exigencias de sus clientes y asegurar sus ventas.

Yboni tiene 38 años de edad, es viuda y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. Es una mujer muy perseverante y responsable, con ganas de salir adelante. Más adelante desea arreglar su casa para poner un negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yboni is a member of the Communal Bank "Our Lady of the Rosary," and resides in the region of San Martín, province and district of Bellavista. She sells firewood and kebabs at night. The business is located in her home where most of her customers are neighbors and passersby who visit her neighborhood. With the loan of S/.1500, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will buy wood in bulk and then sell at retail prices. She will also purchase the supplies needed to sell kebabs such as rice, meat, charcoal among other things necessary to supply her business and meet the demands of her customers and ensure sales. Yboni is 38 years of age, is widowed and counts and the support of her children. She is very persistent and responsible, always wanting to get ahead. In the future, she wants to repair her house and establish a grocery store business.

Translated from Spanish by Jennie Campos, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood in large quantities, as well as rice, meat, charcoal, etc.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr: Né à Djagblé, le 31 décembre 1980, monsieur B. Kokou vit depuis plus de 3 ans à Adétikopé. Soudeur de formation, il est spécialisé dans la fabrication de portes et autres objets métalliques. Père d’un enfant, il sollicite un crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter des tôles et barres de fer pour la fabrication des objets métalliques. Ainsi il pourra rentabiliser ses affaires et prendre correctement en charge sa famille.
texts.en:
Born in Djagblé on December 31, 1980, Mr. Kokou B. has been living in Adétikopé for more than 3 years. A trained welder, he specializes in making doors and other metallic objects. Father of one child, he's seeking this loan that will enable him to buy sheet metal and bars of iron to manufacture metallic objects. He will thus be able to turn a profit and adequately support his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabrication et vente portes et d'obejts métalliques To manufacture and sell doors and other metallic objects

loans.name: Pascoal Raul

texts.pt:
Pascoal was born in Inhambane, is 30 years old and was in school until the 8th grade. He is married with 3 children: the first child is 8 years old, the second is 3 and the last is 5 months old – only the oldest is in school.

After his birth, Pascoal leaves Inhambane for Namaacha – a village on the border with Swaziland – with his mother, who was following her husband who worked in that district. Six years later Pascoal begins his studies and has to stop when he reaches the 8th grade due to his father’s death, given that it was he who paid for Pascoal’s studies. Life becomes hard and being the oldest child of the household, he finds himself forced to work. In 1995 he finds a job at the Hotel Libombos as a bar man and works from 7am to 3pm on the morning shift and from 3pm to 11pm on the night shift. He is a permanent employee and makes 2600 MZN a month but he doesn’t save any money because as well as building his house he is responsible for his two brothers who live with him.

This is Pascoal’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva. These 10,000 MZN will be used to buy construction materials to finish building his house. He is confident that he will repay his loan before it is due and because it’s not easy to live off his salary, he aims to ask for another loan for the construction of a stall that will help increase his family’s income.

Translated from Portuguese, Brazil by Ines Teles, Kiva Volunteer

Pascoal nasceu em inhambane, tem 30 anos de idade estudou ate a 8ª classe vive maritalmente é pai de 3 filhos: o primeiro de 8 anos a segunda de 3 anos e a ultima de 5 meses, somente o mais velho e que se encontra a estudar.

Após a sua nascência Pascual sai de Iinhambane a Namaacha uma vila na fronteira da Swazilândia com sua mãe , esta que ia atras do seu marido que se encontrava a trabalhar naquele distrito. Seis anos depois Pascoal começa a estudar e teve que parar na 8ª classe devido a morte do seu pai este que custeava os seus estudos, a vida fica dificil e sendo filho mais velho da casa vê se obrigado a trabalhar, então em 1995 consegue aranjar um emprego no Hotel Libombos como bar man, Trabalha das 7.00h as 15.00h no periodo da manha e das 15.00h as 23.00h no periodo da noite. É trabalhador efectivo e aufere mansalmente um valor de 2.600.00mt não consegue poupar nenhum valor porque além de estar a concluir a sua obra responsabiliza se pelos seus 2 irmâos estes que vivem com ele em sua casa.

Este e o priméiro empréstimo de Pascoal na Hluvuku e Kiva. Estes 10.000.00mt seram usados para comprar material de construçao para concluir com a sua obra. Esta confiante de que vai reembolsar antes do prazo determinado porque não e facil viver de salário tem como objectivo pedir outro empréstimo para contruçao de um pequeno estabelecimento comercial que lhe vai ajudar a aumentar a renda familiar.

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.en:
Juana Antonia R. D. C. is a member of the Mujeres Emprededoras or Women Entrepreneurs communal bank in Pucallpa, Peru. Pucallpa is a major city and transportation hub of the eastern jungle region in Peru’s Amazon River basin.

Juana is sixty-six years old and she supports herself, her five children, and her retired husband. Juana sells beauty products by catalog for a living. When she first started with the Manuela Ramos micro-finance organization eight years ago, Juana sold clothing. Now Juana is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase cosmetics and beauty products for her stock.

Beauty products sales by catalog is a popular profession in Peru. Women sell to their neighbors, family, friends and acquaintances on credit. Women working with Kiva loans are able to purchase more stock in bulk to save themselves money and to keep their display cases in stock.

Juana plans to repay her loan in six months and will use the funds to purchase more of the perfumes pictured in the photograph. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: purchase more beauty products such as perfumes

loans.name: Lidia Del Transito

texts.es:
La Señora Lidia del Transito R. López tiene la edad de 54 años, su estado civil es soltera, Doña Lidia tiene 2 hijas ambas están casadas y mayores de edad, sus propósitos son proporcionarle las mejoras necesarias a su vivienda para que en un futuro sus hijos gocen de su vivienda sus deseos son de establecer una pulpería con todas las condiciones necesarias para dedicarse completamente a este negocio y obtener su jubilación ya que necesita ingresos para la compra de sus medicamentos por lo que Doña Lidia ha buscado el medio para trabajar y es por medio de la venta de frijoles, leña refrescos entre otros ya que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y es lo que le enseña a sus hijos para que ellos aprendan lo difícil que es trabajar y ganar dinero sus sueños son que Dios le de mas vida para enseñarles a su hijos a trabajar fuertemente y como administrar un negocio ya que es importante por lo que así obtendrán una fuente de ingresos.


La actividad económica es la venta de ropa interior, venta de refrescos, venta de frijoles cocidos y la venta de leña, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación ubicada en el costado norte del restaurante Dilectus, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 12 años, su actividad económica inicia por los deseos de superación y con la necesidad de buscar una fuente de ingresos que sufragara los gastos propios del hogar y el sustento diario de sus 2 hijas, es así que a pesar de contar con una plaza fija de docente de educación primaria surge la idea através de sus hijas de vender refrescos, gaseosa, leña y todo esto ubicado en su casa de habitación siendo atendido por sus hijas ya que cuando Doña Lidia tenia que impartir clases por las mañanas ella cuidaban del negocio por lo que en las tardes ella se hacia cargo del negocio al pasar el tiempo decide abrir ofertas de sus productos en su centro de trabajo y empieza ofertando ropa interior de contado y al crédito a sus colegas y padres de familia de sus estudiantes teniendo hasta la fecha la clientela por lo que el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado para la compra de mas productos de belleza y productos de pulpería para aprovechar la temporada ya que la clientela le solicita constantemente nuevos productos.
texts.en:
Lidia del Transito R. López is 54 years old, single and has two daughters, both of whom are grown up and married. Her goal is to make the necessary improvements to her home so her children can enjoy it in the future. Her wish is to establish a convenience store with all the necessary elements and dedicate herself completely to the business and receive a pension, since she needs the income to pay for her medications. Lidia has looked for a way to work, and in doing this started selling beans, firewood and beverages, among other items, and always has enjoyed it. She taught her children the trade so they'd learn the difficulty of hard work and making money. Her dream is for God to grant her a long life so she can teach her children to work hard and how to administer her business, since it is important for them to have a source of income.

Lidia's main economic activity is selling undergarments, beverages, cooked beans and firewood. Her business is located in her home on the side of Dilectus restaurant. She has had her business for 12 years, which started out of her desire to make headway and out of the necessity to find a source of income to cover household expenses and provide for her two daughters. With a fixed primary educational plan, the idea came to her she could teach her children and also tend to her business. That way when she gave them lessons in the mornings she could take care of the business as well, and in the afternoons could focus fully on her work. As time passed she decided to start offering undergarments by order and on credit. She is requesting a loan to purchase beauty products and other convenience store products to take advantage of the season and because her clientele is constantly requesting new products.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beauty products and other convenience store supplies

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: C., 33, has requested a loan of $600 to buy a new motorbike to support her business investment because she wants to have an easier work flow during her buying and selling procedures. C. currently sells fish and vegetables in the local Takmao Market and earns around of $5 per day. She is married and has two children who are are teenagers and attend school. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and also assists her in selling fish. C. usually gets up every dark morning to buy vegetables and fish for her store in bulk and resells them to the customers in retail. She works very hard because she wants to send both her children to get a university degree. The family lives in Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to support her retail business investment.

loans.name: Aline

texts.fr:
Née en 1977 à Dèkin dans la commune de DANGBO, L. Aline réside  dans le 3e arrondissement de la ville de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative du Bénin. Aline est mère de trois (03) enfants dont deux (02) scolarisés. Aline a pour activité principale la couture. Pour diversifier ses sources de revenus, Aline vend aussi les fournitures de couture.Aline sollicite un crédit pour renforcer son activité afin d’avoir plus de revenus pour faire face d’une part à ses différentes charges et d’autre part pour constituer une épargne.

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500. ALIDé offre les prêts spéciaux de 0% d’intérêt aux personnes très vulnérables et elle est dans un groupe qui lance bientôt un programme de la micro-assurance santé pour les bénéficiaires de micro crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1977 in Dèkin in the city of Dangbo, Aline L. lives in the third arrondissement of the city of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. She's the mother of three children, out of which two attend school. Her main business is sewing. To diversify her sources of income, Aline also sells sewing supplies. She's seeking a loan to bolster her business and increase her profits, in order to pay for her expenses and start building some savings.

Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500. Alidé offers special loans to highly vulnerable people at an interest rate of 0%. It is part of a group that is soon launching a micro health insurance program.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell sewing supplies

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia P., currently in the business of selling green vegetables, is requesting a loan to open up a shop.  Twenty-six years old and married to a soldier, Cicilia has two children, both attending school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to eventually buy a bus to transport passengers from place to place. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a shop.

loans.name: Abdusobur

texts.ru: Абдусобур - молодой мужчина 36 лет. Женат. Имеет 2-х детей. Занимается откормом и продажей скота. Пасет свой скот в горах. С раннего утра до позднего вечера он пасет скот. А в выходные ездит на рынок, чтобы купить или продать скот. Иногда он покупает быка, чтобы заколоть и продать мяснику. Это очень выгодно для него. На этот новый займ он покупает 2 коровы и теленка. Одна из них дойная корова. Жена очень обрадовалась дойной корове. Теперь она будет доить молоко для семьи и для продажи.
texts.en:
Abdusobur is a young man of 36. He is married and has two children. He raises and sells cattle, which he grazes in the hills. From early in the morning till late in the evening he herds his cattle, and on weekends he travels to market to buy and sell cattle. Sometimes he purchases a steer to slaughter and sell to the butcher, which is very profitable. With his latest loan, he purchased two cows and a calf. One of them is a milk cow, with which his wife is delighted. Now she has milk for the family and for sale.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising and selling cattle

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren D. is married but currently is living with her parents and two infant children in Arhanghay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her 5-year-old daughter goes to a local kindergarten and her 2-year-old daughter stays at home with her grandparents. Suren started a small cafeteria in December 2008 to support her family. She rents a small cafeteria space in the town inside the local shopping mall and serves lunch and dinner. She started the business with help from her five siblings and, in less than six months, her business capital has increased from 500,000 MNT (1 USD=1,400 MNT) to 3,000,000 MNT. As her business expands, she needs more working capital to meet the demand for her food service. She requests a loan to purchase necessary ingredients for her food business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Safia Patras Masih Group

texts.en:
Safia baji lives in Kasur, Pakistan, a city famous for its sweetmeats. She is a tailor. She learned this trade from her mother and helps her family by paying the utilities. Her husband, P. M., sells leather. He receives orders from companies and sells them his product to earn income. Safia baji is applying for a loan to buy leather to help her husband complete orders for his customers.

Safia baji is the group leader for this loan, which includes two other ladies.  Hanifan baji and Rani baji each want a loan to buy leather to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy leather to sell

loans.name: Lubov

texts.en:
Lubov is a married woman. She sells a variety of small home products in Khoost city. She has been in this business for 12 years. Low prices and a large assortment help her to overcome the competition. Surely being nice and smiling all the time helps her as well!! For the last couple of years, the business has become a family one. Lubov's husband and children have joined her to help in sales and deliveries.

Lubov would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to increase her inventory. Her business goal is to open a second and then third location selling similar items. This would provide jobs for her children and increase the family income.

loans.use: To open a new location

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas Group

texts.en:
Tania M. is one of two groups leaders in the Renovacion Las Aguilas group. She runs a small business called a ‘fantasia’ out of her house. In the Dominican Republic, a fantasia is a store that sells a variety of non-grocery goods. Tania sells bicycles, shoes, perfumes and other items. 

Tania lives in Santiago, a crowded city that suffers from severe rainwater drainage problems. The income from her business goes to support her family and two children, ages eight and ten.  She has previously taken out one Esperanza loan, and found it to be a great help.  Tania was able to restock her inventory at a time when her family’s budget was very tight. She plans to use this loan to expand her inventory.

Tania reports that her involvement with Esperanza has given her a more positive outlook on her business’s ability to succeed in this economy.  She has learned how to more efficiently manage her costs, which has led her to feel more confident in her skills as a business owner.

loans.use: Restock inventory.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma T. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 32 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Irma owns and operates a fish business, selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Irma has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Irma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish to sell. Irma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina P. has a hog-raising business. She also buys and sells meat. She is 41 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with a child. They live in the rural area of Barangay Annafunan, east of Tuguegarao City.

To support their daily needs, and especially the education of her child, Cristina wants financial assistance from Kiva lenders. She wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to use as additional capital to expand her businesses. She hopes that Kiva lenders will grant her request, because it will improve their living conditions. Cristina hopes that the income from her business will enable her to provide a quality education for her beloved child.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Elfe

texts.en:
Elfe B. is from the city of Dipolog. She is 36 years old. Elfe is separated and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Elfe owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elfe has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Elfe joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elfe has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elfe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest another business such as selling beef and pork products known as "longganisa" in the local community. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Elfe from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in selling beef and pork products known as "longganisa"

loans.name: Mariatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariatou  D.  est âgée de 39 ans et vit dans une famille monogame  avec son mari et ses 4 enfants au quartier Bougouni Lafiabougou de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à  l’école  par incapacité de ses parents de supporter ses charges scolaires, elle commença vite le commerce ambulant  auprès de sa  mère qui vendait des condiments alimentaires. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage couronné d’une expérience enrichissante, elle décida d’évoluer en solo en entamant  le commerce des condiments comme sa mère, au marché de Ségou depuis maintenant plus de 10 ans et jouit d’une notoriété. Ces marchandises mises dans de bons emballages  sont  bien disposées sur une étagère.
Dans l’optique de réaliser plus de bénéfice elle fait recours à   Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 39 mois. Après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser  ce prêt pour acheter, 4 cartons de cubes magies et  1 carton de concentrées de tomates. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières à Bamako. Madame Mariatou D.  vend en détail, au comptant  et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte   réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA qui lui servira de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. 
Son ambition  est de construire une maison.

loans.use: Achat de condiments alimentaires.

loans.name: Merarda

texts.es:
La Señora Merarda está casada con el señor Cresenciano Mongelos, quién se dedica a la olería (fabricación de ladrillos), la pareja tiene 2 hijos, vive en el Barrio Jazmín de la Ciudad de Tobati unos tres kilómetros de la ciudad. 
Doña Merarda, emprendió su propia microempresa en el año 2.001, con un pequeño capital que disponía. Gracias a la buena atención y la calidad de sus productos tiene clientela formada. Doña Merarda es una persona muy sacrificada, atiende en su negocio de lunes a lunes, para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar mercaderías como (azúcar, yerba mate, fideos, panificados, huevo, harina, entre otros), y de esa forma ofrecer variedad a su exigente clientela.
texts.en:
Señora Merarda is married to señor Cresenciano Mongelos, who works as a brick maker. The couple has 2 children and live in the Jazmin neighborhood, about three kilometers from the city of Tobati.

Doña Merarda began her own her own micro-enterprise in 2001, with a small amount of capital she had at her disposal. Thanks to hard work and the quality of her products she has formed a customer-base.

Doña Merarda is a very self-sacrificing person. She attends to her business seven days a week in order to satisfy the needs of her customers. The loan she is applying for is to buy merchandise such as sugar, yerba mate, noodles, baked goods, eggs, and flour, among other things, and in this way offer variety to her demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of merchandise such as sugar, yerba mate, noodles, baked goods, eggs, and flour, among other things

loans.name: Nori

texts.es:
Nori, de 32 años, es una madre muy amorosa, vive en su propia casa junto a sus 2 hijos: Joaquín de 13 y Milagros de 10 años, a quienes desea dar unos buenos estudios. El puesto de Nori está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), ella se dedica a la venta de cubrecamas para bebés, las cuales trae desde las ciudades de Tacna y Desaguadero, ya que es ahí donde llegan los nuevos modelos y es debido a estas novedades que su puesto es muy concurrido.

Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus vecinas de venta y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en el mercado, lleva 10 años realizando es actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que levantarse en la madrugada para abrir su puesto de venta, ya que la gente acostumbra ir de compras muy temprano. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda de ropa en la cual pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.

Este es el sexto préstamo de Nori con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, puesto que no quiere perjudicar a las demás socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por la alegría que le pone al grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Nori, 32, is a loving mom who lives in her own home with her two children, Joaquín, 13, and Milagros, 10, to whom she would like to give a good education. Nori's stall is located in the San José market (a very important market in the city of Juliaca). She sells baby bedspreads that she brings from the cities of Tacna and Desaguadero, where the new models arrive. Because of the novelty of her bedspreads, her stall is very popular. What she likes most about her job is chatting with the ladies in the neighboring stalls and finding out about what is happening in the market. Nori has been in this business for 10 years; the most difficult part of her job is getting up in the morning to open her stall for customers, as they tend to shop in the very early hours of the day. In the future, Nori would like to have a clothing store from which to provide better service to her customers. This is Nori's sixth loan with Kiva partner MFP; she is determined to pay her installments on time to avoid troubling the other members of her communal bank, where she is loved for the joy with which she infuses the group. With the PEN 1,500 she is requesting, she will buy more products in order to better equip her stall.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying products

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is 27 years old and single. She has two children, a boy and a girl, and they attend school. As a single mother she works very hard to provide for her children, especially for their education and their shelter, as well as paying the bills.

Martha is a food vendor. She prepares and sells maize porridge in the community where she lives. Her porridge is enjoyed by many people for breakfast. She prepares and sells it very hot through hawking. She has been in business for three years, taking care of her family.

She requests the loan to buy bags of maize, sugar, bread, cartons of milk and so on to prevent a price hike.

loans.use: To buy maize, sugar, firewood etc.

loans.name: Julia Beatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Julia Beatriz C. O. se dedica al comercio, tiene una pulperia desde hace varios años, siendo su negocio de los primeros que se establecieron en Trojes. Julia es nativa de Oropoli y en busca de fuentes de trabajo para mejorar su situacion economica es como ella y su esposo llegan a esta zona caracterizada por ser una zona apta para la ganaderia, caficultura y agricultura. Estas actividades son las mas fuertes de esta zona.
La sra. C. y esposo tambien se dedican a la ganaderia pues tiene una pequeña finca de café y ganado, con mucho esfuerzo y fe han logrado superarse y sacar adelante a su familia
necesita al credito para surtir mas su negocio donde tenga de todo un poco de tal manera no dejar al cliente irsele sin comprar nada.
texts.en:
Señora Julia Beatriz C. O. has had a grocery store for several years. This was one of the first businesses that was established in Trojes. Julia is a native of Oropoli and while searching for a job to improve their economic situation, she and her husband arrived at this area that is characterized by being good for raising livestock, growing coffee, and agriculture. These activities are the most popular in the area. Señora C. and her husband also raise livestock and have a small coffee farm. With a lot of effort and faith, they have managed to improve their situation and to take care of their family. She needs this credit to supply her business where she has a little bit of everything, so she doesn't want her customers to leave her store without buying anything

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cereal, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, butter, oil, margarine, soup, sauces, pastas, bread, soft drinks, churros, and cookies.

loans.name: Anagonou

texts.fr: A. Anagonou est née en 1963 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Anagonou vit à Cadjèhoun, à Cotonou depuis sa naissance. Mariée à ALLIMENTIN Norbert un maçon, Anagonou est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés. Anagonou  a un autre enfant à charge, en plus de ses deux enfants. Le couple vit ensemble à Cadjèhoun, avec leurs enfants. Anagonou vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pour y parvenir, Anagonou vend depuis une douzaine d’année, des racines de plantes (médicaments traditionnels) et également des cuire dents de façon ambulante. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Anagonou s’approvisionne. Anagonou a obtenu déjà deux crédits à ALIDé et les a bien remboursés. C’est dans l’optique d’augmenter son fonds de roulement et d’agrandir son activité que Anagonou sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Anagonou A. was born in 1963 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Since her birth, she's been living in Cadjèhoun, in Cotonou. She's married to Norbert ALLIMENTIN, a mason, and she's the mother of two school-attending children. Anagonou has another child to support, in addition to her own. The couple lives together in Cadjèhoun with their children. Anagonou helps her husband with the family expenses. In order to do so, she's been selling, for about twelve years, plant roots (traditional medicine) as well as "cuire dents" (wooden chewing sticks) as an ambulant saleswoman. She gets her supplies in Dantokpa, an international market in Benin. She already benefited from two loans from Kiva's partner, Alidé, and repaid them without problems. In order to bolster her working capital and expand her business, she's seeking her third loan from Alidé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plant roots (traditional medicine) and "cuire dents" (wooden chewing sticks)

loans.name: Pony

texts.en:
Pony R. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes in the market and is requesting a loan to stock charcoal to sell. Pony is 37 years old and is married to a husband who is a soldier. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a big retail shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations.

BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: stock charcoal to sell

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Kim Sreymach, 26, is married and lives with a school-aged child and her husband in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. She is engaged in the agriculture sector  growing morning glory plants, earning a gross income of US $14 per day. Her husband is employed as a construction worker, earning an income of US $4 per day to help cover the family expenses. Kim and her family members are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, Kim is asking for a loan of US $1200 to purchase morning glory seeds to expand her farming. She hopes that this loan to invest in her farming will help her family to generate more income and to save more money for the future of the child. This is her first loan from CREDIT MFI, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy morning glory seeds

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther D. sells ready-made ladies tops and skirts as well as secondhand bed sheets in Abura, a suburb of Cape Coast, near the bus stop. She is single and has received junior high education. She has been in business for the past seven years. Esther uses her income to pay for food and clothing as well as to pay the electricity bills and rent. Esther will use her loan to purchase bales of bed sheets, jeans trousers and ladies tops to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esther plans to save for future eventualities.

loans.use: To purchase bales of bed sheets, jeans trousers and ladies tops

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa A. is 50 years old and married to a policeman. She has six school-aged children. Elisa is currently in the business of selling rice, beans and posho (a hot, sticky dough made from maize or cassava) at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and rice to sell. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement.

About BRAC
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted at returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock bags of beans and rice to sell

loans.name: Euloge

texts.fr: Né le 11 mars 1965 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du BENIN, K. Euloge vit depuis bientôt 10 ans à Abokicodji, un quartier de Cotonou, capitale économique du BENIN. Marié à HODONOU Irène, une ménagère et couturière,  Euloge est père de 2 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. La famille vit ensemble et le couple assure les charges familiales. Euloge a fréquenté l’école jusqu’à l’université. Mais depuis une quinzaine d’année, Euloge mène comme activité la vente de fournitures de bureau  dans sa boutique size à Abokicodji. C’est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin que Euloge fait ses achats. C’est un ancien client de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu cinq crédits auprès de l’institution. Ces cinq crédits ont été tous bien remboursés. La clientèle de Euloge s’accroît au jour le jour et il n’arrive plus à satisfaire tous ses clients. C’est pour renforcer son activité et satisfaire les nombreuses demandes de sa clientèle, que Euloge sollicite un sixième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Euloge K. was born on March 11, 1965 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. For almost 10 years he has been living in Abokicodji, a neighborhood of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. He is married to Irene Hodonou, a homemaker and seamstress. Euloge is the father of two children all attending school. The family lives together and the couple provides for the family’s expenses. Euloge attended school up to University level. However, for the last 15 years he has been selling office supplies in his store located in Abokicodji. Euloge gets his goods at Dantokpa, international market of Benin. He is a previous ALIDé client; he has already obtained five loans from the institution. These five loans have all been fully reimbursed. Euloge’ s clientele expands more and more each day and he can no longer meet the needs of all his customers. In order to bolster his activity and to satisfy the many demands of his customers, Euloge is requesting a sixth loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of office supplies.

loans.name: Solade

texts.en:
K. sells drinks and foodstuffs like beans, corn, tomatoes, pepper, 'gari' (cassava couscous), rice, and yam flour. She buys in large quantity and sells retail. She is very hard-working. On days she buy her goods from the market for her shop, she leaves her home as early as 5 am to enable her to get goods to buy. She has been in the business for ten years and with this she has been able to help her husband in providing for the family. K. hopes to improve and expand her business in future.

She is requesting a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell. K. is 36 years old, married and blessed with two children. She appreciative to all KIVA lenders for their support.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio Cesar E. es un señor risueño, trabajador, horrado, con un buen sentido del humor y optimista. Este señor de 63 años aun recuerda como si fuera ayer como 1960 aprendió el proceso de la realización de cazado según comento el empezó con lo más mínimo pero con el tiempo se fue especializando y luego decidió poner su propio Taller de Calzado.

En este le ha ido muy bien y tiene bastantes solicitudes es por ello que necesita del crédito para comprar la materia prima como Brasil, azulón, cuero, pega, plantilla, hilos, suelas, clavos etc. para la producción de zapatos y sandalias artesanales.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar E. is an agreeable, hard-working, honest, optimistic man with a good sense of humor. He is 63 years old and remembers 1960, when he learned to make shoes, as if it were yesterday. He tells us that he started out with the barest minimum skills but, in time, began to specialize and eventually set up his own shoe shop. He has done well with it and has many orders. This is why he needs financing to buy raw materials like: leather, soles, adhesive, thread, nails, etc. to make artesanal shoes and sandals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoemaking supplies and raw materials.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac M. is thirty-four years old, is married, and has three children. He engages in boda-boda (a motorcycle fitted with a tailor-made seat over the rear wheel) transport. He runs this business in the Kimbo area at Thika. Thika is in the central Kenya and is known for the large-scale production of pineapples.

Isaac has been in this business for the last two years. He says that the major challenge in this kind of business is the high cost of maintenance of the motorbikes. He says that the business is good, regardless of the challenges, and that is why he is using his loan of Kes 20,000 to buy another motorbike.

Isaac plans that in the future he will buy more motorbikes which will improve his income in a big way. He is a very hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike

loans.name: Chithra

texts.en:
Chithra is a 43-year old woman living with her sister in the town of Hikkaduwa in southern Sri Lanka.  Chithra is divorced and has no children.

Chithra makes carpets, a business she started after the devastating tsunami in 2004.  Chithra hopes to be a self-sufficient woman, as she lost everything in the tsunami and is working hard to support herself.

Chithra has requested a 30,000-LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka, which she will use to buy a new machine to improve her carpet business.  This will be her third loan from BRAC to supply capital for the carpet business and she hopes to continue to see success.  She is appreciative of BRAC providing her a loan to help her expand her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for her carpet business

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is 21 years old and single. Emmanuel lives with his parents. He owns a small business of selling different kinds of products such as beer, rice, and soap. This is second year successful in his business. His business is fruitful in his region. His business is open from 6:00 a.m. in the morning to 8:00 p.m. in the evening every day except Saturday.

Emmanuel is now requesting second loan from Kiva lenders via vision Finance Company to expand his business by purchasing more products for his shop. After purchasing more products, Emmanuel will be able to satisfy his customers, which will help him to earn more profits. With extra money Emmanuel expects to save, he plans to build his own house and then get married.

loans.use: Expand his business

loans.name: Darnell

texts.en: Some people can see the future clearly through a cloudy, chaotic present. That describes our client Darnell. In the midst of the country's financial situation in early 2008, Darnell saw an opportunity to help others move ahead of chaos and began his business consulting practice. As a consultant to small businesses, Darnell’s advice has helped turn businesses around – instead of losing money, businesses become profitable. What is most important to him about his work is that these businesses can keep people from losing their jobs and even generate more jobs. While Darnell certainly enjoys getting paid to help small business owners improve their companies, helping employees keep their jobs is, in many ways, even better. Darnell is also helping his clients’ businesses become socially responsible by “greening” their practices and missions. He helps the less-advantaged parts of his community through donating "pro bono" (without charge) consulting services. He feels that the education his company imparts to others through its consulting is a worthwhile, meaningful contribution to his community. Darnell will use his ACCION USA loan to hire additional employees, expanding his current staff of five. So many clients have been happy with his services, and have referred other clients to Darnell, that he is now able to grow his business. So while helping other companies grow and expand, Darnell gets to do the same. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To hire additional employees

loans.name: Karina

texts.es:
Karina es una madre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su hijo y a su padre en la ciudad de Zaña, un distrito caracterizado por sus tradiciones y danzas afro – peruanas, sus principales actividades son la agricultura y el comercio, se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de tres años a brindar servicio de alquiler de habitaciones en la ciudad de Zaña, ella alquila diversos ambientes situados en la vivienda donde reside a estudiantes y trabajadores que llegan temporalmente a la ciudad. Los ingresos que le provee este negocio los utiliza en el sostenimiento de su hogar, el cuidado de su padre y la educación de su hijo.

Karina desea habilitar una habitación mas para alquilarla, ya que en los últimos meses la demanda por su negocio ha crecido y actualmente no cuenta con espacio suficiente para mas inquilinos, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le permitan realizar las refacciones necesarias que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Su objetivo es sacar adelante a su familia mediante su negocio. Al tener mas habitaciones habilitadas y disponibles ella percibirá mas ingresos y logrará su meta poco a poco. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos y sus inquilinos la consideran una mujer amable y de confianza.
texts.en:
Karina, 35, lives with her son and her father in the city of Zaña, noted for its traditions and afro-Peruvian dances. Its main activities are farming and commerce. It is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For over three years she has rented out a variety of rooms in her home in Zaña to students and temporary workers who come to the city. Earnings from this business allow her to support her household, care for her father and educate her son. Karina wants to equip another room to rent because demand has grown in the last few months and she currently lacks sufficient space to take in more tenants. This has led to her first loan request of 1000 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa that will make it possible for her to make the necessary improvements to reach her goal. Her objective is to move her family forward through her business. Having more rooms equipped and ready to rent will produce higher income and lead to her reaching her goal gradually. She is considered to be a kind and trustworthy person by her neighbors and her tenants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip a room to rent.

loans.name: Odiljon

texts.ru: Боев Одилчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Возраст, 32 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование средне - специальное, электрик. Работает по профессии. Кроме того занимается производством муки. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 5 лет. Целью кредита является закуп сырья, т.е. пшеницы.
texts.en:
Odiljon B. lives in Tursunzade. He is 32, married, and has 3 children. Odiljon is a professional electrician. In addition he has a mill. Odiljon has been grinding flour for 5 years. He will use this loan to purchase wheat for his mill.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wheat

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice B. is a hairdresser in Abura. She has received senior high education. She is married to a farmer and has three children. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Beatrice has been a hairdresser for three years. Her loan will be used to buy more creams and hair products to sell. She wishes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy an additional hairdryer.

loans.use: To buy more creams and hair products to sell

loans.name: Altannavch

texts.en:
Altannavch D. is 38 years old and lives with her parents and siblings in Baganuur, an outer district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a rented house. Altannavch operates a business where she sews traditional Mongolian and a variety of western clothes. She began her business in 2002 and, since then,  has become established in the local business community. She hopes to become even more successful so that she can provide for her family in the future. 

She is a responsible and honest woman and is requesting a 300,000 MNT loan so that she can purchase a sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Mena

texts.en:
Mena A. sells cassava and plantain at Takoradi market. She has been through junior high school and is married with three children. Her husband is a driver and Mena uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Mena will use the loan to purchase more cassava and plantain to sell and for distribution. With the new revenues from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To purchase more cassava and plantain to sell and for distribution

loans.name: Las Exitosas Group

texts.es:
Doña FRANCISCA I. D. L. tiene 41 años, es casada, tiene 8 hijos, los cuales estan a su cargo y se
dedica a la elaboracion D. telas y fajas D. mostacias, tipicos D. la region, para la venta por mayor y menor,
actividad que viene realizando desD. hace 2 años atrás y con el afan D. mejorar su calidad D. y la D. su
familia deciden organizarse con otras vecinas D. la comunidad para solicitar un credito que les servira para
incrementar el capital D. cada persona, y así generar mas ingresos para cada familia, teniendo en cuenta que 
las integrantes del grupo se dedican a varias clases D. actividades productivas como: Elaboracion D. fajas D.
mostacias, y venta D. mostacia, el cuales los venden en Santa Clara la Laguna, Solola, esperan obtener mejores ganancias para el desarrollo D. la comunidad donD. residen.
texts.en:
Doña Francisca I. D. L. is 41 years old, married, and has eight children who are dependent on her. She makes beaded fabrics and skirts, which are traditional for this region, and sells them in bulk and in smaller quantities. Francisca started this business two years ago and wants to improve the quality of her work. Along with some family members, she decided to join with other neighbors in the community so that they could request a loan that would help everyone increase their capital. This would allow them to generate more income for their respective families.

The members of the group have different types of business activities such as making beaded skirts and selling beaded fabrics. These products are sold in Santa Clara La Laguna, which is in the Department of Solola. They hope to obtain better earnings so that they can develop the community in which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to acquire materials used in making beaded fabrics

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Mary C., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called God Is Able. She is 50 years old, married, and has seven children ages 14 to 33. She was not able to attend school due to lack of financial support. 


For 30 years, she has been selling rice and palm oil in Red Light Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 5,000 LRD portion of this 25,000 LRD group loan to buy more bags of rice and gallons of palm oil. She describes herself as a hard-working woman whose dream is to improve her business and continue her education.

loans.use: To buy more rice and palm oil

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: La señora Maria Ester P. M. tiene la edad de 38 años, es casada del barrio de San Caralampio, ella y su esposo se dedican  al comercio de ropa, calzado y zapatos, tienen más de 7 años de experiencia de ganarse el sustento diario de esta manera, y es por esta razón que solicitan un  préstamo para la compra de un mayor inventario de mercadería tal como, ropa, calzado, cosmeticos, en si productos para uso personal que gracias a su experiencia tiene locaxlizado su M. meta, esta inversion le permitira un aumento en las ventas esto a beneficio de sus dos hijos pequeños que actualmente estudian la escuela primaria, pero pronto entraran a la universidad y esperan tener los recursos económicos para poder subsistir a los gastos, y ofrecerles a sus hijos, mejores condiciones económicas y la tranquilidad como padre de familia de apoyar a sus hijos en el alcance de sus metas y/o sueños que los determina como persona.
texts.en:
Maria Ester P. M. is 38 years old, is married, and lives in the San Caralampio neighborhood.  She and her husband sell clothing and shoes, and have more than seven years’ experience earning a living in this way.  They are asking for this loan so that they can invest in merchandise, such as clothing, shoes, and cosmetics; in other words, personal use products.  Thanks to their experience, they have found their target market.

This investment will allow them to increase their sales and benefit their young children who currently attend elementary school but will be attending university before they know it.  They want to have the adequate financial resources to be able to pay the cost.  As parents, they also want to be able to offer their children better economic conditions, peace of mind, and help them reach their goals and/or dreams.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya. She has been farming for the last ten years and employs one farmhand. Her main products are milk, maize, vegetables and eggs which she sells at the local market. Esther is 38 years old. She is married with six children who are between the ages of 3 and 14. Five of the children are currently attending school.

Esther has requested this loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings through Juhudi Kilimo to expand her poultry project. She hopes that the extra income from this project will help her improve the well-being of her family. Her biggest challenge has been poultry diseases. In five years' time, she hopes to have expanded her trade to become the major supplier of locally produced eggs at the market.

loans.use: To expand her poultry project

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Ayudanos Señor  lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Ivania U. de 40 años inicio hace un año vendiendo verduras en el mercado de san Judas actualmente puso su pequeña verdulería y trucha en su casa. Ella sueña con hacer más grande su negocio y seguir mejorando.
Los integrantes del grupo son Mariana Isabel A. Godinez de 53 años tiene una carnicería desde hace tres años y Aurelia Z. de 20 años vende carne desde hace un año. Ellas invertirán el crédito en sus negocios para mejorar el negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
The Ayudanos Señor group is made up of three hard working people, one of whom is  40 year old Ivania U.. A year ago she began selling vegetable in the San Judas market. Today she has a small vegetable and personal care goods shop in her home. Her dream is to grow her business and continue improving.

The members of the group are Mariana Isabel A. Godinez, age 53 who has had a butcher shop for 3 years, and Aurelia Z., age 20, who has been selling meat for the last year. They will invest the loan in their businesses to get ahead. 
.

loans.use: Vegetable and personal care goods (hair ties, costume jewelry earings etc)

loans.name: Maria Sabina

texts.en:
Maria is forty-eight years old.  She is a single mother and lives with her aging father and one of her sisters in the village of Los Mercedes Partidor in the region of Piura in northern Peru.  The family owns their own home and runs a small farm nearby.

Maria’s father is the owner of the farm.  She works on the land, raising rice, mango and limes.  She has spent the majority of her life as a farm laborer on this land and on other parcels in the area.  It is a productive region and provides the necessary resources to support the family.

The family currently needs a loan in order to purchase additional seed, fertilizer and pesticides in order to initiate a new crop of rice and improve the crop yield on their property.  Maria is taking out the loan and the father has signed as a guarantor.  They hope to be able to improve their lives and opportunities for Maria’s son by continuing to manage the farm and improve productivity.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Juana Rosa

texts.es: La Señora Juana vive en la zona de Pasankeri, zona ubicada en una de las laderas de la ciudad de La Paz, ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza  y Refrescos en las fiestas de provincias y los fines de semana en la popular zona del Gran Poder, lamentablemente tuvo que hacerse cargo de toda su familia por el fallecimiento de su esposo, con mucho esfuerzo logró salir adelante sola y con tres hijos a su cargo, también poco a poco logró comprar su casa donde vive actualmente, ella es una persona que administra bien sus gastos y para tener mayores ingresos construyó cuartos para ponerlos en alquiler, la señora es puntual y responsable con sus pagos. El crédito solicitado es para la refacción de su domicilio y necesita comprar material de construcción, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the district of Pasankeri which is located on one of the mountainsides of the ciy of La Paz.  She sells beer and soft drinks at provincial fiestas and also on weekends in the popular 'Gran Poder' district.  Unfortunately, Juana has had to take care of her family herself since her husband died.  With a lot of hard work she has managed to get ahead on her own with three children in her care.  She has also managed to buy her own home where she currently lives.

Juana is a woman who knows how to manage her expenses.  In order to make more income she built rooms that she could rent out.  She is punctual and responsible in making her loan payments.  She is requesting this loan to refurbish her home and she needs to buy building materials.  She is grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To refurbish her home

loans.name: Santos Genaro

texts.es:
El Señor Santos, tiene 75 años de edad, reside en Joateca, departamento de Morazán, vive con sus cinco hijos de 22, 19, 18, 16 y 12 años de edad, los primeros hijos ya son bachilleres y los otros tres aun estudian, posee una tienda donde ofrece artículos de primera necesidad que atiende desde hace 30 años, sus hijos le ayudan a vender.
Don Santos solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos que son parte de lo que ofrece en su negocio como verduras, frijoles, arroz y azúcar, esta inversión ha planeado hacerla por medio del préstamo para darle mayor estabilidad y ganar más clientela.
Sueña con un negocio estable que contribuya a la superación de sus hijos y les permita terminar sus estudios y ser profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos is 75 and lives in Joateca, department of Morazan with his five children, ages 22, 19, 18, 16 and 12, the older kids finished high school and the other three are still in school.  For 30 years he's had a store where he offers first necessity products, his children help him sell. 

Mr. Santos requests a loan to buy products that he sells at his store such as vegetables, beans, rice and sugar, this investment has been planned through a loan to give him more stability and get more clients.  He dreams with a stable business that contributes to the betterment of his family and allows them to finish school and be professionals in the future.

loans.use: Buy vegetables, beans, rice and sugar

loans.name: Danny Daniel

texts.es:
Danny tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Illimo, un distrito agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace varios años a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos, esta actividad fue enseñada por su padre y actualmente, debido al tiempo que tiene trabajando en el rubro, conoce a la perfección el manejo de su negocio. Danny cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y su negocio es bastante conocido en la zona. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante a su familia.

Danny desea alquilar una parcela de terreno en donde tiene planeado instalar un horno que le permita aumentar su producción y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Danny is thirty-three years old, married and lives with his wife and their two children in the Illimo, an agricultural and commercial district that belongs to Lambayeque province. It is located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

For many years now, his work has been the manufacture and sale of bricks, which he was taught by his father. Currently, due to the time he has spent working in this area, he knows how to run his business perfectly. Danny relies on an already established clientele and his business is well known in the area. The income he makes from this activity helps him and his family to get ahead. 

Danny wishes to rent a parcel of land, on which he plans to install an oven to help him increase his production and increase his income. Because of this, he thinks it's advisable to request a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his objective.

loans.use: To rent a parcel of land where he plans to install an oven which will allow him to increase production of bricks and to make more income.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont des femmes mariées qui vivent avec leur mari et enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 33 ans, 2 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Timbabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage, elles font le commerce de bétail, de condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                   
Les femmes du groupe Badenya sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, des chèvres, des moutons, des condiments et de tubercules.                                                                                    
NAH BAH C. compte s’approvisionner en bétail avec les éleveurs du village et environnants. Elle effectue ses ventes sur place et pendant les jours de foires, au marché de Dioïla, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer le prêt, prendre en charge les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture,  aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are married women who live in traditional families with their husbands and children. They average 33 years of age and two children each. They live in the village of Timbabougou, prefecture of Dioïla, in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
They know one another as neighbors and through ties of kinship. They sell cattle, condiments and tubers.

This is the first group loan for the members of Badenya. They will use it to buy goats, sheep, condiments and tubers.

NAH BAH C. plans to purchase livestock from local breeders. She  carries out her sales locally, and also at the Dioïla market on fair days, for cash and credit to a clientele of both men and women.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will be used to repay the loan and pay for healthcare, food, and tuition, the remainder to be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas M., 50 years old, owns a small shop located in the local market in Kompong Thom Province. To earn a living, Meas M. sells soft drinks and rice soup in the morning and she sells soup for evenings. She typically makes around $4 of profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable living. She is a widow and now she lives with her four children in her own house. Her husband died of illness for a few years ago. 

From step to step, Meas M. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. To earn more extra income, Meas M. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital to buy additional goods such as soft drinks, sweets, snack foods, and other items for sale which will allow her to increase her profit. This is why she has decided to take out a loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks, sweets, snack foods, and other items for sale

loans.name: Honeylyn's Group

texts.en:
Honeylyn A. is from the village of Manla Sapang, Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Honeylyn is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 'Marigold'.

Honeylyn is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Honeylyn owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Honeylyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Honeylyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Honeylyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Honeylyn is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Honeylyn from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 19 years old and lives with three family members. In 2008, Mohamad opened his own food market in his village, where competition is minimal. He is well known and has an excellent reputation.

Mohamad is requesting a $3000 loan to redecorate his shop and increase his inventory. He is planning to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop and increase his inventory

loans.name: Jamshed

texts.en:
A. Jamshed is a married father of two children. He produces different fruits in his garden. To help meet the hard physical labor of his farming work, his elder son is working with him. Fruit growing is the main source of earning income to sustain this family. Jamshed is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.
