This loan will ensure the economic prosperity of this friendly family.

 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. O. is forty-nine years old, married to a businessman, and they have two children aged twenty-three years old and eighteen years old. Her business is located near the Buxton-Kilifi stage in Mombasa, Kenya. Mombasa is the coastal region of Kenya and is well-known for its many tourist attractions, not forgetting the Indian Ocean's white beaches. 

Mary A. O. owns a restaurant in which she has been selling food and drinks to the local people for the last year. She has provided employment to one person. She says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has are financial constraints. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. 

She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy fish and other food items to expand her business. She hopes to be a wholesaler in future. She describes herself as a customer-friendly lady.

loans.use: to buy fish and other food items.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 56 years old and married with 4 children. She works hard to provide for her family. Elena has operated a general store in the Philippines for 30 years and also earns income from vegetable sales. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, sardines, groceries, and other items to sell in her general store.

Elena has previously borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items for her store

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa K. is a single mother of six children. As the sole provider for her family, she makes a living by selling palm oil. First, she purchases the palm fruit (shown in the photograph) and through a process of boiling and filtering, extracts the oil from the fruit.

To increase her income, she is very keen to expand her business. She will use her Kiva loan to purchase more palm fruit so that she can extract more oil for sale. 

The education of her children is of utmost importance to her and her business expansion will help her save up for their future.

loans.use: to purchase more palm fruit so that she can extract more oil for sale

loans.name: Melany

texts.en:
As a married parent of 12 children, Melany R. works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Melany has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Melany is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her sari-sari store business.

 She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more item products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 46 years old.  She is married and has 6 children. 

Erma works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells rice in the Philippines and has been in this business for 10 years.  She also earns additional income from selling timber.  Emma has requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of rice to sell.  

Erma has successfully repaid 17 previous loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: stock more rice to sell

loans.name: La Prosperidad 4 Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth is one of the members of Prosperidad 4 (Prosperity) group. Her group is located in the areas surrounding Santiago, and comprises five entrepreneurs from one of the poorest communities of this large city, dedicated to running small businesses from their houses and by making walking sales.
Elizabeth is a single mother with three children. She is excited to be taking her first loan with Kiva partner, Esperanza. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She sells beauty and cosmetic products by walking and taking them into beauty salons and neighbors' houses. She will use her profits to save and reinvest in her business.
Elizabeth says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house. She enjoys watching television and using the computer. She dreams of having her own house in the near future so that she can stop paying rent. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy beauty and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Armando Daniel

texts.en: Armando is 23 years old and lives in the city of Tulcán in northern Ecuador, along the border with Colombia. He his single and lives with his parents. He has a two-year-old son. Armado is a calm, responsible, and friendly person. He raises pigs and is obtaining this loan to purchase more animals. When he was a child, his mother taught him how to care for animals, and he saw raising animals as a great opportunity to progress. Armando has completed two loan cycles in the past and reports that they helped him increase his sales and income. His goal is to grow professinally and increase his business breeding and selling pigs.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 62 years old and a widow with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Juanita has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines. Juanita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Juanita has been in this business for five years. Juanita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Joram

texts.en:
Joram is a hardworking 34-year-old businessman. He is married and blessed with three children. Two of his children are in school. Joram works as a tailor and supplements his income by renting out houses. His association with Faulu Kenya has enabled him to improve his business. 

Joram is requesting a 60,000 KES loan to buy a sewing machine. Within the next five years, he hopes to grow and expand his business so that he is able to realize his dream of employing other people.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es: El Sr. Cipriano es una persona   responsable  y  muy trabajadora   el  cual   cuenta  con un taller  de carpintería,  el se preocupa  por  ofrecer  el mejor  servicio a sus  clientes , es  por ello que en esta  ocasión requiere realizar  la compra  de  mercancía ya  que   desea   tener   disponible  el  material  para  cuando sus  clientes  le   pidan  algún trabajo  poder   realizarlo  al instante, es  por ello que   ve  en el crédito la posibilidad  obtener  mayores  ingresos y seguir  brindándoles a  sus  clientes  un excelente  servicio.
texts.en: Cipriano is a responsible, very hard working person who has a carpentry shop.  He strives to provide the best service to his customers.  Because of this, on this occasion he’d like to buy merchandise because he wants to have supplies on hand so that when his customers request a job he will be able to do it at once.  He, therefore, sees in the loan the potential to earn higher income and continue offering his customers excellent service.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his carpentry shop.

loans.name: Rakita

texts.en:
Rakita is 42 years old, married and supports seven people in the family. He has been practicing farming for the past six years.

He has been a good client and he repaid his previous loan well; he is applying for his second loan. He plans to use this loan amount to buy maize seeds and fertilizer, and also hire temporary field workers to assist him in planting.

In the future, he hopes to see his children achieve prosperity.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es: Arturo, de 40 años, es un hombre trabajador. Vive en la casa junto a Martha, su esposa desde hace 3 años. Ambos tienen 2 hijos: Jazmín  y Génesis a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la comunidad nativa de Alianza. Su principal trabajo es la enseñanza a personas de la tercera edad, que son analfabetos a los cuales enseña a escribir y leer. Está actividad le proporciona ingresos económicos que son pagados por el estado peruano. Pero en sus tiempos libres se dedica al trabajo en sus terrenos de cultivo. Todas las mañanas, junto a los primeros rayos de sol, camina hasta sus chacras de café, plátano, palta y achiote, las  cuales están a una hora aproximadamente. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es trabajar en 2 lugares a la vez, pues no se abastece de tiempo. Para más adelante, espera comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar sus cultivos, ya que solo posee una hectárea de extensión. Él pertenece al banco comunal “Alianza al progreso” y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues es una regla de su banco comunal. Además agradece al apoyo brindado. Arturo de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de 800 mamones (plantitas de plátanos), que trasplantará en sus terrenos agrícolas y el resto de dinero lo invertirá en los gastos de cultivo.
texts.en:
Arturo, 40, is a hardworking man.  He lives at home with Martha, his wife of three years.  They have two children: Jazmín and Génesis that they care for in their own home located in the indigenous community of Alianza.  His main job is teaching illiterate senior citizens to read and write.  This activity provides him income since it’s paid for by the Peruvian State. 

In his spare time, though, he works on his farmland.  Every morning with the sun’s first rays he heads out to his coffee, banana, avocado and achiote fields which are located about an hour away.  What he most enjoys about his work is tilling the soil, something he does with much dedication.  He’s been in this line of work for 20 years and considers the most difficult part having to work in two places at the same time because there's never enough time.  For later on, he plans to buy new land to expand his crops because he currently has only one hectare.

He belongs to the “Alianza al Progreso” (Alianza toward Progress) communal bank and this is the second MFP loan where he knows that he has to make his installment payments on time because that’s a rule of his communal bank.  Also, he gives thanks for the support received.  If Arturo were to receive your support, he’ll use the requested money to buy 800 banana seedlings that he’ll transplant in his fields.  He’ll use the rest of the money to cover crop maintenance costs.

loans.use: to buy 800 banana plants.

loans.name: Fatimatou

texts.fr:
Fatimatou est une femme âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée à un transitaire. Elle a 2 enfants. 
Fatimatou  travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2009. Elle vend des pagnes et des bazins à toutes les personnes à la maison. Elle achète les pagnes au grand marché de Lomé, au Niger et au Mali.
Fatimatou a requis son premier crédit à WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes et des bazins.
Dans les prochaines années, Fatimatou voudrait étendre son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit rendre sa famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Fatimatou,  29, is married to a dispatcher and has two children. 
 
Fatimatou  has been in sales since 2009. She sells lengths of African print cloth and "damask" cloth to all comers at her house. She buys the cloth in the Grand market in Lomé, in Niger, and in Mali.

Fatimatou has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy more lengths of African print cloth and "damask" cloth. In the coming years, she would like to expand her business. She says that with her profit, she intends to make her family happy.

loans.use: to buy lengths of African print cloth and "damask" cloth.

loans.name: Julieta Del Rosario

texts.es:
Julieta es una señora de 25 años de edad quien vive con su esposo e hijos, en una pequeña comunidad llamada la Trinchera de Pital localizada en la provincia de Alajuela, cuyas principales actividades productivas son la ganadería y la agricultura, donde destaca el cultivo de la pina; siendo estas  comercializadas principalmente en los mercados internacionales. Por esta razón, el desarrollo de la comunidad ha venido creciendo en los últimos anos generando una mayor demanda de productos y servicios brindando mayores oportunidades de trabajo.

Julieta se dedica a creación de prendas, para todo tipo de persona. Ella vende sus costuras a los vecinos de la comunidad, quienes se muestran muy satisfechos por la calidad.

Actualmente Julieta está solicitando un microcrédito de₡600.000 (seiscientos mil colones), para la compra de materiales de costura.

Con esta inversión espera que su microempresa crezca más, para poder atender a mas clientes y ofrecerles mejores prendas. Todo esto ayudara a mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Julieta es socia de la Empresa Comunal de Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, una de las 110 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo préstamo y con el espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico, además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Julieta is 25 years old. She lives with her husband and children in a small community called Trinchera de Pital which is located in the province of Alajuela, a province whose main activities are livestock production and agriculture, with a focus on the cultivation of pineapples which are mainly marketed overseas in international markets. For this reason, community development has been growing in recent years creating an increased demand for products and services providing greater job opportunities.

Julieta makes clothes for every type of person. She sells her garments to residents in the community who are very satisfied with the quality. 

Julieta is currently applying for a small loan of ₡600.000 (six hundred thousand colones) (CRC) to buy material for sewing. With this investment she hopes to grow her small business more, serve more clients and offer them better clothes. All this will help improve her living conditions.

Julieta is a member of the communal bank Mujeres al Éxito de la Trinchera de Pital, one of 110 member organisations of EDESA in Costa Rica.

This will be her second loan and with it she hopes to continue growing both personally and economically as well as actively participating in the communal bank of her community

loans.use: to buy material for sewing.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es: La señora Patricia I. es una mujer trabajadora la cual se dedica a realizar nacatamales. Ella con el credito quiere realizar unas mejoras del local ya que esta muy deteriorado y otra parte invertirlo en productos como maiz, hojas, cerdo y leña.
texts.en: Sra. Patricia I. is a very hardworking woman who makes "nactamales" (a type of Nicarguan tamale). With this loan, she will invest in improvements to her shop, since it has greatly deteriorated, as well as in products such as corn, leaves, pork, and firewood.

loans.use: to purchase pork, corn, potatoes, tomatoes, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jamileth Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Jamileth de 49 años  de edad, trabaja en la clínica como auxiliar de enfermería desde hace 4 años, está solicitando su 4to crédito con el objetivo de mejorar una habitación en su casa ubicada cambiandole el techo que esta en mal estado y esta manera mejorar las condiciones en su hogar y darle mas valor a su propiedad, ademas cuenta con el apoyo económico de su marido que es propietario de un pequeño taller de mecánica el que asume los gastos del hogar. En su barrio es bien reconocida como una persona trabajadora y que ha luchado por su familia hasta sacar adelante sus tres hijos que preparado en la Universidad. Su deseo es tener su casa con buena infraestructura y mantener su familia estable.
texts.en: Jamileth, 49, has worked at the clinic as a nursing assistant for the last four years.  She’s asking for her fourth loan to do some improvements to a room at home replacing its roof that’s in poor condition so that she can improve the condition of her house and increase the value of her property.  Her husband, who owns a small machine shop, helps support her by being responsible for household expenses.  She’s well known in her neighborhood as a hardworking person who has struggled for her family until finally managing to prepare her three children for the university.  Her dream is to have a house with good infrastructure and to keep her family stable.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from coconut wine vending and motorcycle transport. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is married with four children. She is 47 years old and lives in Sto. Nino,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a fisherman. Epifania sells fish to earn a living and has had this business for more than ten years.

Each month she earns Php 5,000. She has requested a loan of Php 10,000 to purchase a pump boat machine to use for fishing.

Epifania is a hardworking, responsible woman who, many years ago, found herself needing to sell seafood to help her husband support the household. She goes out every morning at 5 AM, when her husband comes in from the sea, and she directly sells the catch in her local market or door-to-door in neighborhoods near the market. 

Epifania has been a good member of GDMPC for more than three years. In the future, she is hoping that her business will expand and she can use her  profits for her children's education..

loans.use: To purchase pump boat machine

loans.name: Geoffery

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 25 years old and married to his wife Metrine, who is a business lady. They have no children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport for the past one year with the monthly income of 9,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan term from KADET LTD after successfully repaying the previous loan. Geoffrey will use the loan to service his motorbike. 

With the anticipated profit from his business, he will boost his wife’s business. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for insuring and licensing her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
This is Evangeline, 57, a resident of in Dasmariñas Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Josefino, her business partner and father to their children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evangeline makes a living by operating a Xerox copy machine and selling school supplies other merchandize. She has been in this business for seven years and is very knowledgeable about the preferences of her customers, most of whom are students and young people who buy her products. She earns a minimum of 1,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, she is applying for a loan of PHP 19,000. She will be using the money to buy more school supplies and merchandise that she will sell. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Evangeline dreams of having a successful business over the years. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners which gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional school supplies and other merchandise that she will sell in her business.

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.en: Jeanne is a 53 year old widow. She owns a boutique which she has been running for 4 years. She has requested a loan to purchase more inventory such as soap, cooking oil, and salt to sell. She hopes to use the profits from the business to make savings. She would like to see her business expand in the future.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell like soaps, cooking, oil and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy goats for resale

loans.name: Roman

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal "JUNTOS DE LA MANO"; El banco esta situado en el Distrito de Iscuchaca en la Provincia de Anta perteneciente al Departamento de Cusco.

El socio es la Sr. Roman; ella tiene 40 años de edad, el socio es casado y tiene 1 hijo; el socio  se dedica  a la compra y venta de granos, como trigo, cebada, papa. moraya, entre otros productos. El socio solicita el prestamo en la compra de productos secos.  

El socio sociO agradece el credito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en: Román, 40, is a member of the “Juntos de la Mano” (Together Hand in Hand) communal bank located in Iscuchaca District in Anta Province belonging to Cusco Department.  He’s married and has a son.  He is a grain merchant; he buys and sells wheat, barley, potatoes, and dehydrated potatoes, among other products.  He requests the loan to buy dry goods.  He is grateful for the loan and commits to make his payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy dry goods.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is a 46-year-old woman with two children, a son and a daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling soft drinks. Her husband supports the family by working as a silversmith.

For the past six years, Anh has run a food stall to cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan to buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her to improve her living conditions and allow her to set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in the Nanyuki area of Central province, Kenya. She is a married mother of two children. She owns a tea tree farming business, a business which she has been operating for one year now. The oils extracted from the tea trees are used for cosmetic purposes. She also has been doing farming, mainly planting maize, beans and potatoes. 

She learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group; she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to better her business operations. The main challenge she faces is lack of water.

Elizabeth is applying for a loan of 20,730 Kenya shillings to buy tea tree seedlings for the business. Her extra income from the loan will be added to the savings to expand the agricultural business. Her future plan in five years time is to expand the acreage under tea trees.

loans.use: To buy tea tree seedlings for the business.

loans.name: Aegina

texts.en: Aegina is a 23 year old volunteer Camfed learner guide and an entrepreneur who is running a grocery store, living with her 4 year old son in Mudzi district. Her work involves running a grocery store which she is renting in order to buy food for the family and pay for  rentals. She  volunteers as a Camfed learner guide, where she facilitates life skills sessions with students at the local secondary school, covering active citizenship and personal confidence. This entrepreneur is now requesting KIVA loan to purchase more stock to improve sales. She is planning to further her studies and pay fees for sisters using the profits from the business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to improve sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Elizabeth would like to improve on the quality of her out put by planting hybrid crops which have high yield thus; she wants to buy hybrid seeds.

loans.name: Margaret Lum

texts.en:
Margaret is one of two wives and mother of five children and six step-children. She has received training in “Achuboh” (cooking and retailing food by the roadside), marketing techniques and management skills. She successfully repaid her first two loans and provided lunch to the hungry.

With $600 she plans to increase her business by buying pots, plates, buckets, spoons, firewood, palm-oil, 4 bags of corn, a bag of beans and containers for preservation. She will provide breakfast and lunch to bachelors, day-students, hawkers, laborers and travelers.

She plans to pay her loan in 18 months. The first repayment installment shall be made on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: Cooking supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Óscar

texts.es:
Oscar is married with three children of 5, 14 and 20 years of age. He used to works as a chef in a restaurant in the United States, but found being away from his family very difficult, and therefore decided to return to Mexico to be with his wife and children. Thanks to 20 years of experience as a chef and his good work he managed to find a job working as a chef in a hotel, but his income was not enough to support his family and for his children’s education. To earn some extra money he started his own business doing catering for special events.

Little by little people have got to know him and his client base has grown. He now needs a loan of $150 to buy the materials he needs to meet the needs of his clients. He will repay the loan over a period of 3 months. You can be an important part of the development of this business and in the wellbeing of Oscar and his family. They thank you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Óscar tiene es casado y tiene tres hijos, de 5, 14 y 20 años de edad. Él trabajaba como cocinero en un restaurante de Estados Unidos, pero el estar lejos de su familia era una carga muy difícil de soportar por lo que decidió regresar a México, al lado de su esposa e hijos. Gracias a los 20 años que tiene de experiencia en la cocina y su buen trabajo logró conseguir empleo en el restaurante de un hotel, pero su ingreso no era suficiente para el sostén y educación de su familia, para obtener un ingreso extra emprendió su propio negocio con la elaboración de banquetes para eventos especiales.

Poco a poco, se ha dado a conocer y ha logrado incrementar sus clientes, ahora requiere de un préstamo de $ 150 dólares que empleará en la compra de insumos que necesita para poder cubrir todos los pedidos que tiene, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y en el bienestar de Óscar y su familia, ellos agradecen mucho tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: To buy products/Compra de insumos

loans.name: Gloria Amada

texts.es:
Hello. My name is Gloria Amada F.. I sell cheese pastries and fried pork chunks with beans, which is a traditional dish in my country and are very tasty. This dish is served with cabbage, tomatoes, shred-ed cheese and peppers. I have many customers because my pastries are very appreciated in my neighborhood. I have been in this business for four and a half years. I use the business' income to help my husband cover the cost of raising our children.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Hola, mi nombre es Gloria Amada F., me dedico a la venta de pupusas de quesillo, chicarron y con frijoles. esta es como mida tipiaca de mi pais las cuales son deliciosas, como a compañante llevan rrepocho, tomate, queso rallado, y chile. Tengo bastantes clientes ya que son muy famosas mis pupusa en mi vecindario. Este negocio lo tengo hace 4 años imedio. Con este negocio ayudo a mi esposo con los gastos familiares que tenemos mensualmente de nuestros hijos.

loans.use: Compra de masa para hacer pupusas, quesillos, choriso, frijoles aceite, platos, servillestas. Repollo, tomates, cebollas y chiles.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria is 25 years old and has four children. She has installed a grocery store in her house where she sells salt, sugar, pasta, oil, soap, etc. She belongs to the group called Stars 4 together with Estela Vázquez Paciencia (who has a grocery store) and Maria Cristina Gómez Espinosa (who sells vegetables). Estela and Maria will buy a supply of merchandise to supply their businesses and Maria Cristina will buy mayonaise, salsas, corn, vegetable pears, and with this they hope to increase their sales and increase their earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA tiene 25 años, cuatro hijos. Ella tiene instalada en su casa una tienda de abarrotes en donde vende: sal, azúcar, pastas, aceite, jabón, etc., pertenece al grupo llamado Stars 4 junto con doña Estela Vázquez Paciencia (tienda de abarrotes) y doña Maria Cristina Gómez Espinosa (venta de verduras). Estela y Maria compraran un surtido de mercancía para abastecer sus negocios y Maria cristina comprara mayonesa, salsas, elotes y chayotes, con eso esperan incrementar sus ventas y obtener mas ganancias.

loans.use: Purchase groceries and vegetables

loans.name: Virginia Yolanda

texts.es:
Virginia is a widow who started her business 60 years ago. She started with CS$20,000.00 (Cordobas) in capital which was in part savings she accumulated little by little with the intent of setting up her business, another part was her husband’s contribution, and the last third was from a loan.

Her locale when she started was in mediocre condition, it was closed with cinder blocks and wood and had a dirt floor. Today it is made of concrete with a brick floor and has display cases and enough tools to perform her work.

She’s worked with CEPRODEL for 4 years and has a record of 16 credits. She says that “They have helped increase my inventory and improve my furnishings.”

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva Volunteer.

VIRGINIA ES UNA SEÑORA VIUDA QUE COMIENZA SU NEGOCIO HACE 60 AÑOS, EMPEZÓ CON UN CAPITAL DE CS$20,000.00 (CÓRDOBAS) LOS CUALES PARTE ERAN AHORROS QUE RECOGIÓ POCO A POCO CON EL FIN DE INSTALAR SU NEGOCIO, OTRA PARTE ERA APORTE DE DE ESPOSO Y UNA TERCERA PARTE ERA PRESTADO.

SU LOCAL CUANDO INICIO TENIA CONDICIONES REGULARES ESTABA CERRADO CON BLOQUES Y MADERA Y EL SUELO ERA NATURAL (TIERRA). ACTUALMENTE EL LOCAL ES DE CONCRETO, CON PISO DE LADRILLO, Y CUENTA CON VITRINAS Y SUFICIENTES HERRAMIENTAS PARA REALIZAR SU TRABAJO.

TRABAJA CON CEPRODEL DESDE HACE 4 AÑOS Y SU RECORD ES DE 16 CREDITOS. ELLA EXPRESA QUE "LE HA AYUDADO A CRECER EN SU INVENTARIO Y A MEJORAR SU MOBILIARIO"

loans.use: Purchase raw materials (Retail sales of saddles, horseshoes, nails for horseshoes, stirrups, shoe soles, and bags)

loans.name: Atikah

texts.en: Atikah, 32 years old, and her husband E. are in gardening business - they grow flowers and plants for sale. The couple is usually able to earn US$12 a week. Atikah is a member of MBK and is asking for a loan of US$125 to help expand her gardening business, so that she and her husband can increase their income and pay for their children's education. Atikah is willing to repay the loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of a gardening business

loans.name: Zaman

texts.en: Mr. Zaman is a 31-year-old farmer who has one milk cow. He is married and has two children. He recently started selling diary products. When he started his business in 1999, he was selling meat in the Saatli bazaar. Zaman lives in in the southern Azerbaijani village of Mollavazi in the Saatli region. Zaman is going to purchase one milk cow to expand his dairy production and one calf to begin selling meat to the local bazaar trades. The estimated cost for one milk cow is $500 and for a calf is $200. He plans to pay the loan back in 12 months

loans.use: To buy calves

loans.name: Robiya

texts.en: Robiya A. lives in the Asht region and she is married and has six children. Mrs. A. works in a collective farm, but she has a home business of raising and selling livestock. She also makes yarn and warm socks and has done so for ten years. Now, Mrs. A. is applying to KIVA for a business development loan of $625.00 to purchase special yarn-making equipment.

loans.use: To purchase special yarn-making equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase provisions and fruit

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa E. sells fruit. She is married and has three children. Her business is doing very well and she wants to increase her sales.

She is asking for $125 as additional capital to buy more fruit for sale.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Kodzo Essianyo

texts.fr:
Mr. Kodzo Essianyo D. is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. He works as a photographer to earn money to provide for his family’s needs. He takes photos of weddings and other events in Kpalimé, which is one of Togo’s largest cities. His main business is taking photos for school ID cards (as seen in the photo). He hopes to use this loan to expand his business by buying another camera and some film. With the profits he will make from selling his photos, he will improve his family’s situation enormously.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur Kodzo Essianyo D. est âgé de 39 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants. Pour gagner de l’argent pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il est photographe. Il prend les photos des marriages et autres ceremonies à Kpalimé, une des plus grandes villes du Togo. Son activité la plus grand est de prendre les photos pour les cartes scolaires (on voit les cartes dans la photo.) Avec ce crédit il espere elargir ses activites de en achetant un autre camera et du filme. Avec les profits qu’il va dégager dans la vente de ses photos, il va énormément améliorer les conditions de sa famille.

loans.use: To expand his photographic services

loans.name: Santos' Group

texts.en:
Santos is married and has a child. She has been selling lingerie for 20 years and her business gradually grew.

L. is married and has 3 school-age children. She sells clothes in a shopping arcade. Before that, she sold clothes from a trolley. Now she would like to pursue another business in the shopping arcade so as to supplement her income.

Luz is married and has 3 children. She has been selling shoes for women for a year now, and before that, she sold clothes. Her major issue is the lack of capital to purchase merchandise. Later she would like to have her own store.

Santos, L., and Luz are soliciting loans of 1600 soles (about US$ 560), 400 soles (US$ 140), and 1000 soles (about $ 350) respectively to purchase merchandise for supplying their businesses.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for supplying their businesses

loans.name: Mirali

texts.ru:
Mirali H. lives in the city of Nurek. He is 24 years old and single. He is in the business of raising cattle. He would like to obtain a loan in order to purchase feed for his animals. The loan will allow him to provide the calves with high quality feed. With good food the animals gain weight faster. This will allow raising animals faster. Mirali plans to repay the loan within a 10 months period.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Холов Мирали проживает в городе Нурек. Возраст 24 года , не женат. Занимается разведением крупно-рогатого скота. Хочет получить кредит для закупки комбикормов для своих животных. Это поможет обеспечить бычков качественным кормом. Кроме того при хорошем питании животные быстро набирают в весе . Это будет способствовать быстрому темпу откормки скота. Погасить кредит Мирали планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Zafar

texts.ru: Зиеев Зафар житель города Яван. Женат и имеет троих детей. 12 лет занимается торговлей ковров , одеял и других принадлежностей постельного белья.Зафар является единственным кормильцем семьи. Кроме жены и детей с ним живут его родители и братья с сестрами. Поэтому ему приходится очень много работать для того , чтобы обеспечить семью. По этой причине он решил получить кредит и использовать для приобретения автомобиля  и использовать его для перевозки товара. . Это поможет ему развивать бизнес. Погасить кредит планирует в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Zafar Z. lives in the city of Yavan. He is married and has three children. For the past 12 years he has been selling rugs, blankets, and other pieces of bed linen. Zafar is the sole provider for his family. In addition to his wife and children, his parents, brothers, and sisters also live with him. This means he must work a lot to support the family. Because of this he decided to take out a loan and use it to purchase a vehicle to use for transporting goods. This will help him develop the business. The loan will be repaid over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and resell clothes, undergarments and boxer shorts

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es madre soltera, tiene 36 años, sus padres son de la tercera edad, con quienes vive, y trabaja para ellos.  Se dedica al cultivo de sus tierras, casi toda su vida ha tenido que laborar la tierra, es la única forma de trabajo que conoce, las chacras que posen son en zonas muy altas, donde tiene que esperar la temporada de lluvia, pero ahora piensa alquilar chacras que puedan acceder al regadío. Lo que mas le agrada del trabajo que realiza es tener muy cultivado sus chacras y no permitir nada de hierbas, para que de ese modo produzca bien.  En esta oportunidad ella ha sembrado de 2 arrobas de habas y 20 sacos de semilla de papa. La dificultad que tiene es que a veces que no se abastece en cultivar sus tierras, por lo que también tiene que ir a pastar ovejas. Los precios de los abonos que han subido demasiado y cuando no le alcanza  para comprar, tiene que vender sus carneros.  Maria trabaja también para poder educar a sus menores hijos que están estudiando.  El dinero que ella está solicitando es para fumigar sus campos, de ese modo poder cosechar  bien y llevarlos sus productos al mercado, tiene la esperanza que el precio de mercado se mantenga igual hasta el día que le toque cosechar. Y así poder sembrar en mayor cantidad, aunque tenga que alquilar tierras.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother and is 36 years old. She lives with and works for her parents, who are of a mature age. She cultivates their land. Almost all of her life, she has had to work on the land. It is the only form of work that she knows. The farms are in areas that are at a very high altitude, where she has to wait for the rainy season, but now she plans to rent farms that are irrigated. What she like most about this work is to have very cultivated farms, without any weeds, so that she will have good yields. She has sown 2 sacks of beans and 20 sacks of potato seeds. Sometimes, cultivating her land does not supply her with enough. As a result, she also has to graze sheep. The prices of fertilizer have increased a lot, and when she can’t buy it, she has to sell the mutton. Maria also works so that she can educate her young children, who are studying. The money that she is requesting is to spray her fields, so that she can harvest her crops and bring them to the market. She hopes the prices in the market will stay the same until the day that she harvests, so that can sow more, even though she has to rent land.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To spray her fields for cultivation

loans.name: Roger Augusto

texts.es: El señor Roger Mújica es productor joven ya que a su corta edad mantiene solo a toda su familia. Trabaja en un pequeño taller en el cual fabrica blue jeans es el propietario del taller, es por ello que lo consideR. un verdadero emprendedor, trabajando arduamente durante todo el día con el sueño de que su negocio prospere.Ingreso a  la institución  el año 2005 por referencia de un familiar quien también es cliente antiguo de la institución.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Mújica is a young producer. At his young age, he alone maintains his entire family. He works and is the owner of a small workshop that makes blue jeans. It is for this reason we consider him a true entrepreneur, working hard every day with the hope that his store will prosper. He began working with this institution in 2005 when he was referenced by one of his family members, whom is also a client of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Lucia Franzese, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Florinda Agustina

texts.es: Doña Florinda Agustina de 33 años de edad, es casada de oficios, Artesana “Confección de Delantales para mujeres”, cuenta con un taller de 3 máquinas, habita junto a sus hijos, y con su esposo cuentan con Dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 10 años de confeccionar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chichaclan, Cantón Poxlajuj, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que ella pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Florinda Agustina is 33 years of age. She is an artisan by trade, engaged in the preparation of women’s aprons She lives with her children, and she and her husband work in a shop with three machines, along with two other employees. She has been making aprons for 10 years in her residence which may be found in Paraje Chichaclan, Cantón Poxlajuj, in the Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. At present, her customer demand has grown but the economic conditions she has encountered have not allowed her to accumulate her working capital. For that reason, she turned to the Asociación ASDIR to solicit a loan with the intention of buying raw materials, and thus increase her sales. She is also hoping to bring up her children in order to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Raw Materials (Crafts)

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha O. Velazquez is 45 years old and is married to a body builder. All of her three children live with her even though two are adults and married. Martha and her husband own and operate a gym and a liquor store. They started Tawa Gym together nine years ago, and she says that the business has changed their lives.

Martha’s husband used to drink and smoke frequently when the family owned and operated only the liquor store. He was quite obese, Martha says, and one day he fell ill. The doctors told him that he wouldn’t live long if he didn’t change his lifestyle, eat more healthily, and exercise. And so he did and he loved working out. After a few years, Martha and her husband decided to open their own gym.  Martha began to take out small business loans with the Talented Women communal bank four years ago.  With her loans, Martha has been able to purchase different types of cardiovascular machines and dumbbells to equip the weight rooms.

Martha is now requesting 2,000 Nuevo Soles to purchase a weight machine for arm exercise. She will repay the loan in monthly installments over the course of four months.

loans.use: To purchase a weight machine

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
El Sr. Víctor vive en pareja con Rosa hace 7 años. De la unión de ambos ha nacido un niño que hoy tiene 5 años de edad.

El Sr. Víctor comenta que su señora tuvo que emigrar a España por que aquí en el país no consiguió un trabajo seguro debido a que no posee un nivel de estudio apropiado.

Víctor se dedica a la venta de mercaderías como ser: zapatos, calzados deportivos, jeans, camisas y otros tipos de indumentarias. Afirma que debe doblar esfuerzos de manera a conseguir los ingresos necesarios para poder mantener a su pequeño hijo.

Su deseo es lograr adquirir un local propio para la comercialización de sus mercaderías y así poder tener de regreso a su esposa.

En esta oportunidad solicita un crédito para la compra de más mercaderías a fin de aumentar el stock de los mismos.
texts.en:
Victor has lived with his partner Rosa for seven years. From their union they have a five year old son. Victor says that his wife had to emigrate to Spain because in his country she couldn't find work since she did not posses the appropriate education. Victor sells merchandise like dress shoes, sports shoes, jeans, t-shirts and other clothing items. He affirms that he should double his efforts to earn what he needs to be able to support his young son. His wish is to acquire his own locale where he can sell his merchandise and that way be able to have his wife return. At this time he is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise with the objective of increasing his stock.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing and shoes to sell

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en: Mrs. Sarun S. is a villager in Pech En village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nop Toeurn, is a pig breeder. Aside from pig breeding, he is a palm juice collector. Mrs. Sarun S. is applying for a loan to add to her savings with which she plans to buy construction supplies to build a better house for her family. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the others are too young to work or study.  Her husband is presented in the picture with her in the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to add her saving to buy construction supplies to build the house.

loans.name: Esther Mpingu Group

texts.en:
Esther M. is 59 years of age. She is married with eight children aged between 11 and 25. She has a five-room house where she stays with her children. She also looks after additional family members.

Esther M. has three meals a day. Her greatest expense in a month is paying school fees for her children.

She works seven days a week and receives about five customers a day. She sells her hens on retail basis. She has done this business for 10 years now and the main challenge she has faced so far is that she has to sell seasonally when her hens are of age to sell.

Esther M. has worked with Kiva's partner MCDT for two years now. The reason she chose to work with MCDT is because it was easy for her to join. She will use this loan to buy chicken feed and to increase the number of hens she has in her stock. She looks forward to expanding her poultry business to a farm.

loans.use: Buy more hens

loans.name: Josephine Obiero

texts.en: Josephine Obiero M. is forty-one years old and the mother of three, ages twenty, sixteen and ten. She told us during the interview that one of her children recently passed away. The rest of her children are currently in school and she and her husband combine incomes to pay for their school fees. She sells second-hand clothes in the Kibuye market while her husband is a bike mechanic. Normally, Josephine buys her second-hand clothes from those who can afford to purchase full bales. With the loan, Josephine hopes to purchase a bale on her own, cutting out the cost of dealing with another middle man. She says the profit will be used to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: Clothing Stock

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata  Touré  est âgée de 43 ans,  veuve  et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit  dans le domicile de son feu mari et ses enfants au quartier Bougoufié de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Aminata a abandonné l’école en classe de neuvième année fondamentale       (système éducatif malien) pour se marier par  la volonté parentale. Elle commença le commerce suite au décès  de son mari, avec la vente de gâteaux. Ce commerce lui a permis de comprendre les règles du commerce et de savoir faire le marketing de ses produits. Après le gâteau,  ce fut le commerce du l’ail et d’échalote, qu’elle mène depuis 17 ans au marché château. Elle est très connue dans ce créneau et jouit d’une grande notoriété pour la qualité de ses articles.
Dans l’intention d’avoir plus de marchandises afin de réaliser beaucoup de bénéfices, elle fait recours à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est en relation  depuis 36 mois. Après 2 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel pour un montant de 250 000 FCFA, qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 3 sacs de l’ail et 3 sacs d’échalote. Elle s’approvisionne à partir du Burkina Faso. Madame   Aminata  Touré vend, en détail, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femmes. 
Avec ce prêt elle envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 60 000 FCFA, qui lui servira à subvenir aux  charges de la famille (achat de nourriture, habillements des enfants et paiement des frais de scolarité).
Son ambition est de transformer sa maison du banco en dure.
texts.en:
Ms. Aminata Touré, age 43, is a widow and the mother of three. She and her children live in her late husband’s house in the Bougoufié district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali). She dropped out of school in the 9th basic year (education system in Mali) to get married by parental requirements. She started a business following the death of her husband and sold cakes. This business enabled her to understand the rules of commerce and to find out about marketing her merchandise. After selling cakes, it was garlic and shallots that she sold for seventeen years at the Chateau marketplace. She is very well known in this niche and enjoys great distinction for the quality of her goods.

Wanting to obtain more merchandise in order to realize a lot of profit, she has turned to the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been associated for 36 months. After two solidarity loans, and two individual loans, all repaid, she is now on her third individual loan in the amount of 250,000 francs CFA. She intends to use this loan to buy three sacks of garlic and three sacks of shallots. Supplies are gotten from Burkina Faso. She sells at the retail level to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted.

With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will serve to cover family expenses (to buy food and clothing for the children and to pay the schooling costs). Her ambition is to transform her house from adobe to something hard.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 45 years old and already a widow. Her husband passed away in 2006 and she was left with their two children. Her daughter Cheryl is a 17 year old second-year college student and Maricris is a 15 year old high school student. They live in Barangay San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21) Ilagan, Isabela, a rural and mountainous village.

Rosita manages a school canteen during school days and sells snacks in their village on weekends and during summer. She has been in this business for six years and still aiming to make it grow to save for her children's education and family needs.

She is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000 to improve her vending business by purchasing raw materials needed to make snacks and cook food to sell in the village. According to her, she could achieve her goals in life by being patient and industrious. She knows that God will remain by her side to guide her and her family in reaching their dreams in life.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials needed to make snacks and cook food.

loans.name: Isia

texts.en:
Isia R., 38, sells green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to sell. Married to a businessman who owns a shop at Juba market, Isia is the mother of four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she wants to build a house for her family.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more green vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
L. Nguyễn Thị, age 48, lives in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, L. owns and operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing and selling various products to local businesses and community members. L. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,800,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2004, L. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. L. has successfully repaid a previous L. of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous L. was used to purchase tools and other equipment to expand the business.  

L. is now requesting a new L. of 9,000,000 VND, which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. The L. will be the sixth L. taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. L. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Fetu

texts.en:
Fetu S., 37, is married with four children. She has many years of experience in the pig and chicken business. Fetu sells to the village community and the general public three days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about 145 USD).

Fetu has two previous loans with SPBD. SPBD loans are Fetu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. school fees and home improvement family help out with business and also with family and school expenses

loans.use: To purchase barbed wire and steel pipe for a pig fence

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta G. is engaged in a food-vending business. She is a resident of Barangay Malasin, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya. She is married to Jose Allan and they have two children: Lloyd Stephen and Yvette Stephanie and they are both in the tertiary level of education. Marietta is hoping that she will be able to continue to send them to school to finish their studies.

Marietta is now asking for financial assistance from Kiva lenders in the amount of PHP 15,000 that she will use for the improvement of her business. Aside from selling different food, she is also engaged in selling second hand clothes in their village. She believes that through her business and the salary of her husband, they can provide for the needs of their family.

loans.use: To improve her business

loans.name: Sonia Marina

texts.es: Sonia Marina G. vive en Atiquizaya en el departamento de Ahuachapán, en la zona occidental del país. A sus 51 años, Sonia tiene un poco más de una década de manejar exitosamente un modesto negocio de fabricación de ladrillos. El negocio de Sonia ha contribuido a la construcción de muchas casas de su comunidad y municipio. En este momento Sonia solicita un préstamo para comprar así, tierra amarilla y negra para aumentar su fabricación de ladrillos y la calidad y productividad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Sonia Marina G. lives in Atiquizaya in the Ahuachapán department in the western area of the country. Sonia, 51, has a little more than a decade of successfully managing her modest brick making business. Sonia’s business has contributed to the construction of many houses in the community and municipality. Sonia is now asking for a loan to buy yellow and black soil to increase fabrication of bricks. She will also improve the quality and productivity of her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material to make bricks

loans.name: Gonzales

texts.en:
R. Gonzales is from the village of Jasaan , Misamis , Oriental. She is forty-five years old and a widow with three grown children. To make a living, R. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately $700 a month for these activities.

In 2009, R. joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khémesse

texts.fr: Khémesse G. a 52 ans, est mariée et mère de 8 enfants. Elle tient un commerce de mil, arachide, haricot et oseille. Son prêt lui permettra de renforcer son activité et les revenus générés d’améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Khémesse G., aged 52, is married and the mother of eight children. She sells millet, peanuts, beans and sorrel in her store. Her loan will enable her to strengthen her business, increase her income and improve her children's living conditions.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To trade with millet, beans, peanuts

loans.name: Comité De Mujeres Activas De Candía Loma Group

texts.es:
El comité está integrado por 19 señoras trabajadoras de la compañía Candia Loma de la ciudad de Atyra, que en su mayoría son comerciantes trabajadoras, actualmente el grupo está en su 6to ciclo del programa de comités de mujeres emprendedoras.
Todas son vecinas del barrio, pequeñas comerciantes de la zona y una de las virtudes de ellas es que son muy unidas, cada fin de semana realizan actividades con la finalidad de generar fondos para la caja de ahorro que posee dentro del comité, y las actividades que desarrollan son ferias de comidas, torneos de volleybal, futbol, y los resultados son muy positivos debido a que la comunidad siempre está expectante de las actividades que realizan las señoras del comité. 
Todas las integrantes reciben un promedio de gs. 700.000 y los préstamos que recibieron de la Fundación Paraguaya lo  invierten en la compra de los siguientes productos : carne, leche, azúcar, almidón, queso, galleta, aceite, bebidas, fideos, arroz, ropas para caballeros y damas, telas, hilos etc .
Las representantes del comité, agradecen a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva por el apoyo en otorgarle un préstamo para su capital de trabajo y por las capacitaciones.

loans.use: Para la compra de leche, azúcar, almidón, queso, galleta, aceite, bebidas, fideos, arroz, ropas para caballero y damas, shampoo, tinte, telas, hilos etc.)

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah M. is a young mother who lives in Brgy. Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She was born on March 12, 1989 and only finished secondary education. She did not pursue college because she got married at an early age. Her husband is Mr. Rey M. and they are blessed with a child whom they called Reymarch M., a four year old boy. It is difficult for them to look for a job because they are only high school graduates. 
	So her husband cultivates their farm by planting a variety of vegetables. This is the common source of their income. When her son is on his best behavior Leah sells frozen foods and vegetables. She is the one who displays/sells their produce at the Public Market of Villa Coloma, bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. Since she does not have enough money to acquire more frozen foods, she wants to be a member of the Lending institution in Solano and applied for a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to be used in acquiring more frozen foods and vegetables to be sold at retail. She is so happy and she believes that she can make her business grow through this financial assistance.

loans.use: additional capital for her process foods business

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor  Manuel es originario de la comunidad de Paqui  tierra de Atanasio T.  que se encuentra a ocho kilómetros de la ciudad prócer de Totonicapán su principal fuente de ingreso es la elaboración de muebles,  como sillas roperos, camas, puertas y mesas dicha actividad lo fue aprendiendo hace quince años cuando contrajo matrimonio, ya es la actividad de su esposa  conjuntamente  iniciaron su propio negocio, actualmente necesitan un crédito  para aumentar su producción,  lo invertirá en la compra de madera, clavos, barniz pintura cola blanca
texts.en:
Mr. Víctor Manuel is from the community of Paqui in Atanasio T., 8 km outside the city of Totonicapan. His primary source of income is making furniture, such as chairs, wardrobes, beds, doors and tables. He began learning this job 15 years ago when he became engaged. It is now also his wife's job. They've started their own business, and currently need a loan to increase their production. This money will be invested in the purchase of wood, nails, varnish, paint, and glue.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La Sra. Maria Magdalena G. se dedica al servicio, cuenta con un comedor que se conoce como 
"COMEDOR EMMANUEL" tiene mas 30 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad y durante todo este tiempo
le ha ido muy bien, con este negocio logro que sus hijos estudaran y salieran adelante. Maria vende comida desde que el plato solo costaba menos de 0.75 centavos de lempira, ahora un plato de comida vale de 40 a 50 Lempiras. En este lugar ella fue la primera que puso comedor.
aprovechado las ganancias a mejorado su casa en la que vive y tiene su negocio , tiene una hija que le ayuda en la elaboracion de la comida y una de sus metas es poner un pequeño Hospedaje ya que aquí se carece de este tipo de servicios y las personas que necesitan este tipo de servicio tienen que regresarse hasta EL Paraiso que esta ubicado a 17 kilometros de esta zona.
texts.en:
Maria Magdalena G. is in food service. She has a restaurant called “Comedor Emmanuel”. She has been in this business for over 30 years. It has gone well for her during all of this time. Through the business she was able to educate her children and get them ahead. Maria has been selling food since a plate of food only cost less than 0.75 Lempira. Now a plate of food is worth 40 or 50 Lempiras. She was the first to start a restaurant in this place. Taking advantage of her earnings, she has improved the house where she lives and has her business. Her daughter helps her make the food. One of her goals is to set up a small boarding service because her area lacks this type of service. People need this type of service. They have to go back to El Paraiso, which is 17 kilometers from this area.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy beans, beef, pork, chicken, tortillas, soft drinks, plates, glasses, disposable forks, rice, sugar, shortening, oil, vegetables, juice in boxes, cheese, and sausage

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Milagro de Jesús está conformado por Maura Elena  y Perfecta Rosa. Maura tiene 31 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos a su cargo. Su actividad económica es la venta de refrescos y verduras, hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este oficio, por lo que es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos. Por lo que  solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de verduras frutas frescas para la elaboración de sus deliciosos refrescos. En cambio su amiga Perfecta Rosa tiene 65 años de edad. Tiene 3 hijos pero todos  trabajan de manea independiente, como toda mujer luchadora decide realizar la venta de abarrotes, por lo que es ella quien se hace cargo los gastos de su familia. Por lo que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así realizar la compra de sus productos. ambas sueñan con llegar a lo alto y mejorar cada día la situación de sus hogares.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Miracle of Jesus is made up of Maura Elena and Perfecta Rosa. Maura is 31 years old, and has 3 children in her care. The business she has dedicated herself to for the past 5 years involves the sale of refreshments and vegetables, which is her primary source of income. She is requesting a loan for working capital to buy vegetables and fresh fruits to make her delicious drinks. On the other hand, her friend Perfecta Rosa is 65 years old. She has 3 children, who now work independently. Like many struggling women, she decided to sell groceries since she is the one in charge of generating income for the family. She is requesting a loan to use as working capital, to invest in the purchase of her products. Both dream of reaching the top, and of improving the standard of living in their homes each and every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is divorced and has a grown daughter. She sells toys and games in one of the biggest markets in Zaporozhye. Galina owns two vending locations in the same marketplace. She offers a flexible pricing policy and very friendly customer service which has helped her business grow and flourish. Galina has been in the trade for 15 years. Currently, she has about 20,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her monthly profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas.

Galina is requesting a loan of 12,100 Grivnyas to increase her working capital. She is eager to access the above mentioned amount to buy additional toys that she can sell in her kiosks during this holiday season. As a good manager, she has succeeded in managing all her previous loans and repaid all of them without any delinquencies. Galina will benefit from more consistent financial support because it will strengthen her trade and provide an important profit margin to improve her business.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Sonia

texts.en: Sonia is a 39-year-old married woman. She has children who are of school age. She engaged in rice farming to earn an income for her family. She wants to earn more so she can save for her children’s future. Financially short, Sonia sought the help of the Kiva field partner, CEVI, a micro-finance institution in the Philippines. She applied for a loan of 6,000 PHP to finance her farm. With this loan, she will be able to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. She will also be able to pay the laborers who help at her farm.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Victoria

texts.fr: Victoria P. est mariée, 54 ans et mère de 5 enfants. Elle s’active dans la vente de crème glace et de jus de fruit local. Son objectif est d’augmenter son capital et de participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Victoria PEIRA is married, 54 years old and has five children. She is active in the sale of ice-cream and juice made up of local fruits. Her aim is to increase her capital and contribute to the family's expenses.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of ice-cream and juice made from local fruits

loans.name: Wasswa 2 Jane Nakikyo Group

texts.en:
Jane N. is a business woman who is fifty years old, married and blessed with five children.  She is more so blessed by having eight dependents, of whom four are in school.

She has been carrying out her poultry business for five years so far. She is using the loan to purchase poultry items such as poultry feed, drugs, chicks, and so forth. She is a hardworking business woman whose dream is to educate her siblings.

loans.use: To purchase poultry items such as poultry feeds, drugs, chicks, and so forth.

loans.name: Gloria's Group

texts.en:
Gloria A. is from the village of San Jose, Norte 1. She is 49 years old. Gloria is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI/Kiva. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gloria A.'s group.

Gloria is married and has 2 school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gloria has been involved in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells an animal.

In 2009, Gloria joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase livestock to raise and eventually sell. Gloria is requesting a new loan, her third, of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta F. is a trader who trades in garrie (made from cassava tubers), cigarettes, and provisions. She buys cigarettes from Freetown (the capital of Sierra Leone) and Guinea. On her return, she sells her garrie in Conakry (the capital of Guinea).

She is married to a miner, and they have three children. Her business is located at the center of the business park in Bo.

She has 10 years of business experience in garrie export.

With this loan, she wants to buy additional stock and then use the proceeds from the loan to increase her capital and to support her son's education.

She has spent half of her lifetime in business and is very much committed to her business.

loans.use: To buy garrie, cigarettes, and provisions

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn A. is a businesswoman who loves her business. She sells groceries, plastics and sachet water at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a supermarket in the future. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more groceries to sell. She is married with three children. Her children attend school and they are excelling in school. She is a friendly and hard working woman. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is widowed with five children. Her children go to school. She rents a two-room house where she stays with seven people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Sylvia takes care of additional family members. Monthly expenses include medication, school fees and feeding the family. Resty owns a store where she fries samosas, mandazi and donuts. She doesn’t pay rent for her  because she works from her home and sells to all categories of people at retail only. She works seven days a week. Resty receives at least 25 customers a day. She has been in this business for five years and her business challenges include seasonality and the rainy season because she works from an open place. She has been with MCDT for a few years servicing her 11th loan.  She wants to use this loan to buy more cooking oil, baking flour, cowpeas and firewood. She hopes to see her business grow bigger and own  distributing to different school canteens. She joined MCDT because it was near her home and was working with poor women. 

 .

loans.use: To buy more baking flour, cooking oil and cowpeas

loans.name: Mitina

texts.en:
Mitina N. is a hardworking businesswoman. She is 30 years old with only two children, one of whom is going to school. She has a clothing business located in Masaka town Kikubo (Ssemwogerere building). She has been running this kind of business for over eight years. 

Nassuna is using the loan to purchase clothes from Kampala to Nyendo. She wants to purposely expand on her business by purchasing more party dresses, suits for ladies, trousers and tops, among other items. Her future hopes are to prosper and to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase clothes (party dresses, suits for ladies, trousers, tops, etc.)

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mariana es socia del Banco Umiña, es comerciante tiene una tienda de víveres varios que es de tradición familiar, el esposo trabaja en una fabrica tiene 11 años de casada, le llegan los proveedores a entregarle directamente a su negocio, le gustaría tener su casa, cuando se caso vivía en otra parte cuando sus padres quedaron solos y el papa le pidió que se mude a vivir en su casa y desde entonces los acompaña a ellos, en un sector de la ciudad llamado santa Martha desde hace 10 años frente a una cancha, le va muy bien con los créditos de la fundación, y ahí tiene su tienda, tiene un espacio destinado para su tienda, viene siendo administrada por sus hermanos hasta que ahora como hermana menor le toco a ella, tiene 3 hijos, ella vende carne de pollo, bebidas, no tiene inconveniente al vivir con sus padres es una gran ayuda para ellos,
texts.en:
Mariana is member of the Umiña community bank. She is a businesswoman who owns a supplies store, which has been handed down in her family. Mariana’s husband works in a factory. They have been married for 11 years and have three children. Suppliers deliver directly to her store. Mariana would like to have her own home. When she got married, she lived in another part of the city but then her parents found themselves isolated so her father asked if they could all live together. Since then, and for the past 10 years, they all live together in an area of the city called Santa Martha. Their house is situated in front of a field. Mariana is doing well with the previous loans arranged by the Foundation, and has a designated place in the house for her shop. Previously, the shop was managed by her brothers, but now as the younger sister, it is her turn to manage it. Mariana sells chicken, drinks, and is very content to live with her parents, which helps them a lot.

Translated from Spanish by Justine Raymond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy drinks, meat, and general provisions for her shop.

loans.name: Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento FORTALEZA esta compuesta D. 8 integrantes 7 mujeres y 2 varones, son del mismo barrio D. conocen y se garantizan entre ellos.
 
La Sra. Miriam es la Presidenta D. Banco D. Emprendimiento  tiene como actividad un  puesto D. comida en la Av. 15 D. abril frente, ella venD. hace 18 años  almuerzos y platos especiales como fricase, sajta D. pollo, fritanga, ranga. Ella tiene dos niños uno en edad escolar y el otro es D. apenas dos años. en su puesto le ayudan su mamá y su hermana,es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su familia, con el dinero del credito comprara insumos y otros ingedientes para la elaboracion D. sus riquisimos platillos. 

La Sra. Rosio es la secretaria D. Actas su  actividad es su principal fuente D. ingreso para ella y su hija tiene una tienda D. carteras y zapatos D. cuero en el shoping Corazón D. Jesús,  es una persona muy responsable  ya que con este negocio cubre los estudios D. su hija que esta en la universidad quien estudia y a la ves ayuda a su Mamá, con el dinero dle credito comprara mercaderia. 

Y el Sr.Santos es el tesorero del Banco D.
