Emprendimiento La Fortaleza  el tiene un kioso D. pan en la Av. 15 D. abril  su venta comienza a las 5 D. la madrugada ya que sus clientes son los viajeros a los Yungas en diferentes rumbos el aún es soltero y apoya con su negocio sus estudios y tambien le ayuda a  su mamá con los gastos del hogar.

Todos los socios estan agradecidos con Emprender y Kiva por la confianza brindada en la otorgacion del credito.
texts.en:
El Banco D. Emprendimiento Fortaleza is composed of 8 members. They are all from the same neighborhood. Ms. Miriam is the President. She owns a food stall on Avenue 15 D. abril. Since she was18 years old, she has sold lunch and special plates, such as fricasé (spicy pork meat stew), sajta D. pollo (a chicken dish), fritanga (spicy pork and egg stew), and ranga (tripe). She has two children, one of whom is in school and the other who is barely two years old. Her mother and her sister also help her at her stall. She is a very hardworking and responsible person, always thinking in the wellbeing of her family. With the money from this loan, she will purchase ingredients that she needs to prepare her delicious dishes. Ms. Rosio is the secretary of this bank. She has a wallet and leather shoe store in the shopping area, Corazón D. Jesús, which supports both her and her daughter. She is a very responsible person, having used this business to cover the costs of her daughter's studies, who is studying in the university and also helps out her mother. With the money from this loan, she would buy more merchandise. Mr. Santos is the treasurer and has a bread kiosk on Avenue 15 D. abril. He opens at 5am in the morning, since his customers are travelers going to the Yungas. He is single and spends his earnings on his studies and also in helping his mother with their household costs. Every member of the bank is very grateful to El Banco D. Emprendimiento and to Kiva for their support in offering them loans.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of necessary ingredients.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion B. is a 43-year-old hard-working mother. Her husband earns money sporadically as a hired laborer which makes maintaining a cash flow for the family a great challenge on which Salvacion has to work every day. She realized that her dream of having her children graduate from college for a better career in the future was starting to fade because of insufficient income. With that realisation, she gained more courage and determination.

Salvacion joined ASHI in 2009 and requested a loan to finance starting up her own business. At first, she bought and sold fruit and vegetables from their small village. Now, she has realized that since “muscovado” sugar production is very common in the town where she and her family live, she is considering the buying and selling of this product as a business. “Muscovado” is a red sugar produced from a sugar cane trunk. This is processed naturally without any chemical ingredients and preserves a person’s good health and life. Since Salvacion has had the opportunity to request a loan, she has tried very hard to enhance her productivity as a woman so she can support the needs of her family especially her four children whose ages range from five to 17 years old. She hopes that one day her business will expand and its profits increase so she can support her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase "muscovado" sugar in bulk for a "buy and sell" business.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida P., 50 years old, is from the town of Trento. She is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Nida owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. She hopes for her business to prosper.

Nida joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nida has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Nida is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs. This will be the third loan taken out by Nida from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure and other farm inputs

loans.name: 16 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
La A.C. 16 de Agosto se ha organizado para solicitar un crédito, este es su primer ciclo, tiene como presidenta a la señora Valentina P. Y., la mencionada asociación comunal pertenece al Centro Focal de Panamericana.  La señora Valentina tiene como negocio el tejido de gorros de lana para señoras de pollera, muy utilizados en ésta época de invierno, pues las temperaturas bajan entre 2 a 5 grados centígrados, en la mañana y al anochecer, inclusive esta temperatura se percibe en los lugares que no reciben sol durante el dia.
Doña Valentina vive con su pareja, tiene tres niños pequeños por los que se esfuerza en su negocio.
Las  integrantes de la asociación comunal tienen negocios de elaboración de chompas de lana, venta de mantas y calzados, venta de haba tostada, alfombras, venta de dulces, venta de comida y venta de condimentos.
texts.en:
This communal bank 16 de Agosto has been formed to seek a loan. This is the group's first loan cycle. Their president is Valentina P. Y.. The communal group belongs to the Centro Focal de Panamericana. Señora Valentina knits woollen hats for the women in the highlands (Andes), greatly used at the moment in wintertime as the temperatures drop to between 2 - 5 degrees centigrade in the morning and at sunset (including some areas that don't receive sun during the day). Doña Valentina lives with her partner and has 3 small children - for this reason she works hard in her business. The members of this communal bank have businesses such as making woollen jumpers, selling ponchos and footwear, selling toasted broadbeans, rugs, sweets, food and condiments.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool

loans.name: Ancilla

texts.en:
Ancilla was born in 1970 and is married with four children between 5 and 12 years old.

Ancilla owns a small business selling various products such as juice, cooking oil and so on and has an experience of three years in her business. She employs one person from her community as a helper so that her business runs well. The hours of her daily activities are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day except Saturday.

Now, Ancilla is requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company for the purpose of expanding her business. With this loan she hopes to earn more profit to be used in her daily activities.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products to increase her inventory

loans.name: Melendres Laura

texts.es:
Laura de 38 años, tiene un pequeño salón de belleza, su esposo repara zapatos a un bajo precio ellos tiene una hija de 10 años y viven en una zona urbana del Guasmo de Guayaquil. 

Inicio el negocio para ayudar con los gastos familiares y asegurar la vida de su hija, aprendió a cortar cabello a tinturarlo, hacer peinados y estilo, manicura, pedicura hace años. Trabaja desde muy temprano, hasta el anochecer sola. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar utensilios para su negocio como sillas y panchas de cabello. En el futuro ella quiere abrir un salón de belleza profesional, ya que esta estudiando para perfeccionar el servicio.
texts.en:
Laura, 38, has a small beauty salon. Her husband is a low-cost shoe repairman. They have a 10-year-old daughter and live in an urban zone in El Guasmo, Guayaquil. She started the business to help meet family expenses and provide for her daughter’s wellbeing. She learned how to cut, color and style hair. She also learned how to do manicures and pedicures. She works alone from very early until nightfall. She will use the loan to buy work tools like chairs and hair straightening irons. In the future she’d like to open a professional beauty salon since she is studying to deepen her skills.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For chairs and a hair straightening iron.

loans.name: Hopeful Friends Group

texts.en:
Edward K., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Hopeful Friends.  He is 40 years old, single, and has three children whose ages are between eight months and eleven years. He presently attends college. 


For 20 years, he has been selling petroleum products in “Wood camp community” on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more petroleum products to sell. 

He describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and continue with his education.

loans.use: To buy more petroleum products to sell

loans.name: Rosa Lidia

texts.es:
Rosa es una madre de familia de 28 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío La Pilca, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, distrito agrícola situado en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica al comercio de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas en su domicilio. Ella adquiere su mercadería en el pueblo de Olmos y la ofrece en venta a los vecinos de su caserio y de las zonas aledañas. Adicionalmente vende combustibles y aceites, los cuales son muy utilizados por los agricultores del lugar para optimizar el funcionamiento de los motores con los que extraen el agua de los pozos para regar sus sembríos.

Rosa desea adquirir más bebidas para ampliar su negocio de venta, para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Rosa es una mujer trabajadora y bastante responsable. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar su negocio y poder construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 28-year-old mother who lives with her family in La Pilca, a rural area of the Olmos district. Olmos is an agricultural district located in the province of Lambayeqye, 1 hour and 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She works selling soft drinks and beers from her home. She gets her merchandise in the town of Olmos and sells it in her rural settlement and other neighboring areas. In addition, she sells fuel and oil, which are used a lot by the area farmers to optimize the function of their motors that they use to extract water from wells to water their crops.

Rosa wants to buy more soft drinks to expand her sales business. To reach this goal, she is requesting, for the first time, a loan with Edpyme Alternativa for 1000 PEN.

Rosa is a hardworking and very responsible woman. Her biggest dream is to expand her business and be able to build her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks and beers to expand her business that she runs from her home.

loans.name: Susan  Pose

texts.en:
Susan is married and has four children. She was introduced to KADET by World Vision ADP. She is requesting her first loan. Susan has been selling clothing for two years. With this loan, she plans to increase her inventory of clothing textiles.

Susan's business is located in a busy open-air market. With the extra profits, she wants to start a textile factory. She hopes to become a prominent business person and a wholesaler. Susan describes herself as a dreamer.

loans.use: To increase her supply of clothing to sell

loans.name: Job Group

texts.es:
El grupo Job lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras una de ellas es Analy R. de 42 años quien se dedica al comercio de plata, ropa y comida, pero actualmente por las lluvias no ha puesto su fritanga. Ella inicio este negocio por la ayuda de sus hijos y con el crédito ha mejorado su negocio con el fin de superarse.
Los integrantes del grupo son Graciela M. de 55 años quien se dedica venta de ropa interior e infantil de manera ambulante y Marnie M. de 25 años desde hace dos años comercializa prendas de oro, plata, tesoros del mar, ropa infantil y encargos. Ellas sueñas en progresar y superar sus negocios.
texts.en:
The Job group consists of three very hardworking people.  

42 year old Analy R. sells clothing, silver and food, but during the rainy season, she can't set up her cooking stand.  She began this business with the help of her children and with loans has improved it with the goal of making a better life.  

The other members of the group are 55 year old Graciela M., who sells underwear and baby clothes from a mobile cart, and 25 year old Marnie Mayoraga who has for 2 years been selling gold and silver jewellery, and baby clothes to order.  Their dream is to advance and succeed in their businesses.

loans.use: Buying merchandise of clothing and silver

loans.name: Um Sokhay's Group

texts.en:
Eleven people have formed a group to request a loan. They are located in Angkrong village in Kandal Province. The group members selected Mrs. S. Um, a 40-year-old married woman, as the bank president for their group. Each member of the group will use his or her portion of the loan to support his or her individual purpose.

Mrs. S. Um earns her living by breeding pigs. Her husband, Mr. Chhoeng Sieb, who is 48, works as a rice miller; he owns a rice milling machine to support his business. They both work hard on their businesses to support their three children, two of whom are seamstresses in the garment factory and one of whom works locally as a beautician.

Mrs. S. Um is asking for a loan to buy beautician's supplies to support her child's current business.

loans.use: To buy beautician's supplies

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio, de 38 años, es un hombre soltero y muy trabajador, vive solo en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Sanchirio (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica Antonio, es la fabricación de muebles, por lo que tiene 15 años dedicándose a ello. Su taller es un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su casa, ahí confecciona sillas, cómodas y escritorios. Pero la actividad que más le gusta a Antonio, es la agricultura, donde hace 5 años, comenzó a sembrar café, el cual lo comercializa en la cooperativa de su comunidad, donde empezaron a exportar a otros países. Por ello más adelante, desea juntar más capital de trabajo donde pueda invertir en la apertura de una cadena de tiendas, de esa manera podrá vender los muebles que fabrica, y está segura que con mucho esfuerzo lo conseguirá. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y en este tiempo de trabajo sacrificado y muy duro, se siente agradecido por el apoyo que le brindó su banco comunal, que sin su apoyo, no hubiera salido adelante en el desarrollo de sus sembríos. Es por ello que ya ha pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para sus sembríos de café.
texts.en:
Antonio is 38 years old.  He is single and a very hard-working man.  He lives alone in a rented house in the town of Sanchirio (in the central Peruvian jungle).  Antonio's business is making furniture.  He has been in the business for 15 years.  His workshop is a small space that he fitted out in his home and there he makes chairs, chests of drawers and desks.

However, Antonio's favorite activity is farming.  Five years ago he started growing coffee which he sells in his community cooperative.  The cooperative have begun exporting to other countries.  In the future, Antonio would like to get together more working capital so that he can invest in opening a chain of stores.  In this way he will be able to sell his furniture and he is sure that with a lot of hard work and effort he will achieve his goal.

This is Antonio's second loan with MFP and in this time of sacrifices and hard work he feels grateful for the support which his community bank have given him.  Without their support, he would not have been able to get ahead in growing his crops.  He is planning to invest his loan in buying several sacks of organic fertilizer for his coffee crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer for his coffee crops

loans.name: Esteban Rene

texts.es:
Esteban es un padre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Campiña El Cerrito del distrito de Paiján, la localidad es una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, región La Libertad, a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

El cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio en donde ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio goza de muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda a sus clientes. Adicionalmente cuenta con un equipo de sonido que alquila para amenizar actividades sociales, fiestas, etc.

Los ingresos que obtiene de estas actividades le sirven para sostener la economía de su familia. Esteban desea seguir creciendo como empresario, por ello ha decidido ampliar su bodega con la compra de más productos, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Esteban is a 43 year-old father who lives with his wife and two children in Campiña El Cerrito, in Paiján district.  It is an agricultural area of Ascope province, in La Libertad region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Esteban has a small grocery store in his home where he offers his customers different household products, essentials and groceries.  His business is very popular because of the good quality of the products that he offers and the good service which he provides to his customers.  He also has a sound system which he hires out for social events, parties, etc.

The profits that Esteban makes from these business activities help him to support his family financially.  He would like to continue growing as a businessman and would like to expand his grocery store by purchasing more products.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: To buy products to expand the small grocery store in his home

loans.name: Marlon

texts.en:
Marlon F. is from the town of Banga. He is 41 years old. Marlon is single. To make a living, Marlon owns & operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. Marlon works hard to build his business.

Marlon joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marlon has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Marlon is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building supplies to build an extension on one of her rooms so that she is more comfortable

loans.name: Anecita's Group

texts.en:
Anecita lives in the village of Miligan, Molave, Zamboanga del Sur. Her husband is a farmer. They have 4 children; one daughter is a teacher and she helps them meet their everyday needs. Anecita is the group leader among the 3 members of this group loan, which is offered by Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative. Their group has had a good performance record ever since they became PMPC members.

Anecita is running a piggery which is the income source for their family's primary needs. Since she became a PMPC member, she has begun to access more capital for her piggery with her husband's support.

Anecita is requesting a new loan  in the amount of 10,000 PhP will be used as additional capital for their piggery. That is her 7th loan taken out from Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative.

PAGLAUM MULTI-PURPOSE COOPERATIVE is the most progressive cooperative in Northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to poor rural communities.

loans.use: Piggery

loans.name: Nazim

texts.en:
Nazim R. is married and lives with his wife and three children in Saatli, a province of Azerbaijan. His wife takes care of their children and the household. The children, two daughters and one son, go to a local secondary school. In 2006 Nazim decided to open an electrical goods store. After some years of successful operations he has been able to increase his working capital. 

Nazim's trading business has also grown, thanks to his first loan with AqroInvest. He has been able to improve his living situation and better support his children. Actually this is the main goal of his life. His current monthly income is around 250 AZN. After successfully repaying the previous loan, he is now requesting a new one for 1600 AZN to be used as working capital to purchase new electrical goods. Nazim and his family are very thankful to AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase new electrical goods

loans.name: Ali

texts.ar: علي عمره 46 سن متزوج وله 6 اولاد يعمل في تصنيع وبيع الحلويات له في عمله 30 سنة يحب عمله كثيرا فهو يتقنه جيدا له خبرة واسعة في عمله يحب عائلته ويسعى الى تزويدهم بجميع احتياجاتهم يريد للعائلة ولنفسه التطور والتجدد يحب ان يزيد من مدخوله يريد من خلال طلب قرض له من المجموعة الى شراء مواد اولية لصناعة الحلويات وتطوير المصلحة
texts.en: Ali is 46 years old and married with six children. He works by making and selling sweets and has 30 years of extensive experience in this. He loves his work very much and does it with excellence.  He loves his family and wants to provide all that they want for them. He wants to develop himself and his family and increase his income. With this loan he wants to purchase ingredients to make more sweets and develop his business.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his confectionery business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael G., aged 44 years, is married to Esther and they have two school-aged children. They live in Dandora but the business is located right at the town center. He sells spare parts. He was introduced to KADET LTD by an existing client.

Michael has been in this business for 11 years and earns a profit of KES.50,000. This is his third loan from KADET LTD. He paid his previous loans well and in good time. He intends to add more stock of spare parts such as diffs, axles and shafts.

If the loan boosts his business, he plans to open another spare parts store. Michael is hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more stock of spare parts for sale

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna L. is from the village of Central Poblacion, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Edna is married and has two very young children. To make a living, Edna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, detergents, shampoo, soap & snack foods in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities. In the picture are Edna and her daughter.

In 2011, Edna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Edna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & detergents. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Edna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & detergents.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida lives in Mian Channu, which is a small city of Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a four-room brick house with her family for the past 10 years. 

She is a housewife and takes care of her household responsibilities by staying at home. She is a very good mother who is rearing her children very well. Both of her sons are very young and are not of school-age yet.  

Her husband’s name is R., and he runs two businesses. He is a driver and provides transport services to passengers and also operates a dairy business. He gets milk from his buffaloes and sells to community clients.  

Shahida is a very active lady and operates the milk-selling business in the absence of her husband.  
Shahida has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to buy another buffalo for the dairy business. This will help her husband to produce more milk and increase sales. 

Milk-selling is Shahida’s family business and they have been doing it for past 10 years. She is hopeful that an investment will help them improve their business further. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan experience with Asasah.

loans.use: to buy another buffalo for dairy business

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret N. lives in the Kawempe neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, all of whom are in school. Margaret has a business of selling soft drinks.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Eva sells her products in a shop, by means of retail.  Margaret has requested a loan of 800000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more more crates of soda, passion fruit, and sugar.  She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Margaret include seasonality, transportation and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to build more rental rooms and also to own a soda depot.  Margaret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family

loans.use: to buy more crates of soda, passion fruits, and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Sokchhiv

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokchhiv H. and her husband, Mr. Meanup Som, live in suburb approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have two sons and two daughters. Three are in school and another one is still young. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.

Sokchhiv sell rice and other foods in front of a garment factory. She uses her motorbike to transport food from her house to the factory every day. Unfortunately, the motorbike was stolen. That’s why she is asking for a loan of $700 to purchase one.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for carrying her food.

loans.name: Kalysa

texts.en:
Kalysa is 42 years old, married to Fidelis and has eight children. She has been manufacturing detergents to sell in Nakuru town for the last 3 years. 

She was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by one of our field officers and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan to buy more chemicals for making detergents.

In the future, Kalysa hopes to stabilize her manufacturing business as well as start a poultry farm in Nakuru town.

loans.use: to buy more chemicals for making detergents.

loans.name: Marcelo Dario

texts.es: El señor Marcelo es cliente antiguo de la institución quien trabaja 2 secuencias demostrando puntualidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos,  el es transportista tiene un vehículo con el que trabaja a gasolina y solicito el  crédito para realizar la conversión de gasolina a gas natural, y esta conversión a el le aumentara sus ingresos y reducirá sus gastos, el Sr. Marcelo se levanta muy temprano para  trabajar con su  movilidad, ya que tiene a sus hijos pequeños, que se quedan al cuidado de su esposa, el deseo del Sr. Marcelo es el poder comprarse su casita para ofrecer mayor comodidad a su familia,  es una persona muy trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado. Ojo en la foto el Sr. Marcelo esta acompañado de su esposa.
texts.en:
Marcelo is a long-standing client of our institution who has worked through two loan cycles, demonstrating punctuality and responsibility in making his payments.

Marcelo is a taxi driver who owns a vehicle that runs on gasoline.  He is requesting this loan to convert his vehicle to run on natural gas.  This conversion would increase his profits and reduce his expenses.  Marcelo gets up very early to work in his vehicle since he has young children.  He leaves the children the care of his wife.  Marcelo's wish is to be able to buy his own home so that he can offer his family a more comfortable life.  He is a very hard-working person and is grateful to the institution for the support they have offered him.

In the photo, Marcelo is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: to convert his taxi to run on natural gas instead of gasoline

loans.name: Ayudanos Señor 2, 3 & 7 Group

texts.en: Cleotilde is the coordinator of her group, Ayudanos Senor (Help Us, Lord) 2, 3 & 7, a group made up of mostly Haitian citizens. They are located in the city of La Romana, where decades ago Haitians emigrated to work in the sugarcane industry. They all live in a rural community outside of the main city. Cleotilde and her long-term partner make their home here in a simple structure with their three children. Their community is a Batey, where most of the people live without services and where it is necessary to go to a closer city to get everything they want. Cleotilde told us that with a loan from Kiva's partner, Esperanza International, many families, especially hers, have been able to improve their lives and to have hope. Cleotilde's excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has been running her business for two years. She started investing in calling cards when many people bought prepaid cellphones because they need to buy calling cards to recharge their mobile credits. She will use this loan to buy calling cards and clothing. Cleotilde's dreams are to have an improved business and to take care of her family in a safe and beautiful house. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy calling cards and clothing.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and a mother of four school-age children. She is 37 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Flora is a farmer. She plants and harvests pineapple to earn a living. She sells pineapples by bulk to the local traders. She has been doing this for two years. Twice a year, she earns PHP 40,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 from GDMPC to purchase herbicides and fertilizers.

Flora has been a member of GDMPC for two months. In the future, Flora hopes to earn more income and continue her pineapple production.

loans.use: To purchase herbicides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 23 years old and single. He resides in Narok, Kenya. Samson is a maize farmer. He has been doing this for the past two years. He knew KADET through a registered client with KADET.

Samson has been a good client and this is his second loan. He plans to use the loan to prepare land for farming and to buy farm inputs.

Samson hopes to make profit and use it to re-invest in other business. He is an assiduous man who can do more if funded.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “ILLARY III”; este banco comunal pertenece al Distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia Noemi;  tiene 26 años de edad  y es soltera la socia tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad;  la socia se dedica  a la administarcion y atencion de su tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende todo lo referente a mercaderia de primera necesidad los productos que salen a diario y los productos que son para uso externo tambien ella esta incrementando un pequeño espacio para complementar su negocio de venta de productos de librería como cuardernos, hojas, lapiceros, entre otros simples. La  socia requiere el prestamo para invertir en la compra de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar y algunos articulos de libreria.

La socia agradece y valora el prestamo que se le otorgara para poder mejorar sus calidad de vida y la de sus familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Noemi is a member of the Communal Bank “Illary III” which is located in the District of Huanchac, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 26 years old, single, and has a two-year-old child. Noemi manages and attends to a grocery store where she merchandise, such as everyday basic necessities and products for external use. In addition, she has expanded her small space to accommodate the sale of bookstore items such as notebooks, sheets of paper, pencils, and other supplies. Noemi is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of basic necessity products, such as rice and sugar, as well as bookstore items.

She appreciates and values the loan that has been provided so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to purchase basic necessity products, such as rice and sugar, as well as bookstore items.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a married man with twenty-seven children. Fifteen of his children attend school, and twelve are adults. He owns a house that has neither  electricity, nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.

For the past 30 years, he has operated a charcoal selling business, reared livestock, and also owns residential real estate. His potential customers are charcoal dealers in the area who purchase in wholesale, and sell as retail. He faces the major challenge of seasonality due to disease outbreak in the area. Salim dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs 100,000, he wants to start a motorcycle business; purchasing one motorcycle for transport. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To start a motorcycle business and purchase one motorcycle for transport.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée mère de huit enfants dont un seul garçon.Elle a commencé il y'a dix ans un petit commerce de produits agricoles au bord de la route nationale avant de venir s'installer au nouveau marché central.Elle y vend des divers tissus et des parfums.Avec ce commerce, elle prend non seulement en charge ses besoins personnels mais arrive aussi à appuyer son mari dans l'entretien de la famille.Elle sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un prêt de 250000F pour acheter 5 caisses de parfum et des tissus afin de préparer les fêtes à venir. Son ambition est d'acheter un véhicule pour son fils qui est employé comme chauffeur  par un grand transporteur de la ville.
texts.en: This borrower is a married mother of eight children, of whom one is a boy. Ten years ago, she started a small retail business selling agricultural products on the side of the national highway before establishing herself at the central market, where she sells various fabrics and perfumes. With this business, she not only provides for herself, but is also able to support her husband in taking care of the family. She is seeking a loan of 250,000 F with UIMCEC to buy five crates of perfume and fabric in anticipation of the coming festivals. Her ambition is to buy a vehicle for her son, who is employed as a driver by one of the main carriers in the city.

loans.use: To buy five crates of perfume and fabric.

loans.name: Oganes

texts.en:
Oganes is 46 years old. He lives in the village of Krasnoe (East Georgia) with his wife Margarita and their 25-year-old son. 

Oganes is a tailor. He has his own sewing workshop. Oganes designs various types of seasonal clothes and sells them in his village. The average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Oganes requested credit to purchase a car. He will take his clothes to the nearby villages and towns and sell them there. Oganes hopes that by using the car, he will be able to double the sales of his clothes. He thinks that he has enough production capacity to satisfy the doubled demand. The income of the family will increase and they will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a car for transportation of his products

loans.name: Laudelina

texts.es:
La señora Laudelina es una mujer de 60 años de edad, la misma se dedica a la venta de varios artículos ya que tiene una mercería, dichos articulos son ropas, calzados, articulos de librería, y otros. Se dedica al rubro hace 25 años, y ha tenido locales comerciales en distintos lugares, uno de ellos en el mercado.
Laudelina no cuenta con hijos y es soltera, así que no tiene personas que la ayuden en el negocio, por lo que el trabajo lo realiza con mayor dedicación y esfuerzo con el afán de atender a sus clientes de la mejor forma.
El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de una gama de productos que son de temporada y por lo tanto son rápida venta, como ser ropas, calzados y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da,pues de obtener el crédito le será de mucha ayuda en su negocio.
texts.en:
Laudelina is a 60 year old woman who has a store and sells various items such as clothes, shoes, stationary, etc. She has been in this business for 25 years, and she has done business in various place, one of those being in the market. 

Laudelina doesn’t have children and is single, so she doesn’t have anyone who can help her in her business. For that reason she does her work with much dedication, effort, and eagerness to give her customers the best service.  

She asks for a loan to invest in the purchase of a range of seasonal products that are sold quickly, like clothes, shoes, and other things. She thanks the Fundación for the opportunity they’ve given her, since getting the loan will be a great boon to her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes and other merchandise

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Ella invertirá el credito en la compar de manzanas y perecederos, cajetas etc. para seguir creciendo.
texts.en: She will invest her loan in the purchase of apples, perishable goods, caramel candies, and other products so that she can continue growing.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials & pay for labor to build her house

loans.name: Rios De Agua Viva Group

texts.es: La Sr. Mireyha  es conviviente,  tienes 2  hijos en edad escolar,  actualmente es integrante  en la alcancía comunal “Rios de Agua viva”  grupo  conformado por  7  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.  Mireyha  trabaja desde los 18 años ella se dedica a la venta y confección de tela industrial este negocio lo aprendió porque su familia También se dedica a este  negocio, Mireyha trabaja junto a su esposo en un taller que pusieron hace dos años , hoy en día tiene una máquina para hacer sus telas pero ya tiene clientes fidelizados, Mireyha nos cuenta que su motivación para lograr sus metas son sus hijos,  gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos  , que le ha permitido brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida , con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería, telas, hilos, agujas . Sabemos que Mireyha  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.
texts.en: Señora Mireyha lives with her partner and has 2 school age children.  She is currently a member of the communal bank "Rios de Agua Viva".  The group is made up of 7 members who are dedicated to various commercial activities.  Mireyha has been working since she was 18 years old making and selling industrial fabric.  She learned this business because her family also has the same business.  Miryeha works with her husband in a shop they set up two years ago.  Now she has a machine to make her fabrics, but she already has loyal customers.  Mireyha tells us that her children give her motivation to achieve her goals.  Thanks to her hard work and dedication she has been able to improve her financial situation which has allowed her to give her family a better quality of life.  She is requesting a new loan so that she can continue to grow.  She will by merchandise such as fabrics, thread, and needles.  We know that Mireyha will achieve her goals through a lot of hard work and that the loans with Edaprospo will help her.

loans.use: purchase fabric, needles, and thread.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 29 years old, married to Elizabeth and together they are blessed with two children who go to school.

Elijah offers transport to the residents of Githurai 44 area and he also sells CDs. He has been in this business for the last year and gets an income of 15,000 KES per month. He is applying for his first loan of 16,500 KES from KADET Ltd. which he plans to use to purchase spare parts and expand the CD selling business. He will use the anticipated profit to buy another motorbike.

Elijah hopes to own many motorbikes for hiring out, raise his family and educate his children. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and expand his CD selling business.

loans.name: Sarkis

texts.en:
Sarkis is a 46-year-old married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He is the only income source for his family and he works hard to enhance his family's lifestyle.

He has 15 years experience working in printing designs on textiles. And in 2009, he was able to open his own shop. Today, he’s requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase more products needed for his printing work. In the future, he plans to broaden his business operations and include more designs.

loans.use: to purchase more products needed for his printing work.

loans.name: Rahmonkul

texts.ru: Рахмонкул начинал свою деятельность в сфере аграрном бизнесе. Он вдовец и имеет четырех детей. Он сам обеспечивает семью, и он всегда нуждается в поддержке в  воспитании детей. Рахмонкул хочет, чтобы его дети выросли воспитанными и образованными людьми и поэтому он усердно работает, чтобы устроить их в хорошие школы и университеты. Более 10 лет он занимается выращиванием пшеницы.  В сезон он получает хороший урожай и продает за выгодную цену. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, на полученную прибыль он планирует сыграть свадьбу сына.  Рахмонкул запрашивает займ для покупки семян и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Rahmonkul has been a farmer for the last 10 years. He is a widower and has four children. He raises his family all by himself and always needs help to take care of his children. Rahmonkul wants to see his kids grow up civilized and educated and he is working hard to assure that they attend the good schools and are able to go to college. He grows wheat on his farm and has been getting abundant harvests which he could sell for a good price. Rahmonkul wants to expand his farm and increase his profits, then use the money to organize a wedding for his son. He is requesting this loan to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds in order to expand his business

loans.name: Amil

texts.en: Amil lives in the Agsu district. He is 30 years old, married, and has one son and two daughters between the ages of four and ten. Amil has been engaged in the cattle breeding business for over four years. In the past, he was his father, a farmer's, main helper. After getting married, he decided to start his own business. Amil requested a loan of 1500 AZN to purchase three more cattle to raise and then sell. This is his third loan through AqroInvest and Kiva and he has good loan history. Amil is very thankful because the income from this loan will allow him to increase his family's monthly income to 300 AZN. He plans to purchase at least ten more dairy cows in the next three years.

loans.use: to purchase three cattle.

loans.name: Ramilo

texts.en:
Ramilo is 34-years-old and has been involved in rice farming as a source of income for almost 10 years now. His family relies on his net income per harvest season. He owns a hectare rice field and half-hectare plot of land where he grows vegetables too. He is a very industrious man and his family inspires him to work hard. He plants rice and harvests it to sell to traders. 

He wants to improve his harvest but it requires a larger capital which he lacks financially. He is now requesting a loan of P30,000 to buy 4 liters of herbicides and insecticides to use in farming. This will improve his crops and enable him to generate more profits for the education of his three children. His children are still in elementary grades.

In the future, Ramilo would like to make consistent profits for the improvement of their living condition.

loans.use: to buy 4 liters of herbicides and insecticides to use in farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes in bulk for his business

loans.name: Matilde Florencia

texts.es: La señora Matilde cuenta con un lote el cual lo adquirió recientemente y esta ubicado en una zona periurbana llamada alto buena vista, como recién construyo un cuarto para ya no vivir en alquiler la señora esta necesitando el crédito para poder comprar material de construcción para culminar el muro de su casa, la señora cuenta con un café internet, este esta ubicado en una avenida muy concurrida de la ciudad de Cochabamba, ya tiene experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con clientes asiduos. La señora es casada y su conyugue trabaja en construcción de viviendas  en zonas alejadas, tiene aun a su cargo un hijo el cual esta  estudiando. Cuenta con el negocio hace 4 años, le va muy bien con su negocio su deseo es poder ver su casita terminada, y también poder comprar mas computadoras para ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Matilde has a parcel of land which she obtained recently located in a peri-urban area called Alto Buena Vista. As she just constructed a room so she would not have to rent any longer she needs a loan in order to be able to buy construction material to finish the wall of the house. 

She has an internet cafe which is located on a busy avenue in the city of Cochabamba. She has experience in the area and has regular clients. 

She is married and her husband builds homes in remote areas. She has a dependent child in her care who goes to school. She has had her business for four years. Her business is going very well and her dream is to be able to see her little home finished and also to be able to buy more computers to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy material to build a wall in her house

loans.name: Shushana

texts.en:
Shushana is 51 years old. She lives in the village of Zikilia in South Georgia with her three adult children – two sons who are 28 and 25 years old, and a 23-year-old daughter. Shushana is a widow and she is runs the family's agricultural business which is their main source of income. They own one hectare of land, where potatoes, haricot beans and maize are grown. Harvested products are sold on the local market. Also the family owns four sheep. Shushana’s younger son works as a joiner. He produces furniture from wood. The total average income of the family is 450 Laris.

Shushana requested credit to purchase two milk cows. She will start cheese production and sell produced cheese on the local market as well. Starting the dairy business will significantly increase the family's income which they will then use to purchase additional household goods, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase two milk cows.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.en:
Francisco, 70 has been farming cacao for 20 years. Together with his wife Brigida, Francisco has raised seven children and helped bring up an innumerable number of grandchildren – literally, he couldn’t say how many there were. He lives with Brigida and their grandson Mark, who just graduated high school with a major in agriculture, and kindly helped translate in the gathering of this information. Francisco's native language is Maya Mopan. 

Francisco is in the process of transferring his profound knowledge accumulated during 20 years of farming cacao, the sole source of income for his family, to his grandson. Like many of his peers, Mark is faced with the choice between farming and scarcely available employment in town. Mark says he wants to expand the scope of Francisco's farm to introduce some fresh vegetables, and to experiment with making and applying organic fertilizer. He also hopes to utilize his experience in food processing by using the fresh veg to make products that are not available locally. 

By being able to include his grandson in the ranks of hired help to assist with cleaning and pruning this season, Francisco will invest in the farm while also making a human capital investment to provide opportunity for his grandson to explore farm-related forms of sustenance. Cleaning and pruning is a key investment when it comes to cacao as it eases access to the trees for harvesting, prevents spread of mold infestation and increases yields in the coming harvest season.

loans.use: To clean and prune 5 acres of cacao farm in preparation for the 2013 harvest season.

loans.name: Urb Nueva Tilata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “URB. NUEVA TILATA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jenny es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa y joyas, venta de gelatina guardería, venta de calzados, tienda de barrio, tejido de mantas, venta de jugo de quinua, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jenny es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ladrillos; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió con el apoyo de su amiga quien le enseño la forma de comercialización de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ladrillos por mayor) que adquirirá de las fábricas cercanas a la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada  y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la reunión de su Banca Comunal que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “URB. NUEVA TILATA” will begin its second loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Adela Regional Office. It is made up of eight members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Jenny is the secretary. The businesses that the communal bank´s members run are varied. Among them are: clothing and jewelry sales, gelatin sales, daycare, footwear sales, a neighborhood store, blanket weaving, quinoa juice sales, and grocery sales.

The loan they will take out will benefit micro-entrepreneurs, one of which is Jenny. She indicates that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for a year, joining through an invitation from one of the institution´s associates, who went to visit her at her house. Currently, she has a business selling bricks. She states that she launched this business with the support of her friend, who taught her how to sell this product.

The loan that she is taking out is for an increase in capital in order to buy wholesale bricks that she will acquire from the nearby factories in the city of El Alto, and later sell in her selling space. This work allows her to generate resources in order to support her family, since she is married and has two children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the meetings with the communal bank that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale bricks

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 49 years old and has four children. Myrna is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Myrna is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Myrna has been raising livestock for 3 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Myrna would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ann

texts.en: Ann is married with two children, after finishing secondary level of education, she was unable to continue to college due to lack of fees. Ann joined WEEC in 2004 and started her small business of selling children’s wear in Karura and Wangige Markets. Last year, she started selling belts and chains. She conducts her business door to door, in meeting places and in market places.

loans.use: She wants to boost her business by buying a bale of mixed children wear.

loans.name: Aybaniz

texts.en:
Aybaniz has a small shop where she sells clothes. She is 36, married, does not have a child, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Kalbacar region Djomerd village, settled in the Khirdalan settlement.
7 years ago she decided to start this business
For the first time she borrowed a loan of $400 and bought clohes.
For the second time she borrowed a loan of $1000 and bought jackets, raincoats.
Now she needs a loan of $1000 to expand the area of her shop.

loans.use: To expand the area of her shop

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en: Khasan is a Displaced Person from the occupied Lachin district of Azerbaijan. He fled to Baku in 1993. He started his business in 2002, and borrowed three Normicro loans from Baku branch totaling $1900. Now he is willing to borrow $1200 to increase his variety of goods.

loans.use: To increase variety of goods

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús is 46 years old and is single. He lost his job 9 years ago due to an illness, and the lack of jobs in the country made it difficult for him to find new employment. He had a lot of debts and in order to pay them he began selling ceramic figures and floral arrangements, and he had good results. He began with very little merchandise because he didn’t have much to invest. However, thanks to his liking for sales and his character, it was easy for him to relate to other people. He managed to get ahead with his business and increase his sales.

In order to continue growing his business as he has been able to up to this point, Jesús is requesting a loan of $925.00. He will use it to buy merchandise so that he can offer more variety to his clients. He is committed to paying it back in 6 months. Be an important part in Jesús’ achievements. He sincerely thanks you for your support. .

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús tiene 46 años de edad, él es soltero, hace 9 años a causa de una enfermedad perdió su trabajo y la falta de empleo que hay en el país le dificultó encontrar otro trabajo, tenia muchas deudas y para poder cubrirlas inició vendiendo figuras de cerámica y arreglos florales, pero obtuvo buenos resultados. Empezó con muy poca mercancía porque tenia poco que invertir pero gracias a su gusto por las ventas y su carácter que le facilita relacionarse con los demás ha logrado sacar adelante su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.

Para poder continuar creciendo con su negocio como hasta ahora, Jesús solicita un préstamo de $ 925 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer una mayor variedad a sus clientes, él se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en los logros de Jesús, el agradece sinceramente tu apoyo.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Mrs. Phan D. is 44 years old and lives with her husband and six children. She sells fish at an open-air market. Her husband works as a horse-cart driver (a passenger cart pulled by a horse). Together, they earn around $5 each day. Three of their children work at the garment factory and the others are students.

This loan will be used to purchase a horse to pull the passenger cart.

loans.use: Purchase a horse to pull passenger cart.

loans.name: Lupepe

texts.en:
Lupepe is a 42-year-old mother of four kids and lives with her extended family of more than ten people. She works very hard at her small business of selling chips. She knows it’s a very tough business, but she commits all her time in it because it is her only source of income.

Her first $300 USD loan was used to buy ingredients and expensive tools for making the chips. She goes around to the hospital, schools and the town area for delivering her chips. This is the hardest part of her work and also takes the most time. The business is important for supporting her children’s schooling fees, as well as for her family’s daily needs. Her next loan will be used to buy a gas oven for frying her chips more easily and for repairing the house.

loans.use: To buy  ingredients to make chips.

loans.name: Mili

texts.es:
Mrs. Mili belongs to the Communal Bank "Mujeres Activas" (Active Women). She lives in the San Martin region, the Bellavista district; her business is located in the Jr. Augusto B. Leguia Number 278, 1st floor. She sells edible products like rice, fideos, flour, milk, and more.

Thanks to the support of her husband and her family, she has been able to increase her business, which until now has grown, has more variety, a small store, and her clientele increases more every day.

With her recent loan from the Movement Manuela Ramos, for S/.3,000.00 (US$1000.00), which will be paid in 6 months, she will buy products such as oil, sodas, mineral water, and gasoline for her small store.

Mrs. Mili is 35 years old and lives with her husband, her children, and her mother. She feels very satisfied because thanks to the support of the Communal Bank, she has been able to succeed and she will not rest until she has made all her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

La señora Milí pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujeres Activas”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia y distrito de Bellavista, su negocio está ubicado en el jr: Augusto. B. Leguia Nº 278 1er piso se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles como, arroz fideos harina, leche y demás.

Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de su familia a logrado incrementar su negocio que a la fecha ha crecido, tiene más variedad y un estanquillo, su clientela va de aumento cada día mas.

Con el reciente crédito recibido de Munela Ramos de S/ 3,000.00 ($1000.00), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprará productos como, aceite en litros, gaseosas, agua mineral y gasolina para su estanquillo.

La señora Mili tiene 35 años y vive con su esposo, sus hijos y su mama, se siente muy satisfecha porque gracias al apoyo del Banco Comunal ha logrado salir adelante y no descansará hasta cumplir todos sus sueños.

loans.use:
Buying assorted products (general store)
(Compra de productos variados (bodega))

loans.name: Napsah

texts.en: Napsah is a 56-year-old woman who makes a living producing bamboo matts. Before joining MBK, her husband S. was the only one who worked. But, since joining MBK, Napsah has been able to successfully run her own bamboo matting business at her house, usually earning US$20 per month. She is now requesting a loan to help further expand the business, and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Expansion of a matt-making business

loans.name: Bacar

texts.pt:
Bacar M. lives with his wife and six children in the neighborhood of Fomento, in Matola, Mozambique. He joined the credit program in 2007 and is now on his 2nd loan cycle. He will use his second loan of $150 to invest in his wife's home business.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer.

Bacar M., portador do BI nº 100093480X, vive maritalmente tem 6 filhos entrou em 2007 tomando o valor de 3000 esta no 2º ciclo vai tomar o valor de 3000 a pagar em 6 meses com o valor vai aplicar no negocio que a sua esposa faz. na sua casa.

loans.use: To invest in his wife's home business

loans.name: Uminah

texts.en: Uminah is 49 years old and married to R., who has no steady job. Together, they have opened fresh-food stall to support their family, and they earn about $10 a day. Uminah is seeking a loan of $150 to expand this small business. She is a member of MBK, and will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand a fresh-food stall

loans.name: Paubla Francis

texts.es:
Paubla is 31 years of age and lives in the Laureles Sur neighborhood. She is married to a man who works as a security guard, and together they have 2 preschool age children. She works as a housekeeper, and with both salaries, they lead a humble life. She is requesting a loan in order to lay floor tile in their house, thus giving their children more comfort and cleanliness due to the fact that they currently have a dirt floor.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La joven Paubla de 31 años de edad vive en el Barrio Laureles Sur, es casada y su esposo trabaja como guarda de seguridad, tienen 2 hijos pequeños de edad preescolar, ella trabaja como empleada Domestica y con el salario de ambos viven de forma muy humilde. Solicita un crédito para un embaldosado en su casa y que sus hijos estén con mayor comodidad y aseo en vista que su humilde casa tiene piso de tierra.

loans.use: Lay floor tile in her home

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is married and has four children. She sells used clothing. Business is going well and she wants to increase sales.

She is asking for $525.00 as additional capital to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more used clothing to sell

loans.name: Hairullohon

texts.ru:
Hairullohon M. is 28 years old, married. He has been in the business of selling cigarettes and miscellaneous items for the past eleven years. His wife is helping him with the business after she gets off work. In the beginning, he has been selling in small quantities at random temporary locations. The necessity to increase commodity circulation has pushed him to become a client of MicroInvest. At this time Hairullohon has US$2,000 in assets and his own permanent trading location. In the future he plans to open another location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Муродов Хайруллохон- 28 лет. Женат, занимается торговлей сигаретами и разными мелочами вот уже 11 лет. Жена после работы помогает ему в торговле. Раньше торговал в малом количестве в непостоянных местах. Необходимость увеличить товарооборот подтолкнула его стать клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест». Сейчас его активы достигают 2000 $ и у него свое постоянное место деятельности. В будущем планирует приобрести еще одну точку.

loans.use: To expand trading location

loans.name: Yulit

texts.es:
For the last two years, Yulit has sold artesenal products from Piura: a friend gave her the idea of starting-up this activity. It’s as a result of this that her family, in Piura, send her the products and she sells them to her acquaintances who have made specific orders.

Yulit has also sold make-up products from the Avon catalogue for the last five months.

The loans she has asked for have allowed her to buy more artesenal products. She wants to continue importing merchandise and stocking her business with novelties.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Desde hace 2 años, Yulit vende artesanías piuranas a raíz que una amiga le dio la idea de dedicarse a esta actividad. Es así que su familia, en Piura, le manda los productos y ella los vende a sus conocidos que le hacen pedidos específicos. Igualmente, Yulit ofrece productos de maquillaje por catálogo de la marca Avon desde hace 5 meses.

Los préstamos que ha solicitado le han servido para comprar más artesanías. Ella quiere seguir trayendo más mercadería y surtir su negocio con novedades.

loans.use: To bring more artesenal products from Piura and sell them in Lima

loans.name: Koffi Jean

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Jean H. was born on December 13, 1972 in Tchékpo Dévé, a village in the Yoto prefecture in Togo. He has been living in Lomé since 1995, when he got married and opened a tailoring workshop in the Adidogomé neighborhood. His long-standing business in the neighborhood makes him a respected tailor. He has two young sons who are in school. He is requesting this first loan to purchase five rolls of pants fabric and five rolls of shirt fabric to increase his supplies and thus sell more clothing and earn greater profits.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Monsieur H. Koffi jean est né le 13 décembre 1972 à Tchékpo Dévé, un village situé dans la préfecture de Yoto au Togo. Il s’est installé à Lomé depuis 1995, s’est marié et a ouvert en cette même année un atelier de couture dans le quartier d’Adidogomé. Son ancienneté dans le quartier fait de lui un tailleur reconnu. Il a deux petit fils qui vont à l’école. Il sollicite ce premier crédit pour acheter cinq (5) rouleaux de tissus de pantalon et cinq (5) rouleaux de tissus pour chemises pour augmenter son stock afin de mieux vendre et gagner beaucoup de bénéfice.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric to make clothing

loans.name: Sanja

texts.en:
Sanja is a young woman from the town of Derventa. She is not married, and she works as an accountant with an accounting firm, where her monthly salary is approximately 500 KM.

She is now seeking this loan in the amount of 600 KM ($475) to buy materials for her work. Specifically, Sanja often brings work home with her, so she needs a new printer and some paper supplies. As such, she feels that the loan would enable her to work more productively from home and to thereby do a better job for her firm.

loans.use: To purchase a new printer and paper.

loans.name: Nary

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary N., 43, and her husband, Mr. Soeun Im, 48, live in a small village across Mekong River about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1989 and have six children; four sons and two daughters. One of their children is a garment factory workers and other five children study in the local school.

Mrs. Nary has been growing mushrooms for sixteen years. Her husband has been fishing for nineteen years. Besides growing mushrooms and fishing, the couple has been growing rice since they were married.

Nary is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, and pesticide for growing rice.

loans.name: Félix Obando

texts.es: El Sr. Félix tiene 41 años de edad, habita en el barrio Laureles Sur, es casado y le tienen tres hijos de 2,4 y 6 años de edad, su esposa es ama de casa. Don Félix trabaja como maestro de obra en una construcción, con el préstamo que esta solicitando es para infraestructura para comprar materiales para hacer un muro en la parte de enfrente y así poder darle mayor seguridad a su familia, ya que el barrio s está volviendo peligroso y su familia queda sola hasta que él vuelve por las noches.
texts.en:
Felix is 41 years old. He lives in the region of Laureles Sur. He is married and he has three children aged 2, 4, and 6 years. His wife stays home with the kids. Felix works as a construction worker. With the loan he is requesting he will purchase building materials to build a wall for the front of their house, to provide safety and security to his family. The area has become quite dangerous and his family stays at home alone until he returns from work late at night.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Ccori Soncco (“Heart of Gold” in Quechua) Village Bank. She is married and has ten children. She has a store in her house in the Enace neighborhood where she sells general dry goods, vegetables, meats, and grains with the help of her husband. She also caters meals for various occasions. 

Maura needs a loan of 2000 soles (US$325) which she will use to buy grains, sugar, pasta and oil. Maura’s dreams are for her children to grow up to be professionals, to expand her store and to equip it with all of the necessities. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco que significa Corazon de Oro en quechua. 

Maura es casada y tiene 10 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa ubicada en la Urbanización Enace en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, cereales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo. Además Maura realiza el servicio de preparación de comidas para diversos compromisos.

Maura necesita un préstamo de 2000 dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales, azúcar, fideo, aceite.

Los sueños de Maura son que sus hijos sean profesionales y ampliar, equipar su tienda con todo lo necesario.

loans.use: Buy grains, sugar, pasta and oil

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Mercedes es una persona responsable y trabajadora tiene su propio negocio de abarrotes desde hace tres años y esta solicitando este crédito para invertir en mercancía para su negocio y obtener mas clientes ya que ella le quiere brindar a su familia un futuro mas estable.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a responsible and hard-working person. She has had her own grocery business for three years and is applying for this loan to buy merchandise for the business and bring in more customers. She hopes to be able to provide a more stable future for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Graciana

texts.es: Graciana tiene 43 años, vive con sus hijos Jhon de 23 años y Rodrigo de 21. La venta de queso es el trabajo de Graciana, se ha dedicado a esta labor desde hace 8 años, en los cuales ha podido solventar los gastos de la casa y de sus hijos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede realizarlo de forma independiente y disponer de su tiempo. En un día normal Graciana empieza su jornada a las 8 de la mañana y termina a las 6 de la tarde, terminada toda la venta de quesos, es por eso que Graciana quiere incrementar su capital, pero para eso necesita nuestra ayuda. Ella se encuentra en su séptimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado comprará mayor cantidad de queso para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Graciana is 43-years-old, and lives with her sons Jhon, 23, and Rodrigo, 21. For the past eight years she has made her living selling cheese, giving her the means to support her household and children. What she likes best about her work is that she can work independently and manage her own time. A typical working day for Graciana starts at 8 in the morning and ends at 6 in the evening, after all the cheese has been sold. Graciana needs our help to raise capital for her business. This will be her seventh loan with Micofinanzas Prisma. She plans to use her loan to buy more cheese so she can increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more cheese to sell

loans.name: Fransisico Javier

texts.es:
El Señor Francisco Javier M. Balmaceda tiene la edad de 47 años, su estado civil es casado, Don Francisco tiene 2 hijos su edades son las siguientes su hijo mayor de 12 años y cursa el 5 grado de primaria y su hija de 3 años de edad que no estudia, su compañera de vida labora por cuenta propia, sus propósitos son de incrementar su negocio ya que sus preposiciones están enfocadas en el progreso de su negocio, sus deseos son de obtener otra ruta urbana para asegurar el futuro de sus hijos y de su esposa para que el día de mañana sus hijos puedan hacerse cargo del negocio y tenga la experiencia necesaria para manejar todas las situaciones que se les presenten, sus sueños son de expandirse como transportista para lograr tener mas clientela y mantener a su familia ya que este seria uno de los métodos para que el dinero ajuste para los pagos del hogar y de la familia.

La actividad económica a la que se dedica es transportista, la ubicación de su negocio es de forma ambulante, el tiempo que tiene de poseer su negocio es de 4 años, Don Francisco inicio este negocio con un vehiculo usado por lo que así fue como empezó a trabajar con este vehiculo tenia que realizar los tramite para que su vehiculo recorriera las calles con todos sus papeles en orden por lo que no fue nada fácil llevar a cabo sus propósitos Don Francisco al adquirir este vehiculo tuvo que hacer un préstamo a su familia y con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado pagar la deuda  poco a poco y agradece a Dios por tener un trabajo digno y humilde para la manutención de su familia, el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que necesita los servicio de un mecánico para arreglar ciertas partes de su vehiculo ya que en los lugares donde transita son de acceso rural por lo que es necesario el chequeo constante de este vehiculo además tiene que proporcionar la seguridad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco Javier M. Balmaceda is 47 years of age and is married. Don Francisco has two children, his oldest son is 12 years old and is in his fifth year of elementary school and his daughter is three years of age and is not yet in school. His partner in life works on her own. His goals are to increase his business now that he is focused in the progress of his business. He hopes to get another urban route to secure the future of his children and wife so that, one day, his children can be in charge of the business and will have the experience necessary to manage all of the situations that present themselves. He dreams to expand his transportation services so that he has a larger clientele and to support his family since this could be one of the ways for his income to cover the household expenses.

He is a transportation provider offering his services as a street vendor. He has had this business for 4 years. Don Francisco started this business with a used vehicle. He started using this vehicle once he had all of his papers in order and completed the process to allow his vehicle to travel throughout the streets. It has not been easy to do. To acquire this vehicle, Don Francisco had to ask his family for a loan and, with his earnings, he has been able to pay back the debt little by little. He thanks God for having decent and humble work to support his family. The loan is for business capital since he needs the services of a mechanic to repair certain parts of his vehicle. Now that he travels in rural areas it is necessary to constantly check the vehicle to ensure the safety of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 41 years old and works as a teacher in the Battambang Province. He has been teaching for 14 years and makes about USD $10 per day. His wife sells grocery products at the school campus and earns $7 each day. This couple has three children, all of whom are in school. Sen S. would like to take out a loan to build a store for his wife and to purchase more products to sell at the school.

loans.use: To build a grocery store and purchase its merchandise

loans.name: Kurusumu

texts.en:
Mambo (greetings) from Tanzania! This is Kurusumu M., a 50-year-old woman from Mwanza. She is married and has four children, who are between the ages of 16 and 28 years old. She has been running a charcoal business since 2003.

Charcoal is used by many Tanzanians as fuel to cook their daily meals. Women cook food in small coal pots by arranging mkaa (charcoal), and then adding paper, dry grass, old plastic bags, or kerosene in order to light them.

Because there is such a high demand for charcoal across the country, being a charcoal seller is quite lucrative. Kurusumu works at the business for 9 hours per day, 6 days per week, and is assisted by one employee. She currently earns about $200 USD per month from her business. She is requesting a loan of $400 USD in order to purchase more charcoal for resale. In the future, she plans to open another business. Kurusumu thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for resale

loans.name: Benter Adhiambo

texts.en: Benter Adhiambo O. is 34-year-old mother of four children, two girls and two boys, all in school. She is a shopkeeper who lives and works in Nyamasaria slum and sells “daily-need” items like sugar, soap, and flour.  Her husband is a mechanic. She is asking for 40,000 KSH to expand her stock so that she can be more appealing to a wide range of customers.

loans.use: expand her stock of staples for re-sale

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 45 years old, married and has five children. She lives in Warri, Delta state, Nigeria, where she makes a living selling medicines to the people of her community. She has been in this busines many years, and has applied for a loan to buy more medicines to sell. She offers her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a resident of San Rafael (Cabisera 17-21), Ilagan, Isabela. She is 34 years old and married to Reynaldo, a farmer. They have two children, Erwin, 16 years old, a college ,and Reymar, 5 years old, already in the primary level.

Evangeline is engaged in a sari-sari store business (a community-based store). She sells different commodities that are needed in every household and she also sells vegetables that she displays in front of her store. With her need for business capital, she decided to request a loan of PHP 10,000. She plans to purchase more groceries for her store and piglets for a hog-raising business. She dreams that someday her two children will finish their studies and have a good future. She always keep in mind these words “If others can, why can’t I?”, as her motivation to work hard for her family.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for re-sale

loans.name: Shakeela Nasir Javed Group

texts.en:
Shakeela baji is married to N. J., and they have resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Multan city is famous for its shrines. Her husband earns a living by selling clothing in the community. Shakeela baji helps him by selling clothes to their relatives.
