She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future, and to expand the shop, in addition to the quality of products provided.

loans.use: to increase her business capital to buy special gifts and household items for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: La Sra.  Elsa se dedica a la venta de bebidas y gaseosas y comida hace ya bastante tiempo, su esposo viaja a traer mercaderías de la localidad de  San Ignacio, la señora atiende su venta desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche ofrece variedad de refrescos, donde tambien tiene una rokola que le genera buenos ingresos, tiene tres hijos los cuales van al colegio del mismo barrio donde ella vive, son personas responsables las cuales trabajan hasta los domingos por el bienestar y para el futuro de sus hijos ya que su deseo es que sean profesionales, el motivo del crédito es para poder incrementar su mercadería comprando refrescos por cantidad, la Sra. Elsa se encuentra feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su negocio como en mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en: Elsa has been selling drinks, soft drinks, and food for a long time. Her husband travels to bring merchandise from the town of San Ignacio. Elsa tends to her sales from 8:00 in the morning until 11:00 at night. She has three children who go to the high school in the neighborhood where she lives. They [Elsa and her husband] are responsible people who work even on Sundays for the well being and future of their children. They would like for them to be professionals. The reason for the loan is to be able to increase her merchandise by buying soft drinks in greater volume. Elsa is happy and grateful for the opportunity she is provided to grow her business and improve the quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store (drinks)

loans.name: Kulsoom

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders ! This is Kulsoom and her team: Elvin (to her left) and Fabrice (to her right). 

Kulsoom is in charge of Juhudi Labs, an adventurous entity within Juhudi Kilimo, dedicated to discovering, testing and scaling new financial and agricultural products, services and processes. Fabrice is a marketing associate and Elvin is the Kiva Coordinator. They both work with Kulsoom on various development projects.

The 3 of them believe that success is in rallying coalitions of partners and mobilizing resources to lift smallholder farmers out of extreme poverty by broadening their access to education and financial inclusion. They are concerned that emerging challenges in Kenya such as climate change, conflict, and volatility of commodity prices threaten to erode decades of fragile gains in development we have made. It is for this reason that they have partnered with the following 3 start-up companies to make a difference:

1. Future Pump.
2. Ojay Greene
3. F3 Life

They are seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to pay for 3 video productions that will feature the business profiles for each of the 3 start-ups. The video will give the start-up ventures a great milestone in terms of material for fundraising and marketing, which is necessary for them if they are to meet their business objectives of forming strategic partnerships and creating brand awareness.

Future Pump is a company that produces a solar-powered water pump (called a Sunflower pump) for use in irrigation. The Sunflower pump is a low-cost pump intended to pump fresh water from underground reservoirs for irrigating farmland. A single pump can use solar energy to lift 13,000 litres per day, enough to irrigate an average small-scale farm.

Ojay Greene Ltd produces and aggregates fresh produce from local farmers to sell to regional urban supermarkets. The company also provides smallholder farmers with consultation services that touch on food production, marketing, and training packages to enable them to adopt sustainable agricultural techniques in order to produce high-quality produce to supply to urban supermarkets.

F3 Life provides training, on-site technical farming advice and credit to smallholder farmers to promote profitable, sustainable, and climate-resilient farming in the important watershed areas of Kenya. F3 Life’s credit facility has a ‘credit ladder’ which allows clients to build a credit history, demonstrate cash flows, and build collateral to enable them to secure loans from formal financial institutions. Further, loan terms include requirements for soil and water conservation measures to prevent soil erosion.

Your loan will help Kulsoom, Elvin and Fabrice pay for the production of professional videos about these start-ups. They shall help the ventures to utilize the videos to unlock new opportunities in education, funding, and strategic partnerships in order to scale their business and impact various areas such as:

1. Boosting Agricultural Productivity and livelihoods in Kenya
Kenya has an 82% dependency ratio. 75% of the Kenyan workforce is dependent on agriculture for a living, the majority working on small farms. There is a huge deficit in basic skills and access to finances, meaning that yields and income are far below the potential.

2. Expanding access to energy
Clean renewable energy programs that Juhudi Kilimo has rolled out have had a transformative effect on poor people’s lives. They have provided lighting, clean cooking, and phone charging. Future Pump focuses on income-generating opportunities such as irrigation. They are targeting rural smallholder farmers who live in off-the-grid zones and rely on solid fuels to meet their daily needs.

3. Improving financial inclusion
Rural smallholder farmers in Kenya have little or no access to formal financial services. They are unable to put their meager and unpredictable incomes into bank accounts and are therefore unable to save or take loans. Lack of credit keeps them from purchasing essential goods and services.

The partnership with the start-ups seeks to take full advantage of the explosion of the mobile phone market in Kenya by seizing an opportunity to use innovative, mobile-based solutions to provide inclusive, branchless financial services to rural farmers. We see mobile phones as a way of facilitating low-margin, high-volume business, as well as dramatically increasing the reach.

4. Increasing access to education
Education is the cornerstone of poverty reduction. Education leads to many other development benefits besides improving income. Education has traditionally been a responsibility of the public sector, but it is also an area where the private sector can make a difference!

Help these innovative businesses grow by supporting's Kulsoom's initiative.

loans.use: to pay for video production for companies improving rural smallholder farmers' livelihood

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with two children and all attend school. She takes care of one additional family member. She operates a boutique selling secondhand clothes. She has been in this business for the last two years. She gets additional income from rental houses. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan from MCDT – SACCO to buy materials for making African clothes. Her major challenges include high costs of transportation. Her goal is to buy a plot of land. She lives in her own house with access to piped water and electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy materials for making African clothes

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vilma is 41 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Vilma has a computer shop business in the Philippines. Vilma requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and additional unit of computer for her business.

Vilma has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and additional unit of computer for her business

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
N. Sarem has been widowed for 10 years already. She is living with her three children and running a small grocery shop in front of her house. She sells for around 50,000 Riel everyday, out of which she earns a 15,000 Riel daily profit. Her two grown daughters are also contributing to the household’s income with her factory workers salaries.

 

N. Sarem applied for a first loan of $700 because her neighbor told her about CREDIT. She would like to open a new business, selling second-hand clothes in the nearby market. She needs running capital to start the business, to purchase the clothes and to pay the daily market fee, which is 3,000 Riel. She expects 37,000 Riel daily profit ($9.25).

 

After this cycle, N. Sarem would like to invest more in her business. She would like to purchase a selling spot in the market, so that she no longer needs to rent it. The 1.5m*1.5m plot is worth $1000.

loans.use: Opening a second-hand clothing shop in the market

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en:
This hard-working person has 30 head of cattle. He has difficulty in tending a herd in the pasture because he does not have a horse. 
Having borrowed a loan of $600 he bought 8-10 sheep and goats.
Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy a horse.
He has had this business for 8 years and it allows him to support  his family.
He is 39, married, has 3 children and is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region, settled in the Finnish houses, which are built temporarily on front line in the Fizuli region.

loans.use: To buy a horse

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en:
Ernestina is a seamstress and she makes fabric hats. She is 41 years old and has two daughters, who, along with her husband, help her make the hats. This is a small family business, which is why they do not have any employees. Ernestina has been working in this business for more than 15 years. Her home and shop are located in the Llojeta-Tiwiña zone, one the western slope of the city of La Paz. She also has a stall on Isaac Tamayo Street in La Paz, where she sells hats by the dozen every morning. This is one of the city’s streets that gets a lot of traffic and is dominated by the informal sector. Her hat production is by the dozen, since she sells in bulk to her buyers, who then sell the hats individually; through her business, she indirectly generates several jobs.

This is the fifth loan Ernestina has obtained through IMPRO. Her history with our institution qualifies her as a Level 1 client, that is to say, Very Good in payment of her obligation. The amount requested will be used to buy fabric, thread, and burlap (jute) bags. Her work, experience, and the location of her stall give her the opportunity to obtain credit, which is why she is sure she will have the income to repay the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Ernestina, es costurera y elabora sombreros de tela. Tiene 41 años y dos hijas, quienes junto a su esposa le ayudan en la elaboración de los sombreros. Este es el caso de una microempresa familiar por lo cual no cuenta con empleados. Tiene experiencia en el rubro por más de 15 años. Su Vivienda y Taller están ubicados en la zona de Llojeta-Tiwiña (ladera Oeste) de la ciudad de La Paz y tiene un puesto de venta por las mañanas a precio de docena en la C/ final Isaac Tamayo de la ciudad de La Paz, calle de comercio informal muy popular en esta ciudad. Sus producción y elaboración es por docena ya que en el puesto de venta es al por mayor para que sus compradores lo puedan vender al detalle, con esta actividad genera varios empleos indirectos Es la quinta vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro, Su historial en nuestra institución la califica como cliente 1, es decir con cumplimiento Muy Bueno en el pago de su obligación. El monto solicitado será destinado para la compra de tela, forro hilo y bolsas de yute. Su trabajo, experiencia y ubicación de su puesto de venta le dan la oportunidad de obtener un crédito por lo cual le asegura los ingresos para el retorno de el crédito

loans.use: Working capital to buy materials with which to make hats

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. S., 26 years old and a mother of one child, lives with her husband in a part of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She makes her living by operating a tailoring business and makes in average about $3/day in revenue, while her husband is a staff at a local organization. In order to maximize her family's savings, S. has an idea to grow mangoes in a plantation, which she thinks it will brings huge amount of income in a period of four to five months. To do this, S. is currently requesting for a loan amount of $800 to purchase a plot of land to grow mango and a small part of money is to purchase more clothes and threads for her inventory. In the future, S. dreams of being able to have enough money to build a new house for her family and offers her children a high level of education

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land to grow fruits.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en: Aminata C. is forty yearsold and married with six children.  A hardworking woman, Aminata contributes financially toward her family's well being. She sells food staples in the town of Magburaka in Sierra Leone and was able to repay her first loan successfully.  She increased her stock by purchasing onions and wheat flour with the previous loan.  Aminata needs another loan to expand her business to increase her profit.

loans.use: Increase food staple items for selling.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en: Ana S. is 35 years old and a mother of five.  She has a vegetable garden and she sells the vegetables that she grows.  She hardly needs any help from her husband  and she does the gardening by herself.  Her  two sons eleven and thirteen year old help her out.  She is requesting a loan to buy supplies for her vegetable garden.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.en: Mr. K. is a vulnerable, low-income person. He is 35 and married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan in the Caucasus region. Ilkham owns and operates a mini shop in Saatli town. He sells spare parts, oil and other items for cars. However, his working capital is very limited and he has no opportunity to diversify his inventory. For this purpose, he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch and is waiting to receive a $500 loan.

loans.use: To increase variety in his inventory

loans.name: Estervina Severino

texts.en: Estervina is a very active businesswoman who runs a cafeteria and also sells vegetables in the public market.  She operates the cafeteria on weekends only, when demand is greatest. During the week, you can see her in a stall in the public market selling her fresh vegetables. Estervina is 50 years old and has nine children, eight of whom are boys. She plans to use her loan to buy raw materials for her cafeteria, and more vegetables to sell in the public market.  She is very confident that she use her loan well because of the experience she has acquired during many busy and arduous years of work.  She is also determined to keep working hard to improve her her own life as well as the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy materials for a cafeteria and vegetables for a small business.

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Mambo from Mwanza, Tanzania! This is 41-year-old Dorica B.. She is single with two children, ages 6 and 10, and has one other dependent who is her nephew. In 2005 Dorica established a childcare business, and now requires a loan of $450 in order to expand her daycare centre. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment—a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To expand her daycare centre in Mwanza, Tanzania.

loans.name: Sokinamoh.

texts.ru:
Sokinamoh R. lives in the town of Yavan. She is 45 years old, she is married, and has children. Sokinamoh has a high school education. She works on the market "Tijorat." She purchases goods from the city of Dushanbe and resells them on the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. This is the main source of income for her family and for that reason it is structured and functions very well. She plans to obtain the loan to increase the amount of inventory by purchasing more seasonal goods. She plans to pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova, Kiva Volunteer.

Рахимова Сокинамох Сохибназаровна проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 45 лет.замужем имеет 4детей. Образование среднее.Занимается торговлей на рынке « Тиджорат» города Яван. Привозит товар из города Душанбе и реализует со своей торговой точки. Опыт в данном бизнесе имеет около 10 лет. Эта деятельность является основным источником ее дохода, поэтому бизнес хорошо налажен. Планирует получить кредит для того чтобы увеличить товарооборот путем ввоза сезонного товара. Погасить кредит клиентка планирует в течении 10 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the amount of inventory

loans.name: Rene

texts.es:
Rene works as a driver in the public service. His route connects La Paz and El Alto. This job is his only source of income, and with it he must support his wife and two daughers, both of whom are in school. The family lives in the Tilata (en route to Viacha, in the city of El Alto).

The loan will be used to purchase school uniforms and supplies, as well as to prepay living expenses, so that his daughters can go to school without any complications.

This is the second credit for which Impro has approved this client. His prompt repayment on his first loan helped him be approved for this second loan.

Translated by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva volunteer

Rene es transportista del servicio público, su ruta esta entre las ciudades de La Paz y El Alto, dicha actividad es su única fuente de ingreso la cual cubre la manutención de su esposa y sus dos hijas que asisten a la escuela. La familia vie en la zona de Tilata (camino a Viacha en la Ciudad de El Alto).

El monto del crédito será destinado para la compra de uniforme y material escolar, a esto se suma el pago de las pensiones por adelantado. De esta manera, sus hijas podrán asistir a la escuela sin ningún contratiempo.

Este es el segundo crédito que Impro le otorga a este cliente. Su buen comportamiento de pago facilita la aprobación del préstamo a Rene.

loans.use: Investment in his daughters' education

loans.name: Norma's Group

texts.es:
Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin have been members of Banco Comunal Tambillo for 1 year. They come from the Tambillo dsitrict which is one hour from the city of Ayacucho.

Anatolia lives with her partner, is 30 years old and has 2 children. She has a small grocery shop in her home.

Then there is Norma, who is married, is 30 years old and has 2 children. Norma has a shop where she sells groceries, fruit and vegetables. She is also involved in agricultural work and in raising guinea-pigs.

Yasmin lives with her partner, is 25 years old and has 1 daughter. She sells second-hand clothes donated by her friends and family. She also sells food and toys at the Sunday market in San Juan Bautista.

Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin need this combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, vegetables, fruit, shoe polish, toothpaste, cooking pots and plates.

Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin have four dreams - to build a house, to open a shop in their house, that their business grows, and that their children become successful in their work.

Translated from [Spanish] by [Lisa Ritchie], Kiva Volunteer.

Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tambillo hace 1 año, ellas son del distrito de Tambillo que se ubica a 1 hora de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Anatolia es conviviente, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Anatolia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.

Por otro lado Norma es casada, tiene 30 años y 2 hijos, Norma tiene una tienda donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Norma se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y la agricultura.

Mientras que Yasmin es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hija, Yasmin vende ropa a pedido a personas conocidas, familiares. Además Yasmin vende comida y jugos en la feria dominical de San Juan Bautista.

Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin necesitan préstamos de 450 soles, 900 soles, 900 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, verduras, frutas, betún, crema dental, ollas, platos.

Los sueños de Anatolia, Norma y Yasmin son construir una casa, abrir una tienda en su casa, surtir su negocio y sus hijos sean profesionales.

loans.use: Anatolia, Norma and Yasmin need this combined loan of $850 to invest in the purchase of rice, oil, vegetables, fruit, shoe polish, toothpaste, cooking pots and plates.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena M. is a 60-year-old widow mother of seven children. She is a trader who trades in tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish and other goods from a tabletop in the local market. Abena says her husband died several years ago and through this business she has managed to support her seven children to finish school and enter the workforce. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more tubers, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans to increase her stock and make bigger income to put up a decent shelter.

Abena belongs to the community group called Okamafo (Deliverer) Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more yams, baskets of tomatoes, onions, bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Anita

texts.fr:
Born on October 26, 1972 in Cotonou, south of Benin, Ms. Anita I. is a hairdresser. Anita is married to a teacher and they have 6 children. Having already benefited from four loans (and repaid) from our institution, she requests a fifth loan to invest not only in headgear and braids, but also in cooking oil and various articles of clothing.

Translated from French by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Née le 26 Octobre 1972 à Cotonou au sud du BENIN et coiffeuse de profession, dame I. Anita s'est mariée à un instituteur avec qui elle a eu 6 enfants. Ayant déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits auprès de notre l'institution qu'elle a bien remboursé, elle sollicite un cinquième crédit pour investir non seulement dans la coiffure et la tresse, mais aussi dans la commercialisation d'huile alimentaire et d'articles vestimentaires.

loans.use: To buy 15 cans of 10 L cooking oil, 50 sets of wavy hair, 10 sets of natural hair, 5 cartons of shampoo, 2 bales of skirts and blouses

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa works selling magazines. She rents a space in a downtown area in the city of Huancayo where it is very convenient for her to sell her magazines. She has been 35 years in this business, and hence knows very well what her clients buy and thus knows what magazines to buy. Rosa lives with her two children, and they help her organizing the magazines. Rosa has noticed that taste changes with time, and that the classical magazines no longer sell well with the newer clients. That is why Rosa would like to buy a set of new and varied magazines, and she is asking for a loan with the promise to repay it responsibly and on time. Rosa considers that when a person offers a lending hand to others, that person deserves her utmost respect.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha, Kiva volunteer.

Rosa es una mujer de mucha trayectoria en el ámbito de las ventas de revistas, ella arrienda un espacio en una zona céntrica de la ciudad de Huancayo donde puede ofrecer sus revistas con mucha comodidad. Ella lleva 35 años en este negocio, por ello que conoce muy bien el gusto de sus clientes y sabe cuales revistas traer y cuales no. Rosa vive con sus dos hijos, los que le colaboran mucho con su trabajo y le ayudan a organizar sus revistas. Rosa se ha dado cuenta que los gustos van cambiado según el paso de los años, y las revistas clásicas, muchas veces ya no satisfacen el gusto de nuevos clientes.Por ello Rosa desea adquirir un lote con novedosas y variadas revistas, y solicita este préstamo con la promesa de pagar puntual y responsablemente. Ya que ella considera que cuando una persona le tiende la mano a otra, merece todo su respeto.

loans.use: To buy a new set of magazines to sell them in her business.

loans.name: Berlyn Beatriz

texts.es:
Berlyn is dedicated to the sale of cosmetics on foot and also in her home. She is married. Her husband drives a taxi. The car is belongs to them both. They both work very hard to support their son of 14 years. For 6 years Berlyn has been dedicated to the sale of cosmetics to her neighbors in the Villa Reconciliación neighborhood of the city of Managua. She started this business with her own capital and the help of her husband, but had to request loans from AFODENIC because her initial investment was very small and she needed more inventory. Like the previous loans, this loan will be used to invest in her business, buying perfumes of the AVON brand to offer to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Berlyn se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de forma ambulante y también lo hace en su casa de habitación, es casada, su esposo es taxi, el vehículo es propiedad de la pareja. Ambos se esfuerzan mucho para sacar adelante a su hijo de 14 años. Desde hace 6 años Berlyn se dedica a la venta de cosméticos a sus vecinos del Barrio Villa Reconciliación de la ciudad de Managua, empezó este negocio con capital propio y ayuda de su esposo, tuvo que requerir de créditos a AFODENIC, ya que su inversión inicial era muy poco y ella necesitaba tener más inventario, al igual que los anteriores este crédito será usado en inversión para su negocio, comprará perfumes de la marca AVON para ofertarlos a sus clientes

loans.use: To buy AVON perfums to sell to her clients.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina runs a small business selling denim clothing for women. She is married with two grown daughters. In 2007, Valentina was faced with tough circumstances; she was diagnosed with cancer. Her husband left the family, and she had to fight the disease herself. However, she didn't get desperate. She decided to trust God with her life. Today her family circumstances have stabilized. Valentina's husband returned to the family. Her daughters got settled in life. Today Valentina has about $2,000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. She is making about $400 in profit each month.

Valentina has been in the clothing business for over 10 years and has partnered with Nadiya Ukraine for 7 years. Her diligent, hard work has helped her succeed in business and maintain a loyal clientele. Currently, Valentina has two vending locations. Valentina would like to receive a loan for 5000 Grivnas to serve as working capital in her business. Financial assistance will help her purchase an assortment of denim wear. High-quality, durable, and comfortable merchandise will sell well and will help Valentina's business grow, especially this fall season.

loans.use: To increase stock before the fall season

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Angela L., tiene 53 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno es a quien ella ayuda en sus estudios actualemnte ya que los otros dos se mantienen por su propia cuenta. La actividad economica de ella es la venta de ropa nueva actividad que desarrolla por encargo, teniendo mas de 15 años de dedicarse, cabe señalar que este seria su segundo credito con el programa KIVA,. Doña Angela da inico en los creditos como toda perosna con deseos de superacion y la ncesidad de obtener un poco mas de ingresos incrementadno su capital de trabajo inicial, ella continua con su sueño de poder incrementar su negocio y darle un giro mas adelante de instalsr una pequeña tienda. Por lo que desea contar contar siempre con el apoyo de nuestra institucion que lepermita ir desarrollandose economivamente e ir logrando sus metas propuestas, solicitando nuevamente para capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Angela L., 53, is married and has three children, one of whom she still helps with schooling. The other two children are self-supporting. Angela makes a living selling new clothes, work that she learned by doing, having more than 15 years experience now. It should be noted that this loan would be Angela's second with KIVA. She started like everyone with the hope of getting ahead and a need for a little more income. By increasing her working capital, she's continued toward her dream of growing her business and moving a step closer to setting up a small shop. She's counted on our institution's support for what she's needed to develop her business and fulfill her goals which is why she's again asking for working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 21 años es  soltera, natural de la ciudad de Lima vive sola en un cuarto que alquilo. Delia al migrar de la capital hace dos años decidió dedicarse a la elaboración y venta de chompas de lana, ya que siempre le gusto tejer y es lo que mejor sabe hacer. Delia vende Chompas por pedidos los cuales vende en la ciudad de Juliaca los días de feria y  también lleva a la ciudad de Cuzco. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es el tiempo que le demora tejer las chompas ya que los pedidos son abundantes y a veces ella no se abastece en terminar todos los pedidos. Es su primer préstamo en microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero que Delia esta solicitando quiere comprar algunos repuestos de su máquina para hacerla trabajar al máximo y también  comprar material en lana, hilos, etc.
texts.en:
Delia is 21 years old and single. She is from Lima and she lives alone in a rented room. Delia left the capital two years ago and decided to start a business making and selling wool sweaters. She's always liked to weave and she knows how to do it well. Delia sells sweaters by request, and also on market days in the cities of Juliaca and Cuzco. The most difficult part of her job is that it takes a long time to sew the sweaters and sometimes she isn't able to fill all of her orders. This is Delia's first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She'll use the money to buy some replacement parts for her loom so that it can work at maximum efficiency. She'll also buy materials like wool, thread, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy replacement parts for her loom

loans.name: Doung

texts.en:
Doung V., 46, is married and lives with four of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She and her husband are farmers and make US$2 each day. The family is also supported by two of the children who work in the local garment factories.

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have made it a difficult economic year for many Cambodians. In light of these challenging times, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to breed pigs for extra profit. She sees this new business as a good economic investment and will use it to increase her income and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To breed pigs.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
Carmen Rosa   es socia del Banco Comunal el Triunfo. 
Carmen Rosa es casada, tiene  49 años y cuatro hijos  de 27, 22,18 y 12 años,  el menor de sus hijos todavía está en la escuela y otro de sus hijos está en estudios superiores.
Carmen Rosa tiene su negocio hace ya treinta años, vende productos de belleza de todas las marcas, les ofrece a sus amigos y familiares, ella invierte paga y saca mas mercadería para su stock.También va a comenzar a vender ahora en el tiempo de verano raspadillas y cremoladas.
Desde hace diez años recibe los préstamos ha podido  invertir mas y es una gran ayuda.

Carmen Rosa  necesita  un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo y en la compra de una máquina para moler hielo para la venta de raspadilla y cremoladas.
Carmen Rosa  sueña con  tener su propio negocio y trabajar con su familia, también ampliar el taller de cerrajería de su esposo.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the village bank el Triunfo. She is married, 49 years old and has four children aged 27, 22, 18 and 12. The youngest of her children is still in school while the others are pursuing continued studies. Carmen Rosa has been in business for thirty years selling beauty products of all brands. She sells to family and friends and uses her earnings to increase her stock. Now that it is summertime sh ealso plans to start selling snow cones (crushed ice with syrup on top). She has recieved loans for the past ten years which has allowed her to invest more money and has been a great help. Carmen Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles (325 dollars) which will be spent buying more beauty products and a machine to crush ice for snow cones. She dreams of having her own business and working with her family, and also of improving her husband's locksmith shop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Martyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing beauty products

loans.name: Lek

texts.en: Lek S., 32, lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She stays at home doing housework and helping her husband making drums. Her husband, Tum Thyni, 30, pictured here, is a true entrepreneur who has had a business making drums since 2005. On average, he makes and sells about 5 to 7 drums at the market every day to earn approximately US$ 7.50. The drums are made from palm trees. This couple has three children and all of them are students. Mrs. Lek S. is asking for a loan to purchase palm trees to use to make drums.

loans.use: To purchase palm trees to use to make drums

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mrs. Vith P. is a villager in Tonle village in Takeo province. She is a grocer who owns a small grocery store. Her husband, Mr. Phang Phat, is a construction worker. Since his workplace is far from the house, he usually has to pay a lot of money for a motor taxi to get to work. Thus, Mrs. Vith P. decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorcycle for her husband to go to work. She hopes to reduce the transportation expenses. She is 38 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. Her husband is with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi F. est une femme de 35 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle est  revendeuse de céréales et de légumes au marché d’Atakpamé. Pour augmenter la taille de son activité, Akou désire avec ce crédit acheter plus de marchandises pour la revente. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter ses ventes et par conséquent ses profits.
texts.en:
Akouvi F. is a 35-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four. She sells grain and vegetables at the Atakpamé marketplace. To expand her business, Akou would like to use this loan to buy more merchandise for resale. This will enable her to increase her sales and consequently her profits.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for resale

loans.name: Fadhil

texts.en: Fadhil R. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur business man.  He runs a business to provide transport services at Chanika, in Dar es Salaam.  He owns a taxi and receives 30,000 Tshs per day, equivalent to four hundred thousand Tshs per month.  He has been in the business for three years and plans to extent his services by buying more taxis.   He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to extent his business.

loans.use: Expand taxi business.

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.ru: Исматов Исмоил проживает в районе Гиссара. Возраст 50 лет, женат и имеет восьмерых детей. Исмоил более 20 лет занимается торговлей. Он имеет торговую точку на рынке, где торгует коврами. Работает вместе со своими старшими детьми. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и расширить ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Ismoil I. lives in the Gissar area. He is 50 years old, is married and has eight children. He works in a store. He has a food store. Ismoil works there together with his older children. He plans to receive credit in order to increase his turnover and expand his product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover
